name: Giant Marsh Worm
text:
Forced: Remove 2 damage from Giant Marsh Worm at the end of each round.

Escape: 2

name: Impassable Bog
text:
When Revealed: Place 1 resource token on Gollum for each location card in the staging area.

Escape: 2
link: The card is not considered to be in the staging area while the When Revealed effect is being resolved, it is placed afterwards.The active location is not in the staging area.

name: The Heart of the Marshes
text:
While The Heart of the Marshes is the active location, all cards dealt from the encounter deck for escape tests get +1 Escape. (Cards receive this bonus even if they do not have a printed escape value.)

Escape: 1

name: Fens and Mires
text:
Forced: After the players travel to this location, place 1 resource token on Gollum.

Escape: 2

name: Dáin Ironfoot
text: While Dain Ironfoot is ready, Dwarf characters get +1 Û and +1 Ò.
link: If he exhausts himself to attack or quest, the bonus would be lost unless some other effect could be used to ready him, such as Unexpected courage.

name: Dúnedain Signal
text:
Attached hero gains sentinel.

Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dunedain Signal to another hero.

name: Dawn Take You All
text:
Play after shadow cards have been dealt, before any attacks have resolved.

Combat Action: Each player may choose and discard 1 facedown shadow card from an enemy with which he is engaged.
link: The discarded shadow card is removed and never checked for effects.  This means that Wargs (CORE 85) does trigger his Forced event.

name: Eagles of the Misty Mountains
text:
Eagles of the Misty Mountains cannot have restricted attachments. Eagles of the Misty Mountains gets +1 Û and +1 Ú for each facedown attachment it has.

Response: After another Eagle character leaves play, you may attach that card facedown to Eagles of the Misty Mountains.

name: Support of the Eagles
text: Action: Exhaust Support of the Eagles to choose an Eagle ally. Until the end of the phase, attached hero adds that ally's Û or Ú (choose 1) to its own.
link: Action: Chosen hero does not need to be ready nor is it exhausted.

name: West Road Traveller
text: Response: After you play West Road Traveller from your hand, switch the active location with any other location in the staging area.
link: Response: this is optional like all responses.  The switch may only occur if there is an active location and at least one location in the staging area. This response can only be triggered if you play the Traveller from your hand, it does not trigger if the Traveller is put into play through some other mechanism that 'puts into play'.

name: Astonishing Speed
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all Rohan characters get +2 Ò.

name: Mirkwood Runner
text: While Mirkwood Runner is attacking alone, the defending enemy does not count its Ú.

name: Rumour from the Earth
text: Action: Look at the top card of the encounter deck. Then, you may pay 1 Î resource to return Rumour from the Earth to your hand.
link: Even though the cost is 0, you must still have a Lore Hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

name: Shadow of the Past
text: Action: Move the top card of the encounter discard pile to the top of the encounter deck.

name: Through the Forest
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for Gollum. Choose a player to guard Gollum at the start of the game, and place Gollum in front of that player. Then shuffle the encounter deck. Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck, and add it to the staging area.

name: Escape Attempt
text:
The player guarding Gollum cannot commit characters to this quest (unless he is the only player remaining in the game).

If the players quest unsuccessfully, Gollum escapes and the players have lost the game.

name: To the Elvin King's Halls
text: The player guarding Gollum cannot play cards from his hand.

name: Ambush
text:
Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, all enemies in play engage the player guarding Gollum.

Players cannot defeat this stage if there are any enemies in play. If players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Gollum
text:
Damage from undefended attacks against you must be dealt to Gollum. If Gollum is destroyed, or if the player guarding Gollum is eliminated, the players have lost the game.

Forced: At the end of each round, raise the threat of the player guarding Gollum by 3. Then, that player may choose a new player to guard Gollum.
link:
Gollum cannot be used to attack, defend, or commit to a quest. Otherwise, Gollum is considered an ally character under the control of the player guarding him. Card effects that affect allies do affect him, and any attachment that can be played on an ally can be played on Gollum. Forced: threat is raised by an additional 3 on top of the usual 1.

Cards that can take damage from undefended attacks (such as Barliman Butterbur) do not override the 'must' effect on this card. (official answer)

name: The Spider's Ring
text: While The Spider's Ring is the active location, the player guarding Gollum cannot change.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, return any current active location to the staging area. The Spider's Ring becomes the active location.
link: From the FAQ: Cannot overrides anything else (i.e. Wasted Provisions)

name: Dry Watercourse
text: While Dry Watercourse is the active location, all treachery card effects that target the player guarding Gollum also target each other player.

name: Woodman's Glade
text:
Travel: The player guarding Gollum must exhaust a hero he controls to travel to Woodman's Glade.

Response: After exploring Woodman's Glade, reduce the threat of each player not guarding Gollum by 2.

name: Wood Elf Path
text: Response: After the players travel to Wood Elf Path, the player guarding Gollum may choose a new player to guard him.

name: Gollum's Anguish
text: When Revealed: Raise the threat of the player guarding Gollum by 8. That player must choose a new player to guard Gollum, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Raise the threat of the player guarding Gollum by 4.

name: Gollum's Bite
text: When Revealed: Deal 4 damage to a hero controlled by the player guarding Gollum. That player must choose a new player to guard Gollum, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to a hero controlled by the player guarding Gollum.

name: Wasted Provisions
text: When Revealed: Discard the top 10 cards from the deck of the player guarding Gollum. That player must choose a new player to guard Gollum, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Discard the top 5 cards from the deck of the player guarding Gollum.

name: Mirkwood Bats
text: Forced: After Mirkwood Bats engages a player, deal 1 damage to each character controlled by the player guarding Gollum.

name: Attercop, Attercop
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, Attercop, Attercop automatically engages the player guarding Gollum, regardless of his threat.

name: Dwalin
text: Response: After Dwalin attacks and destroys an Orc enemy, lower your threat by 2.

name: Bifur
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from a hero's resource pool to add 1 resource to Bifur's resource pool. Any player may trigger this ability. (Limit once per round.)

name: Narvi's Belt
text: Action: Exhaust Narvi's Belt to give attached hero a Ì, Î, Ï, or Ê icon until the end of the phase.
link:
Note that this does not grant an extra resource token, it means all resource tokens in the Hero's resource pool are temporarily two types: the Hero's original sphere and the new one you choose.  The Hero also temporarily becomes a "X Hero" for game purposes, where X is the sphere you chose.

Errata: Should read: “Action: Exhaust Narvi’s Belt to give attached hero a [Lore], [Leadership], [Spirit], or [Tactics] icon until the end of the
phase.”

name: Durin's Song
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf hero. That hero gets +2 Ò, +2 Û, and +2 Ú until the end of the round.

name: Ever Onward
text: Response: After players quest unsuccessfully, choose a player. That player does not raise his threat.

name: Veteran of Nanduhirion
text: Veteran of Nanduhirion enters play with 1 damage on it.

name: Dwarrowdelf Axe
keywords: Attach to a Dwarf character. Restricted.
text:
Attached character gets +1 Û.

Response: After attached character attacks, deal 1 damage to the defending enemy.
link: Jury is out whether this point of damage is assigned as soon as character is declared as attacker or later.

name: Khazâd! Khazâd!
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf character. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +3 Û.
link: Even though the cost is 0, you must still have a Tactics Hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

name: Zigil Miner
text: Action: Exhaust Zigil Miner and name a number to discard the top 2 cards of your deck. If at least one of those cards has cost equal to the named number, choose a hero you control. For each card that matches the named number, add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.
link:
Should read: "Action: Exhaust Zigil Miner and name a number to discard the top 2 cards of your deck. If at least one of those cards has cost equal to the named number, choose a hero you control. For each card that matches the named number, add 1 resource to that hero’s resource pool."
Action: Cards with a cost of X have a cost of 0 for this purpose.

name: Untroubled by Darkness
text: Action: Each Dwarf character gets +1 Ò until the end of the phase. (+2 Ò instead if the active location is an Underground or Dark location.)

name: Erebor Record Keeper
text:
Erebor Record Keeper cannot attack or defend.

Action: Exhaust Erebor Record Keeper and pay 1 Î resource to choose and ready a Dwarf character.

name: Ancestral Knowledge
text: Action: Exhaust a Dwarf character to place 2 progress tokens on the active location. (4 progress tokens instead if it is an Underground or Mountain location.)
link: These progress tokens may never be placed on a Quest card.

name: Boots from Erebor
keywords: Attach to a Dwarf or Hobbit character.
text:
Limit 1 Boots from Erebor per character.

Attached character gets +1 hit point.

name: Patrol Leader
text: Forced: Before Patrol Leader is dealt damage, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is an enemy, cancel that damage.
shadow: Shadow: Cancel all damage dealt to this enemy.
link: Each time he would be dealt damage, check the top card of the encounter deck. Remember in a normal attack the damage from all attackers is applied all at once, but sometimes damage might occur separately from the main battle (e.g. Dwarrowdelf Axe (D 7)). General consensus on Infighting is divided.

name: Signs of Conflict
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 2.

name: East-gate
text:
Players cannot optionally engage enemies and no engagement checks are made.

Forced: After East-gate leaves play as an explored location, add First Hall to the staging area.
link: The only way to place progress tokens on it is by questing, and once East-gate is the active location it remains the active location until it is fully explored (even cards like Dreadful Gap (D 52) or Strider's Path (SOM 9) would not be able to move it to the staging area). No regular engagement checks are made, but card effects could still cause enemies to engage players.

name: First Hall
text:
Travel: Each player must raise his threat by 3 to travel here.

Forced: After First Hall leaves play as an explored location, add Bridge of Khazad-dum to the staging area.

name: Bridge of Khazad-dûm
text: While Bridge of Khazad-dûm is the active location, players cannot play cards.

name: Stairs of Náin
text: Travel: The first player must exhaust 1 character he controls to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player must choose and exhaust 1 character he controls.

name: Cave-troll
text: For each excess point of combat damage dealt by Cave-troll (damage that is dealt beyond the remaining hit points of the character damaged by its attack) you must damage another character you control.
link: If a second character runs out of remaining hit points, continue applying to a third character, etc.

name: Orc Horn Blower
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Hidden Threat
text: When Revealed: Each player must raise his threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area. Then, the last player discards an attachment he controls.
link: The last player is the player sitting directly to the right of the first player. If there is only one player, that player is both the first and last player.

name: Book of Mazarbul
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective. Then, attach Book of Mazarbul to that hero. (If detached, return Book of Mazarbul to the staging area.)

Attached hero cannot attack and does not exhaust to commit to a quest.
link: If detached from a Hero, either through a card effect or due to the hero it is attached to leaving play, then it returns to the staging area, and can be claimed by any player who triggers its action. A hero can also exhaust to claim Book of Mazarbul even if it is attached to another hero. If this card is removed from the game, it should be set aside and ignored for the rest of the game (not placed in the discard pile). Attached hero must be ready to commit to a quest, but doesn't exhaust when doing so.

name: The Nameless Fear
text:
The Nameless Fear cannot engage or be engaged.

X is the number of victory points in the victory display.
link: Cannot be selected as the target of any card effect and ignores the effect of any player card that would directly interact with it even if the card doesn't directly target The Nameless Fear. The value "X" is a constant variable that is immediately recalculated whenever victory points are added or removed from the players' victory display.

name: New Devilry
text: When Revealed: If the players are not on stage 1, shuffle the current quest card into the quest deck, then reveal a new quest card. Otherwise, New Devilry gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, raise your threat by The Nameless Fear's $.
link: Will not cause the flipping of the newly revealed quest card. Do not flip the newly revealed quest card until any conditions specified for flipping it are met. If no such conditions are on Side A of this newly revealed quest card, then flip it to Side B as normal.

name: Shadow of Fear
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Shadow of Fear to one of his heroes. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero cannot exhaust or ready and its text box is treated as if it were blank. Action: Pay 3 resources from attached hero's pool to discard this card.")

name: A Foe Beyond
text: When Revealed: The last player deals damage equal to The Nameless Fear's attack to a hero he controls. This effect cannot be canceled.
shadow: Shadow: Deal damage equal to The Nameless Fear's Û to the defending character.

name: Abandoned Tools
text: Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective if it has no encounters attached. Then, attach Abandoned Tools to that hero. (If detached, return Abandoned Tools to the staging area.)

name: Chieftain of the Pit
text: When Revealed: Chieftain of the Pit gets +3 Û until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy attacks again after this attack. Deal it another shadow card for the next attack.

name: Goblin Spearman
text: Goblin Spearman gets +2 Û if its attack is undefended.
shadow: Shadow: Add Goblin Spearman to the staging area.

name: Goblin Archer
keywords: Players cannot optionally engage Goblin Archer.
text:
Characters with ranged are eligible to attack Goblin Archer while it is in the staging area.

Forced: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, the first player must deal 1 damage to 1 character he controls.

name: Undisturbed Bones
text: When Revealed: Each player must deal X damage to 1 ally he controls. X is the number of allies he controls.
shadow: Shadow: If the defending character is an ally, discard it from play.

name: Plundered Armoury
text:
While Plundered Armoury is in the staging area, enemies get +1 Û.

Response: After Plundered Armoury leaves play as an explored location, each player may attach a Weapon or Armour attachment from his hand to 1 character he controls.

name: Goblin Follower
text: When Revealed: Goblin Follower engages the last player.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if attacking the last player.)
link: Goblin Follower doesn't immediately attack, instead he attacks during the regular combat phase. Goblin Follower remains engaged with that player until destroyed or some other effect causes a disengagement. Solo: the player is both the first and last player.

name: Branching Paths
text:
While Branching Paths is in the staging area, each Dark location gets +1 $.

Forced: After Branching Paths leaves play as an explored location, look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Players must choose 1 of those to reveal and add to the staging area, moving the other 2 to the bottom of the deck.
link: +1 Threat applies to Branching Paths as well.If Goblin Patrol (KD 65) is in play, and the revealed encounter card is an Enemy, it would discarded.

name: Lightless Passage
text: Travel: Players must exhaust a Cave Torch to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Cancel all combat damage dealt to attacking enemy.
link: When you determine combat damage to the enemy later during combat, you cancel that damage instead of applying it.

name: Zigil Mineshaft
text: Action: Raise each player's threat by 1 to place 1 progress token on Zigil Mineshaft.
link: Actions on encounter cards can be triggered by any player, following normal restrictions on triggering abilities.

name: Many Roads
text: When Revealed: Shuffle all locations in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

name: Burning Low
text: When Revealed: Each enemy and location currently in the staging area gets +1 $ until the end of the phase. (+3 $ instead if it is a Dark location.) Players may exhaust a Cave Torch to cancel this effect.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +2 Û.

name: Cave Torch
text:
Action: Exhaust Cave Torch to place up to 3 progress tokens on a Dark location.

Forced: After Cave Torch exhausts, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an enemy, add it to the staging area.
link:
If this card would leave play, either through a card effect or the Hero it is attached to leaving play, then it is removed from the game (set aside and ignored for the rest of the game, not placed in the discard pile).

With timing conflicts (Branching Paths) general consensus is that Cave Torch's effect goes first, then the location's progress token effect.

There does not need to be an active Dark location to use Cave Torch's forced effect, it can be used on locations in the staging area.

name: Great Cave-troll
text: No attachments can be played on Great Cave-troll.
link: A character making a ranged attack will not damage this enemy, however a character with the ranged keyword making a normal attack can damage him normally.

name: Orc Drummer
text: While Orc Drummer is in the staging area, each enemy gets +X $. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Stray Goblin
text: X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +X Û. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Chance Encounter
text: When Revealed: Put the top enemy in the encounter discard pile into play, engaged with the first player. If this effect put no enemies into play, Chance Encounter gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+3 Û instead if engaged with the first player.)
link: Enemies are not 'revealed' with this treachery so no 'when revealed' effects come into play (including Thalin's ability). It does engage the player so if there are any forced effects on engagement then these are triggered.

name: Massing in the Deep
text: When Revealed: Reveal X additional cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +X Û. X is the number of players in the game.

name: The Mountains' Roots
text: X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +X Û. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Cave In
text: When Revealed: Remove all progress tokens from the current quest card and active location. If Cave In removed no progress tokens, it gains surge.

name: Crumbling Ruin
text: When Revealed: Each player must exhaust a character and discard the top card of his deck, if able. If the printed cost of the discarded card is equal to or higher than the remaining hit points of the exhausted character, discard the exhausted character.
link: Official Response (Nate) Since the two effects are linked by "and" rather than "then," there is no dependency relationship between them. If you can exhaust and not discard, you exhaust; if you can discard and not exhaust, you discard. In either case, no character is discarded: first because a card with higher cost than hit points was not discarded from the deck, second because there was no character to discard in the first place.

name: Dark and Dreadful
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character. (2 damage instead if the active location is a Dark location.)
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character. (Attacking enemy gets +2 Û instead if this attack is undefended.)

name: Sudden Pitfall
text: When Revealed: The first player must discard 1 questing character he controls, if able. This effect cannot be canceled.
shadow: Shadow: Discard the defending character from play.

name: Dreadful Gap
text:
When Revealed: Immediately travel to Dreadful Gap. If another location is currently active, return it to the staging area.

X is the number of characters in play.

name: Fouled Well
text: When Revealed: Each player may choose and discard 1 card at random from his hand. If all players did not discard 1 card, Fouled Well gains surge.

name: Black Uruks
text: When Revealed: The first player must choose and discard an attachment from a questing character, if able.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, deal 2 additional shadow cards to attacking enemy.
link:
The effect of Black Uruks does not count as a cost, so its effect can apply to any character. Even if the first player had committed no characters to the quest, he won't get off scot-free: he would still have to discard an attachment from one of the other players' characters.

Black Uruks can remove tentacle attachments. Thematically this means that they are trying to capture the character and are cutting it free. (Nate)

name: Mountain Warg
text: If Mountain Warg is dealt a shadow card with no effect, return Mountain Warg to the staging area after it attacks.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if a Mountain is the active location.)
link: If Mountain Warg is dealt a shadow card with an effect, but that effect is canceled for whatever reason, he was still dealt a shadow card with an effect and would not return to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Bitter Wind
text: When Revealed: The first player must discard 3 resources from each hero he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player must discard 2 resources from each hero he controls.
link: If a Hero doesn't have enough resources to discard, you must discard as many as you can from that Hero.

name: Knees of the Mountain
text: While Knees of the Mountain is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After an enemy engages a player, it gets +1 Û until the end of the round."

name: Turbulent Waters
text: While Turbulent Waters is the active location, players cannot optionally engage enemies.

name: Warg Lair
text:
When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Mountain Warg and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Response: After Warg Lair leaves play as an explored location, each player draws 1 card.

name: Goblin Scout
text: Each player with a threat of 25 or higher cannot optionally engage Goblin Scout.

name: Goblin Swordsman
text: Goblin Swordsman gets +2 Û if its attack is undefended.
shadow: Shadow: Add Goblin Swordsman to the staging area.

name: Watchful Eyes
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Watchful Eyes to one of his heroes. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Forced: If attached hero is exhausted at the end of the combat phase, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.")

name: Goblin Tunnels
text: While Goblin Tunnels is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After a Goblin is revealed from the encounter deck, remove a progress token from the current quest card."
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+3 Û instead if attacking enemy is a Goblin.)

name: Goblin Patrol
text:
When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy of his choice, and add it to the staging area. One choice must be Patrol Leader, if able.

Forced: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, discard it instead of adding it to the staging area.

If there are no enemies in play, immediately advance to the next stage of the scenario. (Players can also advance by placing 11 progress tokens on Goblin Patrol.)

name: Search for an Exit
text:
When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player, and add it to the staging area.

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
link:
Forced: does not apply to enemies that are dealt as shadow cards.
You can advance to the next quest stage even if there is an active location.

name: Entering the Mines
text:
When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player, and add it to the staging area.

Players cannot advance to the next stage of the scenario unless Bridge of Khazad-dum is in their victory display.

name: Search for the Chamber
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player, and add it to the staging area.

name: The Fate of Balin
text:
When Revealed: Remove Book of Mazarbul from the game.

Forced: At the end of the staging step, reveal the top X cards of the encounter deck, adding all enemies to the staging area. Discard the other revealed cards without resolving them. X is the number of players.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: A Way Up
text:
Heroes do not collect resources during the resource phase.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.
link: When preparing the quest deck, shuffle all stage 2 quest cards with side 2A face-up and place them beneath stage 1.  Players will progress through stage 2 quest cards until they have won the game.

name: Search for an Exit
text:
When Revealed: The first player chooses 1 of the following:
• Each player discards 1 card from the top of the encounter deck. If the card is a treachery card, the discarding player is eliminated from the game.
• Reveals the next quest card, putting Blocked by Shadow on the bottom of the quest deck.

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase. If the players defeat this stage, they escape and win the game.
link: The only time you immediately flip this to side 2B is through card effects, e.g. Hasty Council (D 74).  If you choose to bypass this quest card, remove all progress tokens and move it to the bottom of the quest deck with side 2B face-down.

name: Search for an Exit
text:
Abandoned Tools gains: "Refresh Action: Exhaust attached hero to put a progress token on Escape from Darkness."

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.

Progress tokens cannot be placed on Escape from Darkness except by Abandoned Tools. If the players defeat this stage, they escape and win the game.

name: A Presence in the Dark
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player, and add it to the staging area. Then, add A Presence in the Dark to your victory display.
link: The only time you immediately flip this to side 2B is through card effects, e.g. Hasty Council (D 74).  If you choose to bypass this quest card, remove all progress tokens and move it to the bottom of the quest deck with side 2B face-down.

name: Search for an Exit
text:
When Revealed: Each player chooses 1 questing character he controls. Each questing character not chosen does not count its Ò until the end of the turn.

Forced: After placing the 1st progress token on Narrow Paths, search the encounter deck and discard pile for Abandoned Tools and add it to the staging area, if able.

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
link: The only time you immediately flip this to side 2B is through card effects, e.g. Hasty Council (D 74).  If you choose to bypass this quest card, remove all progress tokens and move it to the bottom of the quest deck with side 2B face-down.

name: Search for an Exit
text:
Forced: If Heading Down is in the player's victory display at the end of any quest phase, shuffle Heading Down back into the quest deck.

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
link:
The only time you immediately flip this to side 2B is through card effects, e.g. Hasty Council (D 74).  If you choose to bypass this quest card, remove all progress tokens and move it to the bottom of the quest deck with side 2B face-down.

The Reveal clause in this doesn't mean you activate the When Revealed effects of both quest cards should they have them. (General consensus at BGG, no official answer yet from FFG Feb 2013)

name: Search for an Exit
text: When Revealed: Shuffle all copies of A Foe Beyond from the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck. Reveal the top 2 cards of the quest deck. Choose 1 to become the active quest (flipped to side 2B) and put the other on the bottom of the quest deck. Then, add Hasty Council to your victory display.
link: The only time you immediately flip this to side 2B is through card effects, e.g. Hasty Council (D 74).  If you choose to bypass this quest card, remove all progress tokens and move it to the bottom of the quest deck with side 2B face-down.

name: Search for an Exit
text:
Forced: If Heading Up is in the player's victory display at the end of any quest phase, shuffle Heading Up back into the quest deck.

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
link:
The only time you immediately flip this to side 2B is through card effects, e.g. Hasty Council (D 74).  If you choose to bypass this quest card, remove all progress tokens and move it to the bottom of the quest deck with side 2B face-down.

The addition to Abandoned Tools does NOT allow you to bypass an active location to put progress tokens directly on Escape from Darkness (official ruling from Nate).

name: Elrohir
text:
While Elladan is in play, Elrohir gets +2 Ú.

Response: After Elrohir is declared as a defender, pay 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

name: Taking Initiative
text: Action: Discard the top card of your deck. If the discarded card's printed cost is equal to or higher than the number of characters you control, draw 2 cards and deal 2 damage to any enemy.
link: Even though the cost is 0, you still must have a Leadership hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

name: Timely Aid
text: Action: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck and put 1 revealed ally into play, if able. Shuffle all other revealed cards back into your deck.

name: Unseen Strike
text: Action: Choose a character you control. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +3 Û while attacking an enemy with a higher engagement cost than your threat.
link: Even though the cost is 0, you still must have a Tactics hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

name: Keeping Count
keywords: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero.
text:
Attached hero gets +1 Û for each resource token on another copy of Keeping Count that is above the current number of resource tokens on this card.

Forced: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, place 1 resource token on this card.
link: Even though the cost is 0, you still must have a Tactics hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

name: Bofur
text: Quest Action: Spend 1 Ê resource to put Bofur into play from your hand, exhausted and committed to a quest. If you quest successfully this phase and Bofur is still in play, return him to your hand.
link: If you quest unsuccessfully, Bofur remains in-play for the cost of only 1 resource.  If he is returned to your hand, any "ally leaves play" triggers apply.

name: Renewed Friendship
text: Response: After another player plays an attachment on a hero you control, you may (choose 1): ready 1 of that player's heroes, have that player draw 1 card, or lower that player's threat by 2.
link: Even though the cost is 0, you still must have a Spirit hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

name: Ravenhill Scout
text: Action: Exhaust Ravenhill Scout to move up to 2 progress tokens from 1 location to another location.

name: Needful to Know
text: Action: Raise your threat by 1 to look at the top card of the ecnounter deck. Then, reduce your threat by X, where X is the threat of that card.
link: If revealed card's threat is X then X is 0.

name: Good Meal
text: Action: Discard Good Meal to lower the cost of the next event you play this round that matches attached hero's sphere by 2.

name: Up the Pass
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add it to the staging area.

name: Snowdrifts
text:
When Revealed: Shuffle 1 more copy of Snowstorm into the encounter deck than the number of players in the game.

Forced: After placing the 11th progress token on Snowdrifts, discard any active location. Caradhras becomes the active location.
link: You don't travel to Caradhras (D 15), it just becomes your active location.  After reaching 11 tokens on this card, any remaining unplaced progress tokens will then be placed on Caradhras (D 15). If Caradhras is in your victory display you'll need to move the card from your victory display to the active location.

name: The Mountains' Peaks
text:
When Revealed: Shuffle all copies of Snowstorm in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

Characters are discarded from play if their Ò is ever 0.

Players cannot defeat this stage unless they have 5 victory points. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Arwen Undómiel
text:
The first player gains control of Arwen Undómiel, as an ally.

Response: After Arwen Undómiel exhausts, choose a hero. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

If Arwen Undómiel leaves play, the players are defeated.
link: No matter what she exhausts for, you add a resource.

name: Caradhras
text:
While Caradhras is the active location, questing characters get -1 Ò.

Players cannot travel to Caradhras except by quest card effects.

name: Fanuidhol
text: While Fanuidhol is the active loction, heroes must spend 1 resource from their resource pool to count their Ò during the quest phase.
link: This does not reduce [Willpower] to zero. Willpower is simply not added to the total when determining quest resolution unless a hero pays 1 resource.

name: Celebdil
text: While Celebdil is the active location, remove 2 progress tokens from it at the end of each round.

name: The Dimrill Stair
text: Travel: Reshuffle all locations in the discard pile and victory display back into the encounter deck. If you reshuffled at least two locations, reduce each player's threat by 11 and discard all copies of Freezing Cold from play.

name: Rocky Crags
text: Travel: Each player must deal 2 damage to 1 character he controls to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each progress token on the active location.

name: Fell Voices
text: When Revealed: Return the top 2 Snow cards in the encounter discard pile to the top of the encounter deck. If this effect returned less than 2 Snow treachery cards, Fell Voices gains surge.

name: Fallen Stones
text: When Revealed: The first player (choose 1): removes all progress tokens from play, or reveals 2 cards from the encounter deck and adds them to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each progress token on the active location.

name: Snowstorm
text: When Revealed: Each questing character gets -1 Ò until the end of the phase.
shadow: Shadow: Until the end of the phase, characters defending this attack get -1 Ò and are discarded if their Ò is 0.

name: Freezing Cold
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches this card to a hero he controls. Counts as a Condition Attachment with the text: "Attached hero gets -2 Ò and cannot commit to a quest. If attached hero has more than 1 copy of Freezing Cold attached, discard attached hero from play."
link: If the hero is currently committed to the quest, his willpower will be reduced for the quest resolution.

name: Avalanche!
text: When Revealed: Exhaust each ready character and if it is the quest phase commit them to the quest.
link: Cannot takes precedence, so if a character has Freezing Cold attached, they will not be committed to the quest.

name: Mountain Goblin
text: Mountain Goblin gets +1 Û for each Mountain location in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if the active location is a Mountain.)

name: Mountain Troll
text: Mountain Troll gets +1 Û for each Mountain location in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if the active location is a Mountain.)

name: Snow Warg
text:
Allies cannot defend while Snow Warg is attacking.

Forced: After a character is declared as a defender against Snow Warg, deal 1 damage to the defending character, if able.
link: Should read: "Forced: After a character is declared as a defender against Snow Warg…"

name: Elladan
text:
While Elrohir is in play, Elladan gets +2 Û.

Response: After Elladan is declared as an attacker, pay 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

name: Lure of Moria
text: Action: Ready all Dwarf characters.

name: Rivendell Blade
keywords: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character. Restricted.
text: When attached character attacks an enemy, that enemy gets -2 Ú until the end of the phase.

name: Hail of Stones
text: Action: Exhaust X characters to deal X damage to an enemy in the staging area.

name: Rider of the Mark
text:
Action: Spend 1 Ê resource to give control of Rider of the Mark to another player. (Limit once per round.)

Response: After Rider of the Mark changes control, discard a shadow card dealt to an enemy you are engaged with.
link:
The receiving player discards a shadow card. 
There is no action window for Rider of the Mark to be used after a shadow card is revealed during combat. Step 3 of Resolving Enemy Attacks (when shadow cards are revealed) must be completely resolved before the players can take actions.
To take advantage of the Rider of the Mark's ability, you need to trigger it before a shadow card is revealed.
Cheers,
Caleb

name: Song of Eärendil
text:
Response: After Song of Earendil enters play, draw 1 card.

Response: After another player raises his threat, raise your threat by 1 to reduce that player's threat by 1.

name: Bombur
text: Action: Exhaust Bombur to choose a location. That location gets -1 $ until the end of the phase. (That location does not contribute its $ instead if it is an Underground location.)

name: Out of the Wild
text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for any 1 non-objective card worth no victory points and add it to your victory display. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: The End Comes
text: Response: After a Dwarf character leaves play, shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

name: Along the Misty Mountains
text: Setup: Put Arwen Undómiel into play under the control of the first player. Shuffle the encounter deck. Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add them to the staging area.

name: Orc Outpost
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for Goblin Gate and add it to the staging area, if able. Then, if there is no active location, Goblin Gate becomes the active location.

name: Approaching Rivendell
text:
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add it to the staging area.

Characters cannot be healed.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Arwen Undómiel
text:
The first player gains control of Arwen Undómiel, as an ally.

Response: After Arwen Undómiel exhausts, choose a hero. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

If Arwen Undómiel leaves play, the players are defeated.

name: Ruined Road
text: Response: After you travel to Ruined Road, the first player places 2 progress tokens on it or readies 1 hero he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Goblin Gate
text: While Goblin Gate is the active location, the first enemy revealed from the encounter deck each round gains ambush. If that enemy engages a player, it makes an immediate attack (deal and resolve a shadow card).

name: Pathless Country
text: Forced: After at least 1 progress token is placed on Pathless Country, remove 1 progress token from it.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to each ally in play.

name: Barren Hills
text: While Barren Hills is the active location, ignore ambush.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Sleeping Sentry
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character. Then, exhaust all ready characters.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player must discard all exhausted characters he controls.

name: Followed by Night
text: When Revealed: The first player (choose 1): deals 1 damage to all allies in play and Followed by Night gains surge, or all enemies engaged with players make an immediate attack, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Orc Ambush
text: When Revealed: All Orc enemies in the staging area engage the first player. If there are no Orc enemies in the staging area, return all Orc enemies in the encounter discard pile to the staging area, if able.

name: Goblin Taskmaster
text: Forced: After Goblin Taskmaster engages a player, that player deals 2 damage to 1 character he controls.

name: Orc Raiders
text: Forced: After Orc Raiders engages a player, that player discards 2 attachments he controls, if able.

name: Crebain
text: While Crebain is in the staging area, encounter card effects cannot be canceled.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Wild Bear
text: Forced: After Wild Bear engages a player, it makes an immediate attack.

name: Aragorn
text: Refresh Action: Reduce your threat to your starting threat level. (Limit once per game.)

name: Grave Cairn
text: Response: After a character leaves play, add its Û to another character's Û until the end of the round.

name: Sword that was Broken
text:
Attached hero gains a Ì resource icon.

If attached hero is Aragorn, each character you control gets +1 Ò.
link: The player who controls Aragorn gets the [Willpower] bonus.

name: Watcher of the Bruinen
text:
Watcher of the Bruinen does not exhaust to defend.

Forced: After Watcher of the Bruinen defends, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.
categories: WotB does have his place in some decks. He can go on battle quests without a card discard, making him a reasonably-priced questing option. And there are many times when his multiple attacks come in handy, especially if you outfit him with a Rivendell Blade. Just try to pair him up with a deck that has Bilbo or Beravor.

name: Rivendell Bow
text:
Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character, or to Aragorn. Limit 1 per character.

Attached character gains ranged.

If attached character has a printed ranged keyword, it gets +1 Û during a ranged attack.
link: In a certain strict interpretation of the above card text, if Rivendell Bow is attached to an appropriate character, who got the ranged ability already by another attachment (for example by Dunedain Cache), it does NOT grant the +1 Attack, because the ranged keyword is not printed on the character. (BGG)

name: Arwen Undómiel
text: Response: After Arwen Undómiel exhausts, choose a character. That character gains sentinel and gets +1 Ú until the end of the round.

name: Elrond's Counsel
text: Action: If you control a unique Noldor character, give another character +1 Ò until the end of the phase and lower your threat by 3.
link: Even though the cost is 0, you still must have a Spirit hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

name: Short Cut
text: Response: After a location enters play, exhaust a Hobbit character to shuffle that location back into the encounter deck. Then, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Legacy of Durin
text: Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, draw 1 card.
link: This only triggers if you play a dwarf from your hand. If a dwarf is 'put into play' through some other mechanism (even if from your hand) then it doesn't trigger. The distinction is between 'play' and 'put into play'.

name: Resourceful
text:
Attach to a hero you control.

Attached hero collects 1 additional resource during the resource phase each round.

name: To the West-door
text: When Revealed: Reveal cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area until there is at least X $ in the staging area. X is twice the number of players in the game.

name: The Seething Lake
text:
When Revealed: Add The Watcher to the staging area. Doors of Durin becomes the active location, moving any previous active location to the staging area. Shuffle all Tentacle cards in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

If the players have at least 3 victory points and defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Doors of Durin
text:
Progress tokens that would be placed on Doors of Durin are instead placed on the current quest card.

Action: Each player may discard any number of cards from his hand. Then, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the first letter of the encounter card's title matches that of one of the discarded player cards, add Doors of Durin to your victory display. (Limit once per round.)

name: Stair Falls
text: Travel: The first player must exhaust 2 characters to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Remove 1 progress token from the current quest.

name: Perilous Swamp
text: No more than 1 progress token can be placed on Perilous Swamp each round.
shadow: Shadow: Remove 1 progress token from the current quest.

name: Makeshift Passage
text: Forced: After you travel to Makeshift Passage, place 2 progress tokens on the current quest card, bypassing any active location.

name: Stagnant Creek
text: When Revealed: Discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is a Tentacle enemy, add that card to the staging area and raise each player's threat by 5.

name: Ill Purpose
text: When Revealed: All enemies in the staging area engage the player with the highest threat. Then, each player raises his threat by the total $ of all cards in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+3 Û instead if it is a Tentacle.)

name: The Watcher
text:
While there is another Tentacle enemy in play, The Watcher cannot be optionally engaged.

If The Watcher is in the staging area at the end of the combat phase, each player must deal 3 damage to 1 character he controls.

name: Grasping Tentacle

link:
Official: The Grasping Tentacle becomes an attachment and loses the enemy type for as long as it is attached. This means you cannot attack it and there seems to be no way to remove it.
Consensus: Attached character's total Attack and Defense are reduced to zero, otherwise the card would refer to printed values.
Consensus: These can be stacked on one character and the character can still be exhausted and readied. Warden of Healing?

name: Heavy Stroke
text: Response: After a Dwarf deals X damage to an enemy during combat, deal an additional X damage to that enemy. (Limit once per phase.)
link:
The way Heavy Stroke is intended to work depends on allowing players to choose which character's attack value is applied to the enemy's defense value. For example, the optimal way to play Heavy Stroke would be to apply Aragorn's attack 3 to an enemy's 1 defense. So Aragorn is dealing 2 damage to the enemy and Dwalin is also dealing 2 damage, at which point you play Heavy Stroke to double Dwalin's damage and make it 4 for a total of 6 damage dealt to the enemy.

Just to clarify it further, let's say Aragorn and Dwalin were attacking an enemy with 4 defense. The optimal way to play Heavy Stroke would be to apply all 3 of Aragron's attack plus 1 of Dwalin's to beating the enemy's defense, then Dwalin would deal 1 damage to the enemy that could be double with Heavy Stroke for a total of 2. (Caleb)
