text: Forced: When Lossarnach Bandit engages a player, that player discards 1 resource from each of his heroes' resource pools. (2 resources instead if Lossarnach Bandit was not optionally engaged.)

name: Umbar Assassin
text: Forced: When Umbar Assassin engages a player, that player must deal 3 damage to a hero he controls. (Discard that hero instead if Umbar Assassin was not optionally engaged.)

name: Lurking in Shadows
text: When Revealed: Return all Brigand enemies engaged with players to the staging area. If this effect returned no Brigand enemies to the staging area, Lurking in Shadows gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Overgrown Trail
text: Action: Exhaust a Ranger character to place 3 progress tokens on Overgrown Trail.
shadow: Shadow: Remove X progress tokens from the current quest, where X is the attacking enemy's $.

name: Secluded Glade
text: Immune to player card effects.
shadow: Shadow: Remove X progress tokens from the current quest, where X is the attacking enemy's $.

name: Lost Companion
text: When Revealed: Each player removes 1 character he controls from the quest, if able. Then, if any player has no characters committed to the quest, remove all characters from the quest.

name: Morgul Spider
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, Morgul Spider gets +1 Û for each character not currently committed to a quest.

name: Forest Bat
text: When Revealed: The first player deals 2 damage to a questing hero and removes that hero from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by X where X is the attacking enemy's $.

name: Watcher in the Wood
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of questing characters. (If the current quest has the battle or siege keyword, Watcher in the Wood gains surge.)
shadow: Shadow: Each player raises his threat by the number of enemies engaged with him.

name: Southron Mercenaries
text: X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+3 Û instead if it has the Harad trait.)

name: Haradrim Elite
text: Forced: When Haradrim Elite enters play, it makes an immediate attack from the staging area against the first player.
shadow: Shadow: This enemy attacks again after this attack resolves. (Deal a new shadow card for that attack.)

name: Mumak
text:
No attachments can be attached to Mumak.

Mumak cannot take more than 3 damage each round.

name: Southron Support
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 Harad enemy and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Lieutenant of Mordor
text:
Allies cannot defend against Lieutenant of Mordor.

When Revealed: Resolve the "when revealed" effect on the topmost treachery card in the encounter discard pile, if able. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Arbalesters
text: X is the number of different resource icons (Ì, Ï, Ê, or Î) on heroes in play.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +2 Û.

name: Orc Vanguard
text: While Orc Vanguard is in the staging area, resources cannot be spent from the resource pools of heroes who have a Ì, Ê, or Î resource icon.
shadow: Shadow: Deal the attacking enemy two additional shadow cards.

name: Orc War Camp
text: If an Orc enemy is in play, progress tokens cannot be placed on Orc War Camp while it is in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each shadow card dealt to it.

name: The Master's Malice
text: When Revealed: Each player chooses 1 sphere of influence (Ì, Ï, Ê, or Î). Each character a player controls that does not belong to his chosen sphere takes 3 damage.

name: The Power of Mordor
text: When Revealed: Count the number of encounter cards in the staging area and shuffle them into the encounter deck. Then, reveal an equal number of cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Rabble
text: Forced: When Orc Rabble is dealt a shadow card, it gets +2 Û until the end of the phase.
shadow: Shadow: Deal the attacking enemy an additional shadow card for each player in the game.

name: Orc Arsonist
text: Forced: When Orc Arsonist engages a player, deal 1 shadow card to each enemy engaged with that player.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Deal it another shadow card.

name: Scourge of Mordor
text: When Revealed: Each player discards the top card of his deck. Until the end of the phase, raise the total $ in the staging area by X, where X is the total cost of all cards discarded by this effect.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Deal it another shadow card.

name: The Leaping Fish
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck for a copy of Harbor Thug and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Fighting in the Streets
text:
The players cannot advance to the next stage unless Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero.

When Revealed: Attach Alcaron's Scroll to the highest engagement cost enemy in play, if able. Otherwise, add Alcaron's Scroll to the staging area.

name: Escape to the Quays
text:
Enemies cannot be optionally engaged.

Forced: The first enemy revealed from the encounter deck each round makes an immediate attack against the player who controls Alcaron's Scroll from the staging area.

The players cannot defeat this stage unless Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Ambush in Ithilien
text: If the players complete this stage with Celador in the staging area, advance to stage 3A (bypassing stage 2).

name: Southron Counter-attack
text:
X is the number of players in the game.

After this stage is completed, advance to stage 4A (bypassing stage 3).

name: The Hidden Way
text:
When Revealed: The first player takes control of all Ranger objectives in the staging area.

Enemies do not make engagement checks and cannot be optionally engaged.

name: Approaching Cair Andros
text:
If any player's threat is 37 or higher, Approaching Cair Andros gains siege.

Forced: At the end of each round, raise each player's threat by 2.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: The Defense
text: Players must deal damage from undefended attacks to the lowest $ Battleground location in play. If there are no Battleground locations in play, immediately advance to the next stage.

name: Reinforcing the Banks
text: Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area during the staging step each round.

name: Breakthrough at the Approach
text: Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, instead of raising threat, each player must choose and discard 1 character he controls.

name: Breakthrough at the Citadel
text: Breakthrough at the Citadel adds 5 $ to the staging area.

name: The Last Battle
text:
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

If the players have collected 4 or more victory points, The Last Battle gains battle and loses siege.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Hirluin the Fair
text: You may use resources from Hirluin the Fair's resource pool to pay for Outlands ally cards of any sphere.

name: Warrior of Lossarnach
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 Ú.

name: Gaining Strength
text: Action: Discard 2 resources from your hero's resource pool to add 3 resources to that hero's resource pool.

name: Knights of the Swan
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 Û.

name: Gondorian Shield
keywords: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Limit 1 per hero.
text: Attached hero gains +1 Ú. (+2 Ú instead if attached hero has the Gondor trait.)

name: Ethir Swordsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 Ò.

name: Ring of Barahir
text:
Attached hero gets +1 hit point for each Artifact attachment attached to it.

If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a Î resource icon.

name: Anfalas Herdsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 hit point.

name: Mithrandir's Advice
text: Action: Draw 1 card for each hero you control with a printed Î resource icon.

name: A Good Harvest
text: Action: Name a sphere. Until the end of the phase, you can spend resources of any sphere when paying for cards that belong to the named sphere.
link: A Good Harvest does not allow players to play 0 cost cards without a resource match. Since you are not using any resources to pay for the card, the ability of A Good Harvest does not apply and you still need a resource match. [Caleb]

name: Conspiracy
text:
When revealed: Search the encounter deck for The Fourth Star and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Forced: After the active location leaves play as an explored location, place 1 resource token on this quest.

If there are 4 or more resource tokens on Conspiracy, advance to the next stage.

name: The Grand Design
text:
When Revealed: Make Roots of Mindolluin the active location, returning any other active location to the staging area.

Forced: After the active location leaves play as an explored location place 1 resource token on this quest.

If there are 4 or more resource tokens on The Grand Design, advance to the next stage.

name: The Confrontation
text:
When Revealed: Shuffle the underworld deck into the encounter deck. The players cannot defeat this stage while a Villain is in play.

If this stage is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: Underworld Dissident
text: Underworld Dissident gets +1 Û for each Underworld location in play.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, remove 1 token from the current quest.

name: Daughter of Berúthiel
text:
Daughter of Berúthiel cannot be optionally engaged.

Forced: After Daughter of Berúthiel attacks, return her to the staging area. The engaged player may raise his threat by 4 to prevent this effect.

name: The Hand of Castamir
text:
Forced: After The Hand of Castamir attacks, reveal the top card of the encounter deck, resolve its effects, and discard it.

Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, The Hand of Castamir makes an immediate attack against the first player.
link: If the revealed card has a surge effect, one would draw another card and possibly add it to the staging area or trigger its reveal effects. Unconfirmed, however, if this is the way it should work.

name: Telemnar's Bane
text:
Forced: When Telemnar's Bane attacks, discard the top 3 cards of each player's deck.

Forced: After a player plays an event card, Telemnar's Bane makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Sewers
text: When Revealed: Place the top card of the underworld deck facedown underneath the active location, if able.

name: Roots of Mindolluin
text: Each location in the staging area gets +2 quest points.
link: If you travel to a location (including this one) then the location you travel to doesn't have the +2 Quest boost. As long as Roots of Mindolluin is in play, any location in the staging area gets +2 Quest points.

name: Storehouse
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if undefended.)

name: Houses of the Dead
text: Forced: After Houses of the Dead becomes the active location, exhaust all characters.

name: The Fourth Star
keywords: Underworld X. X is the number of players in the game.
text: Response: When The Fourth Star leaves play as an explored location, each player may draw 1 card.

name: Unwelcome Discovery
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the underworld deck and add it to the staging area. If it is a Clue card, discard it instead.

name: A Knife in the Back
text: When Revealed: Randomly select 1 ally controlled by the first player, if able. The first player deals X damage to one of his heroes, where X is that ally's Û. Then discard that ally. If no ally is discarded by this effect, A Knife in the Back gains surge.

name: False Lead
text: When Revealed: End the quest phase without resolving the quest.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove all tokens from the current quest.

name: A Scrap of History
text: Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective, add it to the victory display, and place 1 resource token on the current quest.

name: Secret Map
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective and attach it to that hero.

Action: If attached to a hero, add Secret Map to the victory display to place 3 progress tokens on the active location.

name: A Prisoner
text: Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective, add it to the victory display, and place 2 resource tokens on the current quest.

name: Unholy Alliance
text:
Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area during the staging step each round.

If a hero is destroyed by an enemy attack, the players have lost the game.

name: Up in Flames
text:
Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 resource token on Up in Flames and discard the top X cards of each player's deck. X is the number of resource tokens on Up in Flames.

If any player has no cards in his deck, the players have lost the game.

name: Poisoned Counsels
text: At the end of each round, raise each player's threat by 2.
link: That's a total of three and the end of each round (two from this card, one from normal threat raising)

name: Mirlonde
text: Each hero you control with a printed Î resource icon gets -1 threat cost.

name: Forlong
text: While you control Outlands allies that belong to 4 different spheres, ready Forlong at the beginning of each phase.

name: Strength of Arms
text:
Play only if each hero you control has a printed Ì resource icon.

Action: Ready each ally in play.

name: Mighty Prowess
keywords: Attach to a Ï hero. Limit 1 per hero.
text: Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the enemy just destroyed.

name: Trained for War
text:
Play only if each hero you control has the printed Ï resource icon.

Action: Until the end of the phase, if the current quest has no keyword it gains battle. (Characters quest using Û instead of Ò.)

name: Silvan Refugee
text: Forced: After a character leaves play, discard Silvan Refugee from play.

name: Against the Shadow
text:
Play only if each hero you control has the printed Ê resource icon.

Action: Until the end of the phase, Ê characters use their Ò instead of Ú.

name: Harbor Master
text: Response: After a card effect adds any number of resources to the resource pool of a hero you control, Harbor Master gains +1 Ú until the end of the round.

name: Advance Warning
text:
Play only if each hero you control has a printed Î resource icon.

Action: Until the end of the phase, enemies do not make engagement checks

name: White Tower Watchman
text: If each hero you control belongs to the same sphere of influence, you may assign damage from undefended enemy attacks to White Tower Watchman instead of a hero you control.
link: Can include song card spheres  due to the fact that it does not say 'printed'. (Unofficial)

name: The Pursuit
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player and add it to the staging area.

name: An Untimely End
text: Archery damage must be assigned to allies, if able.

name: Drû-buri-Drû
text:
Allies cannot defend against Drû-buri-Drû.

While Drû-buri-Drû is in the victory display, characters get +1 Ò and +1 Ú.

Unless Drû-buri-Drû is in the victory display, the players cannot win.

name: The Passage Out
text:
Characters use their Ò instead of Û when attacking enemies. If an enemy would be damaged this way, place progress tokens on it instead of damage tokens. When an enemy has progress equal to its hit points, add it to the victory display and place those progress tokens on the quest.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Drúadan Drummer
text: Each Wose enemy in the staging area gets +2 $.
shadow: Shadow: Each Wose enemy engaged with the defending player gets +1 Û.

name: Drúadan Elite
keywords:
Archery 2. Prowl X.

X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks unless any player pays 1 resource.

name: Drúadan Hunter
keywords:
Prowl 1. Archery X.

X is the number of heroes in play with no resources in their resource pool.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û.

name: Drúadan Thief
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks unless any player pays 1 resource.

name: Ancestral Clearing
text:
The cost to play each player card is increased by 1.

Travel: Exhaust a hero to travel here.

name: Garden of Poisons
text:
Heroes cannot gain resources from card effects.

Travel: Each player must pay 1 resource to travel here.

name: Glade of Cleansing
text:
Each Wose enemy gains Archery 1.

X is equal to the total archery value of the highest archery Wose enemy in play.

name: Men in the Dark
text: When Revealed: Each hero must pay 1 resource or take 1 damage. If no hero takes damage from this effect, Men in the Dark gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each hero the defending player controls with no resources.

name: Stars in Sky
text: When Revealed: Each questing hero must pay 1 resource or it is removed from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Discard all resources from the defending character's resource pool.

name: Leaves on Tree
text: When Revealed: Each player must pay 1 resource for each attachment he controls or discard all attachments he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending character.

name: Pippin
text: If each hero you control has the Hobbit trait, Pippin gains: "Response: After an enemy engages you, raise your threat by 3 to return it to the staging area. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage you."

name: Denethor
text:
Denethor gets -1 Ò for each damaged hero you control.

Discard Denethor if his Ò is 0 or less.

name: Lord of Morthond
keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Outlands hero.
text: If each hero you control has a printed Ì resource icon, Lord of Morthond gains: "Response: After you play a Î, Ê, or Ï ally, draw 1 card."

name: Book of Eldacar
text:
Reduce the cost to play Book of Eldacar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed Ï resource icon.

Action: Discard Book of Eldacar to play any Ï event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Gondorian Discipline
text: Response: Cancel up to 2 points of damage just dealt to a Gondor character.

name: Minas Tirith Lampwright
text: Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, discard Minas Tirith Lampwright to name enemy, location, or treachery. If the next encounter card revealed is the named type, discard it without resolving its effects.

name: Small Target
text: Response: After a Hobbit hero you control exhausts to defend an attack, choose another enemy engaged with you and reveal the attacking enemy's shadow card. If that shadow card has no shadow effect, resolve this enemy's attack against the chosen enemy. If that shadow card has a shadow effect, resolve this attack as normal.

name: Ithilien Archer
text: Response: After Ithilien Archer attacks and damages an enemy, return that enemy to the staging area.

name: Ithilien Pit
text:
Play Ithilien Pit into the staging area unattached.

If unattached, attach Ithilien Pit to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.

Any character may choose attached enemy as the target of an attack.

name: Hobbit-sense
keywords: Play only if each of your heroes is a Hobbit.
text: Combat Action: Enemies engaged with you do not attack this round. You cannot declare attacks this round.

name: Savagery of the Orcs
text:
When progress would be placed on Savagery of the Orcs, move an equal number of villager tokens from this quest onto Rescued Villagers instead.

If there are no villager tokens on Savagery of the Orcs, advance to the next stage.

name: Protect the Villagers
text:
If an attack goes undefended, discard X villager tokens from Rescued Villagers instead of damaging a hero. X is the amount of damage that would have been dealt.

When the players defeat this stage, end the game. Compare the number of tokens on Rescued Villagers to the number of tokens on Dead Villagers.

name: Rescued Villagers
text:
If a location leaves play as an explored location, move any villager tokens from that location to Rescued Villagers.

At the end of the game, if there are more villager tokens here than damage tokens on Dead Vilagers, the players have won.

name: Dead Villagers
text:
If a villager token is discarded from a location, objective or quest stage, place a damage token on Dead Villagers.

At the end of the game, if there are more damage tokens here than villager tokens on Rescued Villagers, the players have lost.

name: Lord Alcaron
keywords: The first player gains control of Lord Alcaron.
text:
Response: After a villager token is discarded, exhaust Lord Alcaron to place that villager token on a location instead.

If Lord Alcaron leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Ghulat
keywords: X is the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.
text:
Forced: When Ghulat attacks, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.

While Ghulat is in play, the game cannot end.

name: Marauding Orc
text: Forced: After Marauding Orc attacks and destroys a character, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 villager token from Rescued Villagers.

name: Orc Ravager
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location. If no villager token is discarded by this effect, Orc Ravager gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if undefended.)

name: Craven Eagle
text: When Revealed: Discard the character with the fewest remaining hit points. That character's controller may discard 3 cards at random from his hand to prevent this effect.

name: Burning Farmhouse
text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard 1 villager token from Burning Farmhouse.

name: Gondorian Hamlet
text: While Gondorian Hamlet is in the staging area it gains: "Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, discard 1 villager token from Gondorian Hamlet."

name: Secluded Farmhouse
text: Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

name: Burnt Homestead
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 1 for each damage token on Dead Villagers.

name: Trapped Inside
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location for each player in the game. If no villager tokens were removed by this effect, Trapped Inside gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 villager token from Rescued Villagers.

name: Panicked!
text: When Revealed: Each player must take a villager token from Rescued Villagers and place it on a location in the staging area, if able. If no villager tokens were placed on a location by this effect, Panicked! gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each damage token on Dead Villagers.

name: Faramir
text: Faramir gets +1 Û for each enemy in the staging area.

name: Sword of Morthond
text: Attached ally gains the Outlands trait.

name: Men of the West
text: Action: Return X Outlands allies from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Knight of Minas Tirith
text:
If each of your heroes has a printed Ï resource icon, Knight of Minas Tirith gains: 
"Response: After Knight of Minas Tirith enters play, choose an enemy in the staging area. Engage that enemy and exhaust Knight of Minas Tirith to declare it as attacker (and resolve its attack) against that enemy."

name: Gondorian Fire
keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Dunedain hero.
text: Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 Û for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Pelargir Shipwright
text: Pelargir Shipwright gets +1 Ò for each hero you control with a printed Ê resource icon.

name: Map of Earnil
text:
Reduce the cost to play Map of Earnil by 1 for each hero you control with a printed Ê resource icon. 

Action: Discard Map of Earnil to play any Ê event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Ranger Bow
keywords: Attach to a Ranger character. Restricted.
text: Action: Exhaust Ranger Bow and attached character to deal 1 damage to an enemy in the staging area.

name: Forest Patrol
keywords: Play only if you control at least 1 Ranger character.
text: Action: Deal 3 damage to an enemy with at least 1 Trap card attached to it.

name: Palantir
text: Planning Action: Exhaust Palantir and attached hero to name a card type and look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each of those cards that matches the named type, draw a card. For each of those cards that does not match the named type, raise your threat by 2.

name: Retake the City
text:
Forced: When an Osgiliath location leaves play as an explored location, the first player takes control of that location.

If the players control all Osgiliath locations in play at the end of the round, they have won the game.

name: Uruk Lieutenant
text: When Revealed: Add the topmost Orc enemy from the encounter discard pile to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls. (All attachments he controls instead if undefended.)

name: Uruk Soldier
text: Forced: After Uruk Soldier attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller returns a location he controls to the staging area, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 1 for each location he controls.

name: Southron Phalanx
text: While engaged with a player, Southron Phalanx gets +1 Û for each location that player controls.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each location the defending player controls.

name: Southron Commander
text: When Revealed: Southron Commander makes an immediate attack from the staging area against each player who controls at least 1 location.

name: West Gate
text:
Action: If there is no active location, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Osgiliath location, reveal it and add it to the staging area. Then, make West Gate the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Forced: After the player who controls West Gate lets an attack go undefended, return West Gate to the staging area.

name: The King's Library
text:
Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

Forced: After the player who controls The King's Library lets an attack go undefended, return The King's Library to the staging area.

name: Ancient Harbor
text:
Combat Action: Exhaust a hero to place 1 progress token on Ancient Harbor.

Forced: After the player who controls Ancient Harbor lets an attack go undefended, return Ancient Harbor to the staging area.

name: The Old Bridge
text:
Planning Action: Spend 2 resources to place 1 progress token on The Old Bridge. (1 resource instead if there is another Osgiliath location in the staging area.)

Forced: After the player who controls The Old Bridge lets an attack go undefended, return The Old Bridge to the staging area.

name: West Quarter
text: While West Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains siege. (Characters quest using Ú instead of Ò.)
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest $ to the staging area.

name: East Quarter
text: While East Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains battle. (Characters quest using Û instead of Ò.)
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest $ to the staging area.

name: Ruined Square
text:
Response: After an enemy is defeated, place 1 progress token on Ruined Square.

Forced: If a player controls Ruined Square when a character leaves play, return Ruined Square to the staging area.

name: Ruined Tower
text:
Travel: If there is 1 active location, exhaust a character to travel here. (There are now 2 active locations.)

Forced: After the player who controls Ruined Tower loses control of a location, return Ruined Tower to the staging area.

name: Pinned Down
text: When Revealed: Add X to the archery total this round. X is the number of locations the players control. If the players control less than 4 locations, Pinned Down gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest $ to the staging area.

name: Street Fighting
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an Osgiliath location is discarded. The first player may exhaust a hero to take control of that location. Otherwise, add that location to the staging area. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Counter-attack
text: When Revealed: Each player must return the location he controls with the highest $ to the staging area, or raise his threat by the total $ of all locations he controls.

name: Caldara
text: Action: Discard Caldara to put 1 Spirit ally from your discard pile into play for each other hero you control with a printed Spirit resource icon.

name: Squire of the Citadel
text: Response: After Squire of the Citadel leaves play, add 1 resource to a Gondor hero's resource pool.

name: Tome of Atanatar
text: Reduce the cost to play Tome of Atanatar by 1 for each you control with the printed Leadership resource icon. Action: Discard Tome of Atanatar to play any Leadership event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Guthlaf
text: If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1. If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

name: The Hammer-stroke
text: Encounter Action: Engage each enemy in play.

name: Emery
text: Action: Discard the top 3 card of your deck to put Emery into play from your hand, under any player's control. Then, if any of the discarded cards have the Tactics, Lore or Leadership sphere, discard Emery.

name: Children of the Sea
text: Action: Choose a Silvan or Noldor ally you control. That ally gets +2 Willpower until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, shuffle that ally into its owner's deck if it is still in play.

name: Anborn
text: Action: Exhaust Anborn to return 1 Trap card from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Poisoned Stakes
text: Play Poisoned Stakes into the staging area unattached. If unattached, attach Poisoned Stakes to the next eligble enemy that enters the staging area. At the end of each round, deal 2 damage to attached enemy.

name: Well-Equipped
text: Action: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. You may attach 1 attachment card discarded by this effect to an eligible Dwarf character in play.

name: The Ambush
text: At the beginning of the quest phase, each player takes 1 hidden card. At the beginning of the combat phase, each player must either turn each of his hidden cards faceup or take 1 hidden card.

name: Captured!
text: At the beginning of the quest phase, each player takes 1 hidden card. If a player has 5 hidden cards, he must turn them faceup. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Black Númenorean
text: X is the total number of hidden cards in the game. Forced: At the end of the round, each player must raise his threat by 1 for each hiddien card in his play area.

name: Orc Ambusher
text: Forced: After Orc Ambusher engages you, discard 1 non-objective ally you control, if able.
shadow: Attack enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if undefended).

name: Brutal Uruk
text: Forced: After Brutual Uruk attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller turns all hidden cards in his play area faceup. Deal a shadow card to each enemy turned faceup by this effect and resolve their attacks as normal.

name: Evil Crow
text: Forced: When Evil Crow engages a player, that player takes 1 hidden card.
shadow: Take 1 hidden card.

name: The Cross-roads
keywords: The current quest card gains siege (and loses battle).
text: X is the number of players in the game. Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Southern Road
text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Western Road
text: Western Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area. Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Northern Road
text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Eastern Road
text: Eastern Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area. Travel: The first player must take 2 hidden cards to travel here.

name: The Dark Woods
text: X is the number of players in the game. Forced: After The Dark Woods leaves play as an explored location, the first player discards 1 hidden card.

name: Lying in Wait
text: When Revealed: The first player turns each hidden card in his play area faceup. Resolve the "When Revealed" effects of each encounter cards turned faceup by this effect. If a location is turned faceup, add it to the staging area.

name: Mordor Looms
text: When Revealed: Each player takes 1 hidden card.
shadow: If this attack destoys a characters, that character's controller turns each of his hidden cards faceup.

name: Conflict at the Crossroads
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, Orc enemies engaged with players add their Threat to the staging area. If no Orc enemies are engaged with players, Conflict at the Crossroads gains surge.
shadow: Take 1 hidden card.

name: Faramir
keywords: The first player gains control of Faramir.
text: Combat Action: Exhaust Faramir to turn 1 hidden card faceup. If that card is an enemy, deal 3 damage to it. If Faramir leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Lord Alcaron
keywords: The first player gains control of Lord Alcaron.
text: Action: Exhaust Lord Alcaron to return an enemy engaged with you to the staging area. If Lord Alcaron leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Théoden
text: Each hero with a printed Ï resource icon gets +1 Ò.

name: Pelargir Ship Captain
text: Response: After Pelargir Ship Captain enters play, move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

name: Visionary Leadership
text: While attached hero has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Gondor characters get +1 Ò.

name: Spear of the Mark
keywords: Attach to a Rohan character. Restricted.
text: Attached character gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if attacking an enemy in the staging area.)

text: Combat Action: Each Rohan hero can be declared as an attacker against enemies in the staging area this phase.

name: Steed of the Mark
keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Rohan character.
text: Response: After attached hero commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to ready attached hero.

name: Lay of Nimrodel
text: Action: Choose a Ê hero. Until the end of the phase, that hero gets +1 Ò for each resource in its resource pool.

name: Ered Nimrais Prospector
text: Response: After Ered Nimrais Prospector enters play, discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, choose and shuffle 1 card from your discard pile back into your deck.

name: Scroll of Isildur
text:
Reduce the cost to play Scroll of Isildur by 1 for each hero you control with a printed resource Î icon.

Action: Discard Scroll of Isildur to play any Î event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Hidden Cache
text:
Response: After Hidden Cache is discarded from your deck, add 2 resources to the resource pool of a hero you control.

Action: Action: Spend 1 resource to draw 1 card.

name: The Rearguard
text: Murzag cannot leave play unless destroyed. If Murzag is defeated, advance to the next stage.

name: The Betrayal
text: Lord Alcaron cannot leave play unless destroyed. If Lord Alcaron is defeated, advance to the next stage.

name: The Morgul Rider
text:
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

Nazgûl of Minas Morgul cannot leave play unless destroyed.

If Nazgûl of Minas Morgul is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: To the Tower
text:
To the Tower cannot leave the staging area.

Remove Faramir from the game.

If 10 or more progress tokens are on To the Tower, the players have lost the game.

name: Morgul Bodyguard
text: Any damage that would be dealt to a Captain is dealt to 1 Morgul Bodyguard instead.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy engages the next player and makes an immediate attack, if able.

name: Morgul Sorcerer
text: Forced: After any number of progress tokens are placed on To the Tower, deal Morgul Sorcerer a shadow card.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player must place 1 progress token on To the Tower or treat this attack as undefended.

name: Morgul Tracker
text: Forced: When Morgul Tracker is optionally engaged, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If undefended, place 1 progress token on To the Tower as well.

name: Murzag
text: Forced: After Murzag attacks, reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an enemy, put it into play engaged with the defending player.
link: Murzag's Forced effect works the same as any other effect that forces players to reveal cards from the encounter deck: resolve any "when revealed" effects and keywords, then resolve the staging of that card. If it is a treachery card, it is discarded after resolving its effects. If it is a location, add it to the staging area. If it is an enemy, Murzag's ability instructs the defending player to put it into play engaged with him instead of adding it to the staging area. That enemy will make an attack since it is still the "resolve enemy attacks" part of the combat phase, but it will not be dealt a shadow card. -Caleb

name: Lord Alcaron
text:
Forced: When Lord Alcaron attacks, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.

Forced: When Lord Alcaron is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect, he makes an additional attack after this one (deal and resolve another shadow card).

name: Nazgûl of Minas Morgul
text:
Nazgûl of Minas Morgul cannot have attachments.

Reduce any amount of damage dealt to Nazgûl of Minas Morgul to 1.

name: Morgul Road
text: Response: After Morgul Road leaves play as an explored location, the first player may remove 1 progress token from To the Tower or deal 1 damage to an enemy in play.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Morgul Vale
text: Forced: At the end of the round, each player returns 1 enemy engaged with him to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.

name: The White Bridge
text: X is the number of progress tokens on To the Tower.

name: Impenetrable Fog
text: When Revealed: The first player places 3 progress tokens on To the Tower or reveals X additional cards from the encounter deck and adds them to the staging area. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Sleepless Malice
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 3 random cards from his hand or place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Terror Drives Them
text: When Revealed: Place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each progress token on To the Tower.

name: The Dead City Looms
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of progress tokens on To the Tower. If there are no progress tokens on To the Tower, The Dead City Looms gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each progress token on To the Tower.

name: Éomer
text: Response: After a character leaves play, Éomer gets +2 Û attack until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: Gríma
text: Action: Lower the cost of the next card you play from your hand this round by 1. That card gains Doomed 1. (Limit once per round.)

name: Saruman
keywords: Doomed 3. At the end of the round, discard Saruman from play.
text: Response: After Saruman enters play, choose a non-unique enemy or location in the staging area. While Saruman is in play, the chosen enemy or location is considered to be out of play.

name: Orthanc Guard
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, ready Orthanc Guard.

name: Isengard Messenger
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, Isengard Messenger gets +1 Ò until the end of the round. (Limit twice per round.)

text: Action: Discard Westfold Outrider to choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage the chosen enemy.

name: Westfold Horse-breeder
text: Response: After Westfold Horse-breeder enters play, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mount attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Rohan Warhorse
keywords: Attach to a Ï or Rohan hero. Restricted.
text: Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Rohan Warhorse to ready attached hero.

name: Silver Lamp
text: While attached hero is ready, shadow cards dealt to enemies engaged with you are dealt face up. (Shadow card effects are still resolved when resolving enemy attacks.)

name: Keys of Orthanc
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, exhaust Keys of Othanc to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.

name: Legacy of Númenor
text: Action: Add 1 resource to each hero's resource pool.

name: Deep Knowledge
text: Action: Each player draws 2 cards.

name: The Wizard's Voice
text: Action: Each player chooses 1 enemy engaged with him. Until the end of the phase, each chosen enemy cannot attack the player that chose it.

name: Power of Orthanc
text: Action: Each player may choose and discard a Condition attachment from play.

name: The Seeing-stone
text: Action: Search your deck for a card with the Doomed keyword and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Gríma
text:
If free of encounters, the first player gains control of Grima.

Action: Exhaust Grima to draw a card.

If Grima leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: The Islet
text: While The Islet is the active location, each Dunland enemy in play gets +1 $

name: Fords of Isen
text:
While Fords of Isen is in the staging area, players cannot gain resources from card effects.

Forced: After Fords of Isen becomes the active location, each player with fewer than 5 cards in his hand draws cards until he has 5 in his hand

name: The King's Road
text:
While any player has 3 or more cards in hand, The King's Road gets +3 quest points.

While any player has 5 or more cards in hand, the King's Road gains: 'When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to The King's Road, if able.'

name: Gap of Rohan
text: While Gap of Rohan is in the staging area, Dunland enemies get +1 Û
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û.  If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Pillaging and Burning
text: When Revealed: Each player draws a card. Each player raises his threat by 1 for each card in his hand.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls (each attachment he controls instead if this attack is undefended.

name: Down From The Hills
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either remove 1 time counter from the current quest, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dunland enemy, reveal it, and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. If any player has 5 or more cards in hand, this effect cannot be canceled.

name: Ill Tidings
text: When Revealed: The first player draws this card into his hand.  Ill tidings cannot leave that player's hand. Then, if the first player has 5 or more cards in his hand, Ill Tidings gains surge.

name: Mugash
text: Forced: After Mugash is defeated, the first player attaches him to a hero he controls and exhausts that hero.  (Counts as a Captive attachment with the text: 'Attached hero cannot ready. If attached hero leaves play, the players lose the game.')

name: Mugash's Guard
text:
While a player controls a hero with Mugash attached, Mugash's Guard engages that player.

Forced: After Mugash's Guard destroys a character, if Mugash is attached to a hero, return Mugash to the staging area.

name: Methedras Orc
text: Forced: When Methedras Orc attacks, the defending player shuffles 1 random card from his hand into his out-of-play deck.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Methedras
text:
While Methedras is the active location, each location in the staging area gets +1 $.

Forced: When Methedras leaves play as an explored location, each player Searches 3.

name: Orc Cave
text:
Forced: After Orc Cave leaves play as an explored location, the first player Searches 5.

Travel: Discard the top X cards of the encounter deck to travel here.  X is the number of players in the game. Add each Orc enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

name: Mugash's Lair
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, reveal the top card of each player's out-of-play deck.  Add each revealed enemy to the staging area and discard the rest.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls.

name: Orc Territory
text: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a location and adds it to the staging area.  If the total $ in the staging area is less than the total Ò of all characters committed to the quest, each Orc enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack.

name: Mugash
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective when it is free of encounters. Attach Mugash to that hero.

Forced: After attached hero takes damage, return Mugash to the top of the encounter deck.

name: Edge of Fangorn
text: Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and add it to the staging area to travel here (2 Huorn enemies instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).

name: Dark-Hearted Huorn
text: Forced:  At the beginning of each resource phase, the engaged player must raise his threat by 2.

name: Angry Huorn
text: Forced:  At the beginning of each resource phase, Angry Huorn attacks the engaged player.

name: Deadly Huorn
text: Forced:  At the beginning of each resource phase, the engaged player must deal 3 damage to a character he controls.

name: Heart of Fangorn
text: While Heart of Fangorn is in the staging area, each player cannot refresh more than 5 characters during the refresh phase
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: The Forest's Malice
text: When Revealed: Each Huorn enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack.  If no attack was made as a result of this effect, each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and put it into play engaged with him.  This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Skirmisher
text: Forced: After Orc Skirmisher engages a player, that player must either deal 3 damage to a character he controls, or remove 1 time counter form the current quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û

text: When Revealed:  Either reveal an additional encounter card, or remove 1 time counter from the current quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes and additional attack after this one.

name: Orc Hound
text: Forced:  After Orc Hound engages a player, that player must exhaust a character he controls.

name: Orc Hunting Party
text: When Revealed: Deal each Orc enemy in play a shadow card.  Each Orc enemy gets -15 engagement cost until the end of the round.  If there are no Orc enemies in the staging area, Orc Hunting Party gains surge.

name: Dunland Prowler
text:
While any player has 3 or more cards in hand, Dunland Prowler gains surge.

While any player has 5 or more cards in hand, Dunland Prowler gets +1 $

text: While engaged with a player, Dunlending Bandit gets +1 Û for each card in that player's hand
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending player has at least 3 cards in his hand).

text: Forced: After Dunland Raider engages a player, that player must deal X damage divided among characters he controls where X equals the number of cards in his hand.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control

name: Dunland Tribesman
text:
When Revealed: Each player draws a card.

Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, Dunland Tribesman gets +1 $ until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û

name: Dunland Chieftain
text: Forced: After Dunland Cheieftain engages a player, discard X cards from the top of the encounter deck where X is the number of cards in the engaged player's hand.  Put the topmost Dunland enemy discarded this way into play engaged with that player

name: Dunland Berserker
text: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, Dunland Berserker makes an attack.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Wild Men of Dunland
text: When Revealed: Attach to the current quest.(Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, that player deals 1 damage to a character he controls.'

name: Ancient Forest
text: While Ancient Forest is in the staging area, each Forest location in the staging area gets +1 $ and +3 quest points.  This ability does not stack with other copies of Ancient Forest.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player exhausts a character he controls.

text: While Tangled Woods is in the staging area, each Forest location in play gains: 'Travel: Exhaust a hero to travel here'.  This ability does not stack with other copies of Tangled Woods.

name: Turned Around
text: When Revealed: Either remove 1 time counter from a card in play, or return the active location to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, return the active location to the staging area.

name: Prowling Wolf
text: While engaged with a player, Prowling Wolf gets +1 Û for each location in the staging area
shadow: Shadow: Defending player exhausts a character he controls.

shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each location in the staging area.

text: When Revealed:  Each player must assign X damage among characters he controls where X is the number of characters that player controls.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û(+2 Û instead if the defending character is undamaged.)

name: Off Track
text: When Revealed: Attach to a location in play. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per location. Attached location gets +2 quest points and gains: 'Forced: Remove and additional time counter from the current quest at the end of each refresh phase, if able.'"

name: In Need of Rest
text: When Revealed: Remove a hero from the quest and attach In Need of Rest to that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'Limit 1 per hero.  Forced:  After a time counter is removed from the current quest, attached hero takes 1 damage.')

name: Fight at the Fords
text:
Time 5. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard Grima from play.

The players cannot advance unless the first player controls Grima.

name: Dunlending Attack
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 different Dunland enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the Encounter Deck.

Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls where X is the number of cards in his hand. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

name: Hold the Fords
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard the top X cards of the encounter deck.  X is the number of card's in the first player's hand.  Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.  Put 3 time counters on this stage.

While there is at least 1 enemy in play, the players cannot defeat this stage.  If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Orders from Orthanc
text: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck for a Mountain location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Then, advance to Stage 2

name: Searching for Mugash
text:
Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, shuffle the discard pile into the encounter deck and reveal 2 encounter cards per player. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

Response: After questing successfully, cancel all progress that would be placed on this stage. Then, place 1 time counter on this stage. Or, if Mugash is in play, advance to stage 3.

name: The Wizard's Prize
text:
Time 3.  Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, return Mugash to the staging area and reveal X encounter cards.  X is the number of players in the game minus 1.  Place 3 time counters on this stage.

Progress cannot be placed on this stage unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Into the Woods
text:
Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, shuffle Mugash into the encounter deck and advance to stage 3.

The players cannot advance to stage 2 unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

name: Escape from Fangorn
text:
Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, shuffle Mugash into the encounter deck and advance to stage 3A.

The players cannot defeat this stage unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: The Angry Forest
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. Each player must choose an enemy or objective in the discard pile, reveal it, and add it to the staging area. Place 3 time counters on this stage.

Forced: After placing progress here, if there is at least 6 progress on this stage and Mugash is attached to a hero, advance to stage 2A.

name: Celeborn
text: Response: After a Silvan ally enters play, that ally gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú until the end of the round.

name: Naith Guide
text: Response: After Naith Guide enters play, choose a hero. That hero does not exhaust to quest this round.

name: Swift and Silent
text: Action: Ready a hero you control. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Swift and Silent this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.

name: Firefoot
text:
Attach to a Ï or Rohan hero. Restricted.  
  
 Attached hero gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if attached hero is Éomer).  
  
 Response: After attached hero attacks alone, exhaust Firefoot to choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. Excess damage dealt by this attack is assigned to the chosen enemy

name: Close Call
text: Response: Cancel X damage just dealt to a hero.

name: Blue Mountain Trader
text: Action: Choose another player. That player gains control of Blue Mountain Trader. Then, that player moves 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero he controls to the resource pool of a hero you control, or Blue Mountain Trader is discarded.

name: The Fall of Gil-Galad
text:
Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a hero.  
  
 Response: When attached hero is destroyed, add The Fall of Gil-galad to the victory display to reduce your threat by X, where X is the attached hero’s threat cost.

name: Ithilien Lookout
text: Response: After Ithilien Lookout enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy, you may discard it.

name: The Tree People
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Silvan ally. Put that ally into play and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. You can only play 1 copy of The Tree People each phase.

name: The White Council
text:
X is the number of players in the game.  
  
 Action: Starting with the first player, each player chooses 1 different option: ready a hero he controls, add 1 resource to the resource pool of a hero he controls, draw 1 card, or shuffle 1 card from his discard pile into his deck.

name: The Road to Tharbad
text: Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, each player discards his hand and draws 2 cards. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

name: A Well Laid Trap
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Boar Clan enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck. Each player shuffles his discard pile into his draw deck and draws 1 card. 
  
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, advance to stage 3A.

name: No Way Out
text:
Time X. X is 5 times the number of players in the game. 
  
  If a hero is destroyed at this stage, the players lose the game.  
  
Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, the players make engagement checks. Then, each engaged enemy makes an attack. If no heroes are destroyed by these attacks, the players win the game.

name: Chief Turch
text:
Cannot have attachments. 
  
 Cannot leave play. 
  
 Chief Turch engages the first player. 
  
Forced: After an enemy engages a player, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Munuv Dûv Ravine
text: Dunland enemies get +1 Û and +1 Ú.

name: Old South Road
text: Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Boar Clan Stalker
text:
Boar Clan Stalker gets +1 Û and +1 Ú for each resource token on it (limit +4). 
  
 Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, put a resource token on Boar Clan Stalker.

name: Boar Clan Warrior
text: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, deal Boar Clan Warrior a shadow card.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each shadow card on it.

name: Hithaeglir Foothills
text:
X is the number of resource tokens on this card.  
  
 Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, place 1 resource token here.

name: Hills of Dunland
text:
While Hills of Dunland is in the staging area, it gains: 'Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is a Dunland enemy, put it into play engaged with that player. This ability does not stack with other copies of Hills of Dunland. 
  
 Travel: Each player draws a card to travel here.

name: Plains of Enedwaith
text: While Plains of Enedwaith is the active location, players do not draw a card during the resource phase.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if undefended).

name: Hithaeglir Stream
text: While Hithaeglir Stream is the active location, players draw 2 cards during the resource phase instead of 1.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Deal it an additional shadow card.

name: Frenzied Attack
text: When Revealed: Each player draws a card. Each player discards each ally from his hand. If no allies are discarded this way, Frenzied Attack gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Until the end of the round, attacking enemy cannot take damage.

name: Dunlending Ambush
text: When Revealed: Attach to the active location. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'Limit 1 per location. Forced: After attached location is explored, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dunland enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.')

name: Idraen
text: Response: After a location is explored, ready Idraen.
link: You can use Feint (CORE 34) to prevent him from attacking and thus prevent him from returning to the staging area.  The forced effect happens immediately after determining combat damage and before any player actions.

name: Feigned Voices
text: Combat Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

name: Rúmil
text: Response: After you play Rúmil from your hand, choose an enemy engaged with a player. Deal X damage to that enemy where X is the number of ranged characters you control.
link: If Frodo (SoM 25) is damaged, the defending player's threat is still raised by 1 and then if you decide to cancel Frodo's damage you will raise the threat an additional amount equal to the damage being cancelled.

name: Elven Mail
keywords: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character. Restricted.
text: Attached character gets +2 hit points and gains sentinel.
link: Players have crossed the Anduin when they have reached Stage 4 of the quest.

link: Players have crossed the Anduin when they have reached Stage 4 of the quest.

Players have crossed the Anduin when they have reached Stage 4 of the quest.

name: Message from Elrond
text: Action: Choose a player. That player may choose 1 card from his hand and add it to another player’s hand. At the end of the round, if the chosen card is in that player's hand or in play, shuffle it into its owner's deck.
link: The effect applies to every Scout enemy revealed while this Location is in-play.

name: Noiseless Movement
text:
Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. That enemy does not make engagement checks this round. Then, if your threat is 20 or less
and this is the first time you played a copy of Noiseless Movement this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.
link: Players have crossed the Anduin when they have reached Stage 4 of the quest.

name: Leaf Brooch
keywords: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero.
text: The first event card you play each round that matches the attached hero’s printed sphere gains secrecy 1.
link: Players have crossed the Anduin when they have reached Stage 4 of the quest.  If two copies are in-play and you don't travel to either, each players' threat increases by 6.  If two copies are in-play and you travel to one of them, each players' threat still raises by 3 because you didn't travel to the other one (official answer from Nate).

name: The Trials Begin
text: When Revealed: The players advance to a stage 2A quest of their choice.
link: Players have crossed the Anduin when they have reached Stage 4 of the quest.

name: The Trial of Strength
text:
Each Guardian enemy engages the first player. Barrow locations cannot be the active location and are immune to player card effects.

When the players control the current trial’s Key objective, add all Barrow locations in play to the victory display and immediately advance to a stage 2A of the players’ choice. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, advance to stage 3A, instead.

name: The Trial of Perseverance
text:
Each Guardian enemy engages the first player. Guardian enemies cannot be damaged or leave play except by quest effect.

When the players control the current trial’s Key objective, add all Guardian enemies in play to the victory display and immediately advance to a stage 2A of the players’ choice. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, advance to stage 3A, instead.

name: The Trial of Intuition
text:
Each Guardian enemy engages the first player. Any time players would place progress on this quest, discard an equal number of cards from the encounter deck instead. (Progress is placed on the active location before triggering this effect.)

When the players control the current trial’s Key objective, add all Guardian enemies and Barrow locations in play to the victory display and immediately advance to a stage 2A of the players’ choice. If all stage 2 quests have been
defeated, advance to stage 3A, instead.
link: Players have crossed the Anduin when they have reached Stage 4 of the quest.

name: The Antlered Crown
text:
Each Guardian enemy engages the player who controls the Key objective with a Trait shared by that enemy.

Players cannot defeat this stage unless Hallowed Circle is in the victory display. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Boar's Guardian
text:
Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Boar’s Guardian, the engaged player must discard an ally he controls. Place 2
time counters on Boar’s Guardian.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Wolf’s Guardian, it makes an immediate attack against the engaged player. Place
3 time counters on Wolf’s Guardian.

text: Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Raven’s Guardian, deal 1 damage to each character controlled by the engaged player. Place 4 time counters on Raven’s Guardian.

text:
If unattached, the first player must claim Key of the Boar and attach it to a hero he controls.

If Key of the Boar is discarded, add it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Shuffle Key of the Boar back into the encounter deck.

name: Key of the Wolf
text:
If unattached, the first player must claim Key of the Wolf and attach it to a hero he controls.

If Key of the Wolf is discarded, add it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Shuffle Key of the Wolf back into the encounter deck.

text:
If unattached, the first player must claim Key of the Raven and attach it to a hero he controls.

shadow: Shadow: Shuffle Key of the Raven back into the encounter deck.

text: Forced: After a Guardian enemy attacks, raise each player’s threat by X, where X is that enemy’s $.

text:

Doomed 2.

name: Double Dealings

Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this quest, reduce each player's threat elimination level by 10 for the remainder of the game. Then, place 4 time counters on this stage.

Forced: After 1 or more progress is placed on this quest, cancel all progress and reduce each player's threat by an equal amount.

When all players have 0 threat, immediately proceed to stage 2.

Progress that would be placed on this quest are instead placed on The Crossing of Tharbad.

text: When Revealed: Each player draws 3 cards. Until the end of the round, players cannot play events.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 time counter from the active location.

name: Driven Back
text: When Revealed: Remove all progress from each location in the staging area. Increase the total $ in the staging area by 1 for each progress removed this way. If no progress was removed by this effect, Driven Back gains surge.

name: Aragorn
keywords: Each enemy engaged with you gets -1 Ú.
text: Response: After Aragorn participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, choose an enemy not engaged with you and engage that enemy.

name: Halbarad
text:
While you are engaged with an enemy, Halbarad does not exhaust to commit to a quest. 

You may optionally engage 1 additional enemy during the encounter phase.

name: Weather Hills Watchman
text: Response: After Weather Hills Watchman enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Signal card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Dúnedain Hunter
text: Forced: After Dúnedain Hunter enters play, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a non-unique enemy and put it into play engaged with you. If no enemy enters play by this effect, discard Dúnedain Hunter. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Sarn Ford Sentry
text: Response: After Sarn Ford Sentry enters play, draw 1 card for each enemy engaged with you.

name: Warden of Annúminas
text: Warden of Annúminas gets +1 Ò for each enemy engaged with you.

name: Ranger Summons
keywords: Play only if you control a Dúnedain hero.
text: Planning Action: Shuffle 1 of your set aside Ranger of the North allies with the encounter keyword into the encounter deck. Then, remove Ranger Summons from the game.

name: Tireless Hunters
keywords: Play only before the resolving enemy attacks step.
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage that enemy. Then, discard a shadow card from that enemy, if able.

name: Expert Trackers
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, exhaust a Scout or Ranger character to place X progress tokens on a location. X is the engaged enemy’s printed $.

name: Heir of Valandil
text: Planning Action: Exhaust Heir of Valandil to reduce the cost of the next Dúnedain ally you play this phase by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.

name: Athelas
keywords: Attach to a Dúnedain or Healer hero.
text: Action: Discard Athelas and exhaust attached character to heal all damage on a character. You may discard a Condition attachment from that character.

name: Secret Vigil
keywords: Attach to an enemy. Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets -1 $.
text: Response: When attached enemy is destroyed, reduce each player’s threat by the attached enemy’s printed $.

name: Star Brooch
keywords: Attach to a Dúnedain or Noldor hero. Limit 1 per hero.
text: While you are engaged with an enemy, attached hero gets +1 Ò and cannot have its Ò reduced.

name: Gather Information
text: Response: After this stage is defeated, each player may search his deck for 1 card and add it to his hand. Each player shuffles his deck.

name: Ranger of the North
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a player to take control of Ranger of the North. Then, either deal 2 damage to an enemy or place 2 progress tokens on a location.

name: Iârion
keywords:
X is the number of quest cards in play. 
The first player gains control of Iârion.
text:
Response: After a side quest is revealed from the encounter deck, ready Iârion.
If Iârion leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Orc War Party
text:
While Orc War Party is in the staging area, enemies in the staging area cannot take damage.
The players cannot win the game while Orc War Party is in play.

name: Chetwood Forest
text: Travel: One player chooses and engages an enemy in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player either exhausts a hero he controls, or returns attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Borders of Bree-land
text: While Borders of Bree-land is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, return 1 enemy engaged with a player to the staging area.”
shadow: Shadow: Defending character gets –1 Ú for each quest stage in play.

name: Outlying Homestead
text:
While Outlying Homestead is in the staging area, players cannot reduce their threat. 

Travel: Reveal a card from the encounter deck.

name: Sudden Assault
text: When Revealed: If the total Ò of characters committed to the quest is greater than the total $ in the staging area, each enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the first player. If no attack is made this way, shuffle Sudden Assault and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

name: Surprising Speed
text: When Revealed: Each player returns 1 enemy engaged with him to the staging area. If no enemy was returned to the staging area this way, Surprising Speed gains surge and doomed 1.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Orc Rearguard
text:
No more than 3 progress tokens can be placed on the current quest each round.

While Orc Rearguard is the current quest it gains: “Forced: At the end of the staging step, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck.”

name: Rescue Iârion
text:
Time 4. When Revealed: The first player loses control of Iârion and places him facedown underneath this stage. When this stage is defeated, the first player takes control of Iârion and exhausts him. 

Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard Iârion.

name: Cornered Orc
text: Forced: After Cornered Orc engages a player, it makes an immediate attack.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending character is damaged).

name: Amon Forn
text: While Amon Forn is the active location, it gains: “Forced: After an Orc enemy is added to the staging area, it makes an immediate attack against the first player.” The players cannot win while Amon Forn is in play.

name: Weathered Hilltop
keywords: Weathered Hilltop gets +1 $ for each resource token on it.
text: Forced: After a Weather treachery is revealed from the encounter deck, place 1 resource token here.

name: Exposed Ridge
text: While Exposed Ridge is the active location, it gains: “Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, each player deals 1 damage to a character he controls.”
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each damaged character the defending player controls.

name: Sheltered Valley
text:
While Sheltered Valley is the active location, it gains: “Response: When Sheltered Valley is explored, heal all damage from 1 character.” 

Travel: Remove 1 resource token from the Mission objective.

name: Concealed Orc-camp
text:
While Concealed Orc-camp is the active location, it gains: “Response: When Concealed Orc-camp is explored, place 1 resource token on the Mission objective.” 

Travel: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Ice Storm
text: When Revealed: Each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of quest cards in play. Then, exhaust each damaged character.
shadow: Shadow: Assign X damage among characters you control. X is the number of quest cards in play.

name: Find Shelter
text: Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this quest card, each player deals 4 damage to a hero he controls. Then, place 4 time counters on this quest card.

name: Thaurdir
text: Forced: After a treachery card with the Sorcery trait is revealed from the encounter deck, Thaurdir heals 3 damage and makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Thaurdir's Damned
text: Forced: After Thaurdir’s Damned engages you, discard the top 2 cards of your deck and assign X damage among characters you control. X is the combined printed cost of the discarded cards.

name: Baleful Shade
text: Forced: When Baleful Shade attacks, the defending player discards the top card of his deck. If the discarded card is an ally, Baleful Shade gets +2 Û for this attack.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

name: Broken Battlements
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Broken Battlements, each player discards the top 5 cards of his deck and places 1 time counter here.

Travel: Each player discards the top card of his deck.

name: Norbury Tombs
text:
While Norbury Tombs is the active location, it gains: “Response: When Norbury Tombs is explored, each player shuffl es the top 5 cards of his discard pile back into his deck.”

Travel: Return the topmost enemy in the encounter discard pile to the staging area.

name: Fornost Square
keywords: Fornost Square gets +1 $ for each resource token on it.
text: Forced: After the first player discards any number of cards from the top of his deck, place 1 resource token here.

name: Haunted Keep
text: While Haunted Keep is the active location, the first Undead enemy revealed each round gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards the top card of his deck. Attacking enemy gets +X Û where X is the discarded card’s printed cost.

name: Deadmen's Gate
text: While Deadmen’s Gate is the active location, it gains: “Forced: After a player triggers an ‘Action’ or ‘Response’ effect, he must discard the top card of his deck.”
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control.

name: Unnatural Fog
text: When Revealed: Each player must either discard 1 card from the top of his deck for each questing character he controls, or remove each character he controls from the quest.

name: The Shadow World
text: Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, each player discards the top X cards of his deck, where X is the number of Undead enemies engaged with him.

name: Angmar Orc
text: When Revealed: Either discard 1 ally from play, or reveal an additional encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys an ally, return attacking enemy to the staging area.

name: Angmar Marauder
text: Forced: After Angmar Marauder attacks and destroys an ally, return it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each ally the defending player controls.

name: Angmar Captain
text: Forced: After Angmar Captain attacks and destroys an ally, discard the top card of the defending player’s deck. If the discarded card is an ally, Angmar Captain makes an additional attack against the defending player.

name: Orc Ambush
keywords: Each Orc enemy gets +1 $, +1 Û, and +1 Ú.
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Rugged Country
text: If the current quest is a side quest, Rugged Country gets +2 $.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each quest card in play.

name: Shrouded Hills
keywords: X is the number of quest cards in play.
text: While there is only 1 quest card in play, Shrouded Hills gains surge.

name: Pressing Needs
text: When Revealed: Either search the encounter deck and discard pile for an encounter side quest and reveal it, or choose a different quest card in play to be the current quest until the end of the phase. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Weight of Responsibility
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card for each quest card in play.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards 1 attachment he controls for each quest card in play.

name: Lost in the Wilderness
text:
When Revealed: Each player places all cards in his hand facedown underneath Lost in the Wilderness.

Forced: When Lost in the Wilderness is defeated, return each card underneath to its owner’s hand.

name: Biting Wind
text: When Revealed: Assign X damage among characters committed to the quest. X is the number of characters committed to the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

name: Freezing Blast
text: When Revealed: Remove each damaged character from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each damaged character the defending player controls.

name: Cold from Angmar
text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a hero he controls. Then, attach Cold from Angmar to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Treat each damaged character’s printed text box as if it were blank, except for keywords and Traits.”)

name: Make Camp
text:
Characters cannot be healed.

Response: After Make Camp is defeated, each player heals up to 3 damage from a hero he controls.

name: Ruins of Arnor
text: Forced: After the “when revealed” effect of a treachery card is canceled, raise each player’s threat by 2.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, the defending player raises his threat by 2.

name: Ancient Causeway
text: Forced: When Ancient Causeway is explored, raise each player's threat by 2.

name: Tragic Discovery
text: When Revealed: Raise each player’s threat by the $ of the active location.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player either raises his threat by 3, or this attack is considered undefended.

name: Search the Ruins
text:
Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, raise each player’s threat by 2.

Response: After Search the Ruins is defeated, reduce each player’s threat by 3.

name: Dead Lord
