text: Forced: After Dead Lord engages you, put the topmost Undead enemy in the discard pile into play engaged with you.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, reveal 1 encounter card.

name: Cursed Dead
text: When Revealed: Put each copy of Cursed Dead in the discard pile into play in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if there is a copy of the defending character in its owner’s discard pile).

name: Restless Evil
text: When Revealed: Each Undead enemy gets +1 $, +1 Û, and +1 Ú until the end of the round. If there are no Undead enemies in play, Restless Evil gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Each Undead enemy engaged with you gets +1 Û and +1 Ú until the end of the round.

name: Seal the Tomb
text: Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Return the topmost Undead enemy in the encounter discard pile to the staging area.

name: Terror of the North
text: When Revealed: Each player discards the top 3 cards of his deck. Until the end of the round, add 2 to the total $ in the staging area for each different card type discarded this way.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards the top 3 cards of his deck. Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each different card type discarded this way.

name: Dark Sorcery
text: When Revealed: Each player discards each ally he controls that has the same title as a card in his discard pile.
shadow: Shadow: Discard the defending character if there is a copy of that character in its owner’s discard pile.

name: Heavy Curse
text: When Revealed: Attach to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “When a player plays a card, increase its cost by 1 if there is a card that has the same title in its owner’s discard pile.”)

name: The Power of Angmar
text:
Cards in each player’s discard pile cannot leave that player’s discard pile by player card effect.

Forced: After this stage is defeated, each player shuffl es the top 5 cards of his discard pile back into his deck.

name: Stop the War Party
text:
Enemies do not make engagement checks.

Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, raise each player's threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area.

If the players control Iarion and defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Scattered Among the Hills
text:
The first Weather treachery revealed each round gains surge.

Forced: After the active location is explored, reveal the top card of the Orc deck and resolve its staging as if it was just revealed from the encounter deck (the top 2 cards instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).

name: Cornered Animals
text:
Each damaged character gets -1 Ò.

Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, either discard 1 resource token from Savage Counter-attack, or reveal an additional encounter card this phase.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Hunting the Orcs
text:
Forced: After Savage Counter-attack enters play, advance to stage 2A.

Forced: After an enemy attacks and destroys a character, discard 1 resource token here.

If there are no resource tokens here, the players lose the game.

name: The Shades of Angmar
text:
When Revealed: Each player musst search the encounter deck for a Baleful Shade and put it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 encounter card per player.

Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, each player discards the top card of his deck.

If a player has no cards in his deck, he is eliminated from the game.

name: A Fell Wraith
text:
Forced: After Thaurdir attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller must either discard the top 3 cards of his deck, or return Thaurdir to the staging area.

If a player has no cards in his deck, he is eliminated from the game. The players cannot defeat this stage while Thaurdir has any hit points remaining. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Merry
text: Response: After an enemy is revealed from the top of the encounter deck, exhaust Merry to lower your threat by that enemy’s $.

name: Ingold
text: Ingold gets +1 Ò for each hero you control with at least 1 resource in its resource pool.

name: Rallying Cry
text:
Response: After an ally leaves play, add it to its owner’s hand instead of placing it in the discard pile.

Valour Action: Until the end of the phase, add each ally that leaves play to its owner’s hand instead of placing it in the discard pile.

name: Honour Guard
text:
Response: Exhaust Honour Guard to cancel 1 point of damage just dealt to a character.

Valour Response: Exhaust and discard Honour Guard to cancel up to 5 points of damage just dealt to a character.

name: Raven-winged Helm
keywords: Attach to a hero with sentinel. Limit 1 per hero.
text: Response: Exhaust Raven-winged Helm to cancel 1 point of damage just dealt to attached character.

name: Curious Brandybuck
text:
Forced: When the active location is explored, place Curious Brandybuck on the bottom of its owner’s deck.

Response: After you travel to a location, put Curious Brandybuck into play from your hand, under any player’s control.

name: Hobbit Pony
keywords: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Restricted.
text: Quest Action: If attached hero is not committed to the quest, exhaust Hobbit Pony and attached hero to commit attached hero to the quest.

name: East Road Ranger
text: East Road Ranger gets +2 Ò while committed to a side quest.

name: Scout Ahead
text: Response: When this stage is defeated, the first player searches the top X cards of the encounter deck for 1 non-objective card worth no victory points and adds it to the victory display. Put the remaining cards back in any order. X is the number of players in the game plus 4.

name: Ranger of Cardolan
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, if you control at least 1 Dunedain hero, spend 1 resource to put Ranger of Cardolan into play from your hand, under your control. At the end of the round, if Ranger of Cardolan is still in play, shuffle it into its owner’s deck.

name: Daybreak
keywords: It is Night. Progress cannot be placed on quest cards. Encounter card effects cannot be canceled.
text:
Forced: When it becomes Night, reveal an encounter card.

Forced: At the end of the round, flip this objective.

name: Across the Wastes
text:
While it is Day, heroes get +1 Ò.

Forced: When it becomes Night, raise each player's threat by 1.

name: Howling at Night
text:
Forced: When it becomes Day, each player draws 1 card.

Forced: When it becomes Night, discard 1 non-objective ally from play (discard 2 non-objective allies instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).

name: Battle with the Pack
text:
Pack Leader cannot take damage unless there are at least 5 progress tokens on this stage.

Forced: When it becomes Day, discard all progress from this stage.

The players cannot defeat this stage while Pack Leader is in play. If Pack Leader is destroyed, the players win the game.

name: Amarthiúl
text:
Response: After an enemy engages a player, give control of Amarthiúl to that player.

If Amarthiúl leaves play, the player lose the game.

name: Pack Leader
keywords:
Cannot have attachments.
Cannot be optionally engaged.
text: Forced: After Pack Leader engages you, exhaust a character you control for each Warg enemy engaged with you.

name: Northern Warg
text: When Revealed: Each Warg enemy gets +1 $ until the end of the phase.
shadow: Shadow: After this attack, attacking enemy engages the next player, then makes an immediate attack (deal a new shadow card for that attack).

name: Blood-thirsty Warg
text: While Blood-thirsty Warg is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: When it becomes Night, Blood-thirsty Warg engages the first player and makes an immediate attack.”

name: Hunting Pack
text: When a player is making an engagement check against Hunting Pack, it gets –1 engagement cost for each damaged character that player controls.

name: White Warg
text: Forced: After White Warg engages you, deal 1 damage to a character you control (2 damage instead if it is Night).
shadow: Shadow: If it is Night, attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Wolf of Angmar
text: While it is Night, Wolf of Angmar gets +2 Û.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if it is Night).

name: Eriador Wastes
text:
While Eriador Wastes is in the staging area, no more than 5 progress can be placed on the current quest each round.

Travel: The first player engages a Warg enemy in the staging area and deals it a shadow card.

name: Warg's Den
text: Travel: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Warg enemy, reveals it, and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: North Downs
keywords: While it is Night, North Downs gets +2 $.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, remove all progress from the current quest.

name: Sudden Darkness
text: When Revealed: If it is Night, raise each player's threat by 4. If it is Day, flip the Time objective to Nightfall.
shadow: Shadow: Put the topmost Warg enemy from the discard pile into play engaged with you and deal it a shadow card.

name: Predatory Wolves
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either discard the highest cost ally he controls, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Warg enemy, reveal it, and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

name: Rossiel
text:
If the active location shares a Trait with a location in the victory display, Rossiel gets +2 Ò.

If an attacking enemy shares a Trait with an enemy in the victory display, Rossiel gets +2 Ú.

name: Veteran of Osgiliath
text: Veteran of Osgiliath gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú while your threat is 40 or higher.

name: Descendants of Kings
text: Action: Ready X Dúnedain characters you control. X is the number of enemies engaged with you.

name: Derndingle Warrior
keywords:
Sentinel.
Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted.
text: While Derndingle Warrior is defending, it gains: “Action: Deal 1 damage to Derndingle Warrior to give it +3 Ú for this attack.” (Limit once per attack.)

name: Boomed and Trumpeted
text: Response: After an Ent character takes any amount of damage, ready it. That character gets +2 Û until the end of the phase.

name: Elven Jeweler
text: Action: Discard 2 cards from your hand to put Elven Jeweler into play from your hand, under your control.

name: Double Back
text: Response: When this stage is defeated, reduce each player's threat by 5.

name: Leave No Trace
keywords: Limit 3 copies of Leave No Trace in the victory display.
text: Response: After a non-unique location is explored, add Leave No Trace to the victory display to add that location to the victory display.

name: Distant Stars
text: Action: Exhaust a Ranger or Scout character to discard a non-unique active location. Then, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a non-unique location and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Keen as Lances
keywords: Reduce the cost to play Keen as Lanches by 1 for each card worth no victory points in the victory display.
text: Action: Add Keen as Lances to the victory display. Then, choose one: add 2 resources to a hero’s resource pool, draw 3 cards, or lower your threat by 4.

name: Unexpected Rescue
text: When Revealed: Each player creates his own staging area and advances to a different stage 2A.

name: Gornákh's Dungeons
text:
Any time players would place progress tokens on this quest, rescue an equal number of captured cards at random from underneath it instead. (Progress is placed on the active location before triggering this effect.) 

Forced: If there are no captured cards underneath Gornákh’s Dungeons, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players advance to stage 3A together.

name: Flight from Mount Gram
text:
Players cannot travel to Southern Gate unless there is at least 14 progress on this stage.

Players cannot defeat this stage while Southern Gate is in play. If the players defeat this stage, they have escaped Mount Gram and win the game.

name: Jailor Gornákh
text: Forced: When 1 or more captured cards are rescued, Jailor Gornákh engages the player with the highest threat and makes an immediate attack.

name: Southern Gate
text:
While Southern Gate is the active location, each Orc enemy gets +2 Û.

Forced: After Souther Gate becomes the active location, each player with less than 35 threat must raise their threat to 35.

name: Cruel Torturer
text: Forced: When Cruel Torturer would damage a character by an attack, capture that character underneath Cruel Torturer instead.

name: Dungeon Guard
text: Response: After the captured card(s) underneath Dungeon Guard are rescued, the players may put 1 of them into play at no cost.

name: Goblin Tormentor
keywords: X is the number of cards in play with 1 or more captured cards underneath it.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if it has no captured cards underneath it).

name: Prison Cell
text: Response: After the players travel to Prison Cell, look at the captured card(s) underneath it and choose 1 to put into play at no cost. Place the other cards back underneath Prison Cell.

name: Patrol Room
text: Travel: Each player raises his threat by 3 to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending player’s threat is 20 or higher).

name: Tunnels of Mount Gram
text: X is the number of cards captured underneath Tunnels of Mount Gram.
shadow: Shadow: Capture each attachment attached to the defending character underneath the attacking enemy.

name: Sound the Alarm!
text: When Revealed: If there are no enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and add it to the staging area. Until the end of the round, each enemy gets –10 engagement cost and +1 Û.

name: Feeble and Weary
text: When Revealed: Each player must either deal 1 damage to each exhausted character he controls, or remove each exhausted character he controls from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

name: Captives of Gornákh
text: When Revealed: Each player chooses one of their allies and captures it underneath the encounter card with the highest $.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack damages a character, capture that character underneath the attacking enemy instead of dealing damage.

name: Interrogation
text: When Revealed: Each player discards the top card of his captured deck and raises his threat by that card’s printed resource cost. If at least 1 player discarded no cards from this effect, Interrogation gains doomed 2.
shadow: Shadow: Shuffle 2 random cards from your hand into your captured deck.

name: Stop the Executioners!
text: Time 4. Forced: When the last time counter is removed from this quest, discard its captured cards and remove this quest from the game. Then, raise each player’s threat by 3 for each of his characters that was discarded by this effect.

name: Dori
text: Response: After another hero is declared as a defender, exhaust Dori to add his Ú to the defending hero’s Ú for this attack.

name: Ranger Provisions
keywords: Attach to a location. Limit 1 per location.
text: Response: After attached location is explored, the first player adds 1 resource to each of his heroes’ resource pools.

name: Dúnedain Message
text: Action: Search your deck for a side quest and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Longbeard Sentry
text: Action: Discard 2 cards from the top of your deck to give Longbeard Sentry sentinel and +1 Ú until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Delay the Enemy
text: Response: When this stage is defeated, each player may choose and discard a non-unique enemy engaged with him.

name: Steed of Imladris
keywords: Attach to a Ê or Noldor hero. Restricted.
text: Response: After attached hero commits to the quest, discard a card from your hand to place 2 progress on the active location.

name: Fair and Perilous
text: Action: Choose a Noldor or Silvan character. Until the end of the phase, add that character’s Ò to its Û.

name: Wellinghall Preserver
keywords: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted.
text: Response: After Wellinghall Preserver readies, heal 1 damage from an Ent character.

name: None Return
keywords: Limit 3 copies of None Return in the victory display.
text: Response: After a non-unique enemy is destroyed, add None Return to the victory display to add that enemy to the victory display.

name: Hope Rekindled
text:
Action: Lower the cost of the next event that has a Valour trigger you play this phase by 2.

Valour Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for an event that has a Valour trigger and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Into the Ettenmoors
text:
Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, if there are no encounter side quests in play, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a side quest is discarded, and add it to the staging area.

Forced: When a side quest is defeated, place progress tokens on Into the Ettenmoors equal to that side quest's quest points.

name: A Miserable Journey
text: Reveal 1 additional encounter card during the quest phase unless there is an active location with the safe keyword.

name: Journey's End
text:
Each damaged character gets –2 Ò unless there is an active location with
the safe keyword.

If the players defeat this stage, they have escaped the Ettenmoors
with their lives, and win the game.

name: Amarthiúl
text:
Response: After an enemy engages a player, give control of Amarthiúl to that player.

If Amarthiúl leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Secluded Cave
keywords:
Guarded. Safe.
Immune to player card effects.
text: Response: After you travel to Secluded Cave, each player draws 3 cards.

name: The Hoarwell
keywords:
Guarded. Safe.
Immune to player card effects.
text: Response: After you travel to The Hoarwell, heal 1 damage from each character in play.

name: Abandoned Camp
keywords:
Guarded. Safe.
Immune to player card effects.
text: Response: After you travel to Abandoned Camp, each player may return 1 card from his discard pile to his hand.

name: Patch of Woods
keywords:
Guarded. Safe.
Immune to player card effects.
text: Response: After you travel to Patch of Woods, each player adds 1 resource to each of his heroes’ resource pools.

name: Savage Trollspawn
text: Savage Trollspawn gets +1 Û for each damaged character the engaged player controls.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each damaged character the defending player controls.

name: Coldfell Giant
text: Forced: After Coldfell Giant engages you, deal 1 damage to 3 different characters you control.
shadow: Shadow: If the defending character has at least 1 damage token on it, attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Cruel Mountain-troll
text: For each excess point of combat damage dealt by Cruel Mountain-troll (damage that is dealt beyond the remaining hit points of the character damaged by its attack) you must remove 1 progress from each quest card in play.

name: Ruthless Hill-troll
text: Ruthless Hill-troll gets +2 Û and +2 Ú while it has 3 or more damage on it.
shadow: Shadow: Shuffle 1 location with the safe keyword (but not its attached encounter) back into the encounter deck.

name: Goblin Pursuer
text: Damaged characters cannot be declared as attackers or defenders against Golbin Pursuer.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if this attack is undefended).

name: Troll-fells
text:
While Troll-fells is the active location, Weather cards gain doomed 1.

When Revealed: If Troll-fells is not revealed guarding a safe location, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a location with the safe keyword and attach it to Troll-fells, guarded. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Barren Moorland
text:
While Barren Moorland is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: When an ally enters play, you must either exhaust it or deal 1 damage to it.”

Travel: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character.

name: Arador's Bane
text: When Revealed: Starting with the first player, each player must either engage an enemy in the staging area with a higher engagement cost than his threat, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Troll or Giant enemy and add it to the staging area. Deal each enemy that engages a player through this effect 2 shadow cards.

name: No Rest
text: When Revealed: Attach to an exhausted hero, or to a ready hero if there are no exhausted heroes. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero cannot ready and does not collect resources during the resource phase. Discard No Rest if the players travel to a safe location.”)

name: Lie Low
text:
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if no progress was placed on Lie Low this round, each enemy gets –20 engagement cost until the end of the round.

Response: After this stage is defeated, choose an enemy in the staging area and shuffle it into the encounter deck.

name: Forage for Food
text:
Forced: After 1 or more resources are spent from a hero’s resource pool, deal 1 damage to that hero.

Response: After this stage is defeated, heal 1 damage from each hero.

name: Scavenge for Supplies
text:
The cost to play each player card is increased by 1.

Forced: When this stage is defeated, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Troll enemy and put it into play engaged with the player with the highest threat. Each player may play a card from his hand, at no cost.

name: Erestor
text:
Draw 3 additional cards at the beginning of the resource phase.

At the end of the round, discard all cards in your hand.

name: Reinforcements
keywords: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card.
text: Action: The players, as a group, can put up to 2 allies into play from their hands. Each of these allies may enter play under any player's control. At the end of the phase, return each of those allies that are still in play to their owners' hands.

name: Send for Aid
text: Response: When this stage is defeated, each player may search the top 10 cards of his deck for an ally and put it into play under his control. Each player who did shuffles his deck.

name: Elven Spear
keywords: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero. Restricted.
text: Action: Discard a card from your hand to give attached hero +1 Û until the end of the phase. Limit 3 times per phase.

name: Horn's Cry
text:
Action:All enemies get -1 Û until the end of the phase.

Valour Action: Choose a player. Each enemy engaged with that player gets -3 Û until the end of the phase.

name: Galadhrim Weaver
text: Response: After Galadhrim Weaver enters play, shuffle the top card of your discard pile into your deck.

name: Silver Harp
keywords: Attach to a Ê hero. Restricted.
text: Response: After a card is discarded from your hand, exhaust Silver Harp to return that card to your hand.

name: Galdor of the Havens
text: Response: After 1 or more cards are discarded from your hand, draw 1 card. Limit once per round.

name: The Door is Closed!
text: Response: After an encounter card is revealed from the encounter deck, cancel its effects and discard it if there is a card with the same title in the victory display.

name: Elf-friend
text: Attached character gains the Noldor and Silvan traits.

name: Secrets of Rhudaur
text:
Time 5. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Secrets of Rhudaur, remove each Treachery of Rhudaur side quest from the game and immediately advance to stage 2.

During the quest phase, Secrets of Rhudaur cannot be chosen as the current quest.

If there are no Treachery of Rhudaur side quests in play, immediately advance to stage 2.

name: Thaurdir's Pursuit
text:
Thaurdir’s Pursuit has –5 quest points for each Clue objective attached to a character.

This stage cannot be defeated while Thaurdir has any hit points remaining. When this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

name: Amarthiúl
text:
Response: After an enemy engages a player, give control of Amarthiúl to that player.

If Amarthiúl leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: The Great Hall
text: Forced: When The Great Hall is explored, each player discards the top 5 cards of the encounter deck and chooses an Undead enemy he discarded in this way to add to the staging area.

name: Thaurdir
text: Forced: After a treachery card with the Sorcery trait is revealed from the encounter deck, Thaurdir heals 3 damage and makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Wight of Rhudaur
text:
While the current quest has 1 or more progress on it, Wight of Rhudaur gains surge.

While the current quest has 0 progress on it, Wight of Rhudaur gains doomed 2.

name: Traitorous Wight
text: Forced: When Traitorous Wight engages a player, remove 2 progress from each quest card in play.
shadow: Shadow: For each point of damage dealt by this attack, remove 1 progress from each quest in play.

name: Forbidden Descent
text:
While Forbidden Descent is in the staging area, the first 2 progress that would be placed on a quest each round must be placed on Forbidden Descent, instead.

Forced: If Forbidden Descent leaves play from the staging area, raise each player’s threat by 2.

name: Eerie Halls
text: Action: Raise your threat by 1 to lower the $ of Eerie Halls by 1 until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this action.
shadow: Shadow: If the defending player does not control at least 1 Clue objective, the attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Ghostly Ruins
text:
Any time the encounter deck runs out of cards, return the topmost Undead enemy in the encounter discard pile to the staging area before resetting the encounter deck.

Travel: Return the topmost Undead enemy in the encounter discard pile to the staging area.

name: Decrepit Remains
text: While Decrepit Remains is in the staging area, each location and quest in the staging area gets +2 quest points.
shadow: Shadow: For each point of damage dealt by this attack, remove 1 progress from each quest in play.

name: Centuries of Sorrow
text: When Revealed: The first player must choose a new quest to be the current quest, if able.
shadow: Shadow: If the defending player does not control at least 1 Clue objective, this attack is considered undefended.

name: Curse of the Years
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character. Each player with a threat of 35 or higher must also discard each exhausted attachment he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if the defending player does not control at least 1 Clue objective).

name: Dark Covenant
text: When Revealed: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. The first player must either remove X progress from among the quests in play, or assign X damage among characters he controls. X is the total $ of the discarded cards.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, raise your threat by the destroyed character’s Ò.

name: Haunting Fog
text: When Revealed: Each player must exhaust a character he controls. Attach Haunting Fog to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Attached quest gets +6 quest points.”)

name: Quiet the Spirits
text:
Action: Exhaust Amarthiúl or a hero to claim Daechanar’s Brand. Then, attach Daechanar’s Brand to that character.

Attached character gets +1 Û while attacking Undead enemies.

name: Daechanar's Brand
text:
Action: Exhaust Amarthiúl or a hero to claim Daechanar’s Brand. Then, attach Daechanar’s Brand to that character.

Attached character gets +1 Û while attacking Undead enemies.

name: Sift Through the Debris
text:
Action: Exhaust Amarthiúl or a hero to claim Heirloom of Iârchon. Then, attach Heirloom of Iârchon to that character.

Attached character gets +1 Ò.

name: Heirloom of Iârchon
text:
Action: Exhaust Amarthiúl or a hero to claim Heirloom of Iârchon. Then, attach Heirloom of Iârchon to that character.

Attached character gets +1 Ò.

name: Decipher Ancient Texts
text:
Action: Exhaust Amarthiúl or a hero to claim Orders from Angmar. Then, attach Orders from Angmar to that character.

Attached character gets +1 Ú while defending against Undead enemies.

name: Orders from Angmar
text:
Action: Exhaust Amarthiúl or a hero to claim Orders from Angmar. Then, attach Orders from Angmar to that character.

Attached character gets +1 Ú while defending against Undead enemies.

name: Amarthiúl
text:
While you are engaged with at least 1 enemy, Amarthiúl gains the Ï resource icon.

While you are engaged with at least 2 enemies, add 1 additional resource to Amarthiúl's resource pool when you collect resources during the resource phase.

name: Guardian of Arnor
text: Guardian of Arnor gets +1 Ú for each enemy engaged with you.

name: Doom Hangs Still
text:
Planning Action: Until the end of the round, players do not raise their threat from questing unsuccessfully.

Valour Planning Action: Skip the quest phase this round.

name: Beechbone
keywords: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted.
text: Response: After Beechbone is declared as an attacker, deal 1 damage to him to deal X damage to the defending enemy. X is the amount of damage on Beechbone.

name: Hold Your Ground!
text:
Action: Choose and ready a sentinel character.

Valour Action: Ready all sentinel characters.

name: Lindir
text: Response: After Lindir enters play, if you have less than 3 cards in your hand, draw until you have 3 cards in your hand.

name: Lords of the Eldar
keywords: Lords of the Eldar can only be played from your discard pile.
text: Action: Place Lords of the Eldar on the bottom of your deck from your discard pile. Then, until the end of the round all Noldor characters get +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú.

name: The Long Defeat
keywords: Attach to a quest card in play. Limit 1 per quest.
text: Response: After attached quest card is defeated, each player either draws 2 cards or heals up to 5 damage from characters he controls.

name: Quick Ears
text: Response: Exhaust a Dúnedain or Ranger hero to cancel an enemy card just revealed from the encounter deck. Then, shuffle it back into the encounter deck and reveal an additional encounter card.

name: Favor of the Valar
keywords: Attach to a player's threat dial. Limit 1 per player.
text: Forced: When you would be eliminated by reaching your threat elimination level, instead discard Favor of the Valar and reduce your threat to 5 lower than your threat elimination level. You are not eliminated.

name: The Clutches of Carn Dûm
text:
Thaurdir cannot leave the staging area and cannot take damage. At the end of the round, if Thaurdir is Champion side face-up, flip him.

Do not discard unresolved shadow cards at the end of the combat phase.

Forced: If there are 3 shadow cards dealt to Thaurdir, flip him.

name: Midwinter's Crux
text:
Thaurdir cannot leave the staging area, is considered to be engaged with each player, and attacks each player in turn during the combat phase (deal and discard a new shadow card for each attack). At the end of the round, if Thaurdir is Captain side face-up, flip him.

While Sever the Head has 15 or more progress on it, Thaurdir loses Indestructible.

You cannot defeat this stage while Thaurdir is in play. If Thaurdir is defeated, you win the game.

name: Thaurdir
text:
Each other enemy has -10 engagement cost.
Forced: After Thaurdir is flipped or a treachery card with the Sorcery trait is revealed, Thaurdir heals 3 damage and makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Carn Dûm Garrison
text: Carn Dûm Garrison gets +1 $ for each shadow card currently dealt to it.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each shadow card currently dealt to it.

name: Orc Grunts
text: Any time progress is placed on the current quest, reduce the amount of progress placed by 1.
shadow: Shadow: Add Orc Grunts to the staging area.

name: Werewolf of Angmar
text:
Forced: After an event card is played, deal 1 shadow card to Werewolf of Angmar. 

Forced: If there are 3 shadow cards dealt to Werewolf of Angmar and it is in the staging area, it engages the first player and makes an immediate attack (do not deal it another shadow card for this attack).

name: Accursed Battlefield
text: While Accursed Battlefield is the active location, each quest card in play gains the battle keyword.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if the defending player's threat is higher than the attacking enemy's engagement cost).

name: Mountains of Angmar
text: While Mountains of Angmar is the active location, each shadow card with no shadow effect gains "Shadow: Raise defending player's threat by 2."
shadow: Shadow: Raise defending player's threat by 2.

name: Blight of Carn Dûm
text:
Forced: After an enemy attacks, heal 1 damage from it.
Travel: Deal each enemy in play 1 shadow card to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: If the attacking enemy is Thaurdir, heal 3 damage from him.

name: Fortress Walls
text: While Fortress Walls is the active location, for each resource spent by a player, raise that player’s threat by 1.
shadow: Shadow: If your threat is 40 or higher, attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: The Sky Darkens
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard a random card from his hand. Each player then searches his deck for each other copy of the card he discarded, and discards those as well. Shuffle each searched deck.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a random card from the defending player's hand.

name: Vile Affliction
text: When Revealed: Each player must distribute damage among questing characters he controls equal to the printed cost of the highest cost card in that player’s discard pile.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys an ally, search your deck for another copy of that ally and discard it, if able.

name: Daechanar's Will
text: When Revealed: Flip Thaurdir. Then, if he is Captain side face-up, Daechanar's Will gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Flip Thaurdir after this attack.

name: Furious Charge
text:
Forced: When at least 1 progress is placed on Furious Charge, each character gets –2 Ú until the end of the round. If Thaurdir is Captain side faceup, flip him.

Response: After Furious Charge is defeated, add 10 progress to the main quest.

name: Arwen Undómiel
text: Action: Discard a card from your hand to add 1 resource to a Noldor hero's resource pool, or to Aragorn's resource pool. (Limit once per round.)

name: Éothain
text: Response: After a Rohan ally is discarded from play by a card effect, ready Éothain.

name: Sword of Númenor
keywords: Attach to a Dúnedain or Gondor hero. Restricted.
text:
Attached hero gets +1 Û.

Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy with 5 or more printed hit points, exhaust Sword of Númenor to add 1 resource to attached hero’s resource pool.

name: Fornost Bowman
text: Fornost Bowman gets +1 Û for each enemy engaged with you.

name: Hour of Wrath
text:
Action: Choose a hero. Until the end of the phase, the chosen hero does not exhaust to attack or defend.

Valour Action: Until the end of the phase, heroes do not exhaust to attack or defend.

name: Elven-light
keywords: Elven-light can only be played from your discard pile.
text: Action: Return Elven-light to your hand from your discard pile. Then, draw 1 card.

name: Tale of Tinúviel
text: Action: Exhaust a Noldor character to ready a Dúnedain character, or vice-versa. Until the end of the phase, add the exhausted character’s printed Ò to the other character’s Ò, Û, and Ú.

name: Galadhrim Healer
text: Response: After Galadhrim Healer enters play, choose a player. Heal 1 damage from each hero controlled by that player.

name: Weather-stained Cloak
keywords: Attach to a Ranger character. Limit 1 per character
text: While attached character is committed to the quest, Weather-stained Cloak gains: “Response: Exhaust Weather-stained Cloak to cancel 1 point of damage just dealt to attached character.”

name: Sword-thain
keywords: Attach to a unique ally belonging to any sphere of influence.
text: Attached character loses the ally card type and gains the hero card type.

name: The Catacombs of Carn Dûm
text:
Reanimated Dead are Undead enemies with 2 $, 2 Û, 2 Ú and 2 hit points. 

When the players advance to stage 2, all Sorcery cards attached to this stage are attached to stage 2B.

name: Angmar Awakened
text:
Reanimated Dead are Undead enemies with 2 $, 2 Û, 2 Ú and 2 hit points.

When Daechanar is defeated, advance to the next stage.

name: Daechanar's Fall
text:
Reanimated Dead are Undead enemies with 2 $, 2 Û, 2 Ú and 2 hit points.

Progress that would be placed on this quest is instead placed on locations in the staging area, divided as you choose.

Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if there are any locations in play, deal 1 damage to all characters in play. If there are no locations in play, the players have escaped Carn Dûm, and win the game.

name: Daechanar
text:
Cannot have attachments.

Daechanar gets +1 Û for each Sorcery card in play, and gains indestructible while at least 1 Sorcery card is in play.

Forced: When Daechanar is damaged, if there is at least 1 Sorcery card in play, cancel all damage just dealt and remove a Sorcery card from the game.

name: Altar of Midwinter
keywords: While Daechanar is in play, progress cannot be placed on Altar of Midwinter.
text: Forced: At the end of the staging step, the first player must either reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck, or reanimate the top card of his deck.

name: Dwimmerlaik
text: Forced: After Dwimmerlaik attacks and destroys a character, the defending player reanimates that character and deals it 1 shadow card.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, reanimate that character and deal it 1 shadow card.

name: Witch of Angmar
text: Forced: When you resolve shadow cards dealt to Witch of Angmar, if they have the Sorcery trait, resolve their “when revealed” effects. (Resolve any shadow effects first.)

name: Wraith of Carn Dûm
text: Forced: When Wraith of Carn Dûm leaves play, attach it to a character in play. (Counts as a Sorcery attachment with the text: “Attached character has –1 Ò, –1 Û, and –1 Ú. If the attached character leaves play, return Wraith of Carn Dûm to the staging area as an enemy.”)

name: Sinister Dungeon
text: Forced: When Sinister Dungeon is explored, the first player reanimates a random card from his hand and deals Sinister Dungeon to it as a shadow card.
shadow: Shadow: Discard the top 2 cards of the encounter deck. Resolve the “when revealed” effects of each Sorcery card discarded by this effect.

name: Tombs of Carn Dûm
text:
Forced: At the end of the round, discard the top card of each player’s deck. Each player must reanimate each ally discarded by this effect.

Travel: Deal 1 shadow card to each Undead enemy in play to travel here.

name: Dark Halls
text: While Dark Halls is in the staging area, each Reanimated Dead gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.
shadow: Shadow: If there is a copy of the defending character in your discard pile, reanimate it and deal it 1 shadow card.

name: Unholy Crypt
text: Unholy Crypt gets +1 $ for each Reanimated Dead in play.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, reanimate that character and deal it 1 shadow card.

name: Possession
text: When Revealed: Destroy the highest cost ally in play. That ally’s controller reanimates that character, adds it to the staging area, and attaches Possession to it. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “If Possession is discarded, the attached card is also discarded.”)

name: A Fell Dread
text: When Revealed: The player with the highest threat must attach A Fell Dread to a hero he controls without A Fell Dread attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Attached hero’s Ò is reduced to 0. During the quest phase, attached hero must commit to the quest, if able.”)

name: Death and Calamity
text: When Revealed: Attach Death and Calamity to the current quest. Then, the first player reanimates the top X cards of his deck, where X is the number of copies of Death and Calamity in play.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +X Û, where X is the number of Sorcery cards in play.

name: Círdan the Shipwright
text: Draw 1 additional card at the beginning of the resource phase. Forced: After drawing cards at the beginning of the resource phase, choose and discard 1 of those cards.

name: Galdor of the Havens
text:
Response: After drawing your setup hand, instead of taking a mulligan, you may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw that many cards.
Action: If you have no cards in your hand, draw 6 cards. (Limit once per game.)

name: Mithlond Sea-watcher
text: While the top card of your discard pile is an ally, Mithlond Sea-watcher gets +2 Û and gains ranged.

name: Skyward Volley
text:
As an additional cost to play Skyward Volley, exhaust a ranged character you control.
Combat Action: Deal 2 damage to an enemy engaged with a player. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Skyward Volley currently in your discard pile (you may choose different targets).

name: Grappling Hook
text: Quest Action: Discard Grappling Hook and exhaust attached character to commit attached character to the quest, using its Û instead of its Ò (or instead of its Ú if the current quest has the siege keyword).

name: Warden of the Havens
text: While the top card of your discard pile is an attachment, Warden of the Havens gets +2 Ú and gains sentinel.

name: Anchor Watch
text: Response: After an enemy is declared as an attacker against you, declare an exhausted character you control as the defender. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Anchor Watch currently in your discard pile (all chosen characters are defending against this attack).

name: Mariner's Compass
keywords: Attach to a Ì or a Scout character.
text: Response: At the beginning of the travel phase, exhaust Mariner's Compass and attached character to search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a location. Switch that location with a location in the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Lindon Navigator
keywords: Lindon Navigator does not exhaust to commit to a quest, and can commit to quests while exhausted.
text: Forced: After resolving a quest to which Lindon Navigator was committed, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.

name: The Evening Star
text: Action: Place 2 progress on any location. Resolve that effect again for each copy of The Evening Star currently in your discard pile (you may choose different targets).

name: Explorer's Almanac
keywords: Attach to a location in the staging area.
text: Progress from questing successfully may be placed on the attached location before it is placed on the current quest.

name: Sailor of Lune
text: While the top card of your discard pile is an event, Sailor of Lune gets +1 Ò and gains “Cannot be damaged while committed to the quest.”

name: Elwing's Flight
text: Quest Action: Ready a questing character and give that character +1 Ò until the end of the phase. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Elwing’s Flight currently in your discard pile (you may choose different targets).

name: To the Sea, to the Sea!
text: Action: Exhaust To the Sea, to the Sea! and discard X cards from your hand to reduce the cost of the next Noldor ally played this phase by X (to a minimum of 1).

name: Narya
keywords:
Attach to Círdan the Shipwright or Gandalf.
Attached character gains a Ì resource icon.
text: Action: Exhaust Narya and attached character to choose and ready up to 2 allies. Each of those allies gets +1 Û and +1 Ú until the end of the phase.

name: Departure from the Havens
text:
Sailing.
While you are on-course (º), each Ship objective gets +2 Ò.
When this stage is defeated, if you are on-course (º), look at the top 2 stages of the quest deck and advance to one of your choice, placing the other on the bottom of the quest deck. Otherwise, advance to the top stage of the quest deck.

name: Into the Storm
text:
Sailing.
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), each player must distribute 5 damage among characters he controls.
When this stage is defeated, if you are on-course (º), look at the top 2 stages of the quest deck and advance to one of your choice, placing the other on the bottom of the quest deck. Otherwise, advance to the top stage of the quest deck.

name: Cursed Mists
text:
Sailing.
While you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), each non-Ship ally gets –2 Ò.
When this stage is defeated, if you are on-course (º), look at the top 2 stages of the quest deck and advance to one of your choice, placing the other on the bottom of the quest deck. Otherwise, advance to the top stage of the quest deck.

name: Calphon’s Divination
text:
Sailing.
While you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), each Ship enemy gains Boarding 1.
When this stage is defeated, if you are on-course (º), look at the top 2 stages of the quest deck and advance to one of your choice, placing the other on the bottom of the quest deck. Otherwise, advance to the top stage of the quest deck.

name: The Star’s Guidance
text:
Sailing.
While you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), each Ocean location gets +1 $.
When this stage is defeated, if you are on-course (º), look at the top 2 stages of the quest deck and advance to one of your choice, placing the other on the bottom of the quest deck. Otherwise, advance to the top stage of the quest deck.

name: Corsair Pursuit
text:
Sailing.
You cannot place progress on Corsair Pursuit unless you are on-course (º).
If there are no Ship enemies in play, you have defeated your pursuers, and win the game. If this stage has 10 or more progress on it, you have lost your pursuers, and win the game.

name: Scouting Ship
text: Scouting Ship gets –15 engagement cost while you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾).

name: Starlit Sea
text: While you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), Uncharted Ocean gains: “Travel: Raise each player’s threat by 3.”
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if you are off-course).

name: Fog Bank
text: While Fog Bank is the active location, Ship enemies do not make engagement checks, cannot attack, and cannot be attacked.
shadow: Shadow: If your heading is at the worst setting (¾), attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Explore the Island
text:
Progress cannot be placed on Explore the Island except by quest effects.
Forced: After a location is explored, add progress to Explore the Island equal to that location’s printed quest points.
Forced: When an Uncharted location becomes the active location, add 1 copy of Lost Island from the top of the Uncharted deck to the staging area.

name: A Fateful Discovery
text:
Forced: After a location is explored, if it would be shuffled into the Uncharted deck, add it to the victory display, instead.
The players cannot defeat this stage unless Shrine to Morgoth is in the victory display. When Shrine to Morgoth is added to the victory display, the players win the game.

name: Lost Island
keywords: While Shrine to Morgoth is the active location, players cannot draw cards or search their decks.
text: Forced: After Shrine to Morgoth is flipped over while active, exhaust each ally in play with printed cost 2 or less. Then, each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Undead enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Calphon
keywords: The first player gains control of Calphon.
text:
Action: Exhaust Calphon to look at the bottom card of your deck. Then, you may switch that card with a card in your hand.

If Calphon leaves play, the players lose.

name: Servant of the Deceiver
text: Forced: When Servant of the Deceiver engages you, look at the top card of your deck. If it is printed cost 2 or less, place it on the bottom of your deck and Servant of the Deceiver gets +2 Û until the end of the round.

name: Lost Island
keywords: While Lush Jungle is in the staging area, characters get –1 Û and lose ranged.
text: Forced: After Lush Jungle is flipped over while active, return it to the staging area unless each player exhausts each ready hero he controls.

name: Lost Island
keywords: Uncharted. Cannot have player card attachments.
text: Forced: After Forbidden Coast is flipped over while active, each player may draw a card. Then, each player chooses a card from his hand and places it on the bottom of his deck.

name: Steep Plateau
text: Response: After Steep Plateau is explored, look at the facedown side of an Uncharted location in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Discard the bottom card of the defending player’s deck. If that card’s printed cost is 2 or less, attacking enemy gets +2 Û.

name: Mysterious Fog
text: When Revealed: Either each player must exhaust a character he controls, or each Lost Island in the staging area gets +1 $ until the end of the phase.
shadow: Shadow: Discard the bottom card of your deck. If that card's printed cost is 2 or less, exhaust a character you control.

name: Lingering Malevolence
text: When Revealed: The first player discards the bottom card of his deck. Then, he discards each card in his hand with a printed cost higher than that of the discarded card.
shadow: Shadow: Discard the bottom card of the defending player’s deck. If that card’s printed cost is 2 or less, attacking enemy gets +2 Û.

name: Ruins of Ages Past
text: When Revealed: Add 1 copy of Lost Island from the top of the Uncharted deck to the staging area. Remove all progress from each Uncharted location in the staging area and shuffle them so that the players do not know which one is which.

name: The Corsairs' Assault
text: Forced: At the end of the combat phase, deal X damage to the Aflame location in play with the lowest Aflame value. X is the number of Corsair enemies in play.

name: Sahír's Advance
text:
Any time players would place progress on this quest, remove an equal amount of damage from locations in play instead. (Progress is placed on the active location before triggering this effect.) 
Each Raider enemy revealed by the encounter deck enters play with 1 resource on it.
If Captain Sahír is in the victory display and each location in play has no damage, the players win the game.

name: The Havens Burn
text:
Forced: When a card is placed underneath The Havens Burn, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.
If there are X or more cards underneath The Havens Burn, the Corsairs have destroyed the Elven fleet and the players lose the game. X is 3 more than the number of players in the game.

name: Dream-chaser
keywords: Aflame 12. Immune to player card effects.
text:
The players cannot travel to The Dream-chaser.
When The Dream-chaser is placed underneath The Havens Burn, the players lose the game.

name: Corsair Arsonist
text: When Revealed: Either deal 2 damage to an Aflame location in play, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Aflame location with the highest Aflame value, and add it to the staging area.

name: Sahír's Ravager
text: Forced: After Sahír’s Ravager attacks, place 1 resource on it. Then, deal X damage to the Aflame location in play with the lowest Aflame value, where X is the number of resources on Sahír’s Ravager.

name: Mithlond Harbor
text: While Mithlond Harbor is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each damage token on the active location.

name: Burning Piers
keywords: Aflame 5. Burning Piers gets +1 $ for each damage on it.
text: Forced: When Burning Piers is placed underneath The Havens Burn, deal 3 damage to The Dream‑chaser.
shadow: Shadow: Add Burning Piers to the staging area.

name: Pillaged Ship
text: When Revealed: Either deal 3 damage to Pillaged Ship, or add the topmost enemy in the encounter discard pile to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Raider, move all resources from defending character to attacking enemy.

name: White Ship
text: Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Corsair enemy and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Forced: When White Ship is placed underneath The Havens Burn, place 1 resource on each Raider enemy in play.

name: Elven Wave-runner
text: Response: After Elven Wave-runner is added to the victory display, each player draws 1 card.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Raider, discard a card at random from your hand and place 1 resource on attacking enemy.

name: Elven Caravel
text:
Travel: Each player must assign damage among characters he controls equal to the amount of damage on Elven Caravel.
Forced: When Elven Caravel is placed underneath The Havens Burn, deal 1 damage to each character in play.

name: Put to the Torch
text: When Revealed: Each player must either deal 3 damage to a character he controls, or to an Aflame location in play.
shadow: Shadow: If the active location has the Aflame keyword, either deal it 3 damage or deal the defending character 1 damage.

name: The Fires Spread
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each Aflame location in play. If less than 3 total damage is dealt by this effect, The Fires Spread gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, deal 1 damage to each Aflame location in play.

name: Calm Waters
text: While Calm Waters is the active location, look at 2 additional cards from the top of the encounter deck during each Sailing test.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if attacking enemy is a Ship enemy).

name: Rolling Seas
text: Travel: Shift your heading off-course to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack deals damage to a Ship objective, shift your heading off-course.

name: Thrown Off Course
text: When Revealed: Either remove all progress from the current quest and raise each player’s threat by 4, or shift your heading off-course.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, shift your heading off-course.

name: Rough Waters
text: While Rough Waters is in the staging area, cancel the first ¹ symbol found during each Sailing test.
shadow: Shadow: If you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), attacking enemy gets +2 Û.

name: Waterspout
text:
While your heading is at the worst setting (¾), when faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to Waterspout, if able.
Forced: After traveling to Waterspout, deal 4 damage to each Ship objective.

name: Sudden Storms
text: When Revealed: Either shift your heading off-course or deal 1 damage to each exhausted character.
shadow: Shadow: Excess damage from this attack is dealt to a Ship objective you control.

name: Winds of Wrath
text: When Revealed: If you are off-course, deal 1 damage to each character in play. If your heading is at the worst setting (¾), this effect cannot be canceled.
shadow: Shadow: Either shift your heading off‑course or treat this attack as undefended.

name: Light Cruiser
text: Each Raider enemy revealed from the Corsair deck by Light Cruiser’s boarding keyword enters play with 1 resource on it.

name: Corsair Warship
text: While Corsair Warship is in the staging area, it cannot be damaged and gains archery 4.

name: Boarding Party
text: When Revealed: Each player reveals the top card of the Corsair deck and puts it into play, engaged with him.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if you control an exhausted Ship objective).

name: Southron Sailor
text: While Southron Sailor is engaged with you, each Ship enemy engaged with you contributes its $ to the total $ in the staging area.

name: Cunning Pirate
keywords: Cunning Pirate gets +1 Û and +1 Ú for each resource on it.
text: Forced: When Cunning Pirate engages you, discard an attachment you control and place resources on Cunning Pirate equal to that attachment’s printed cost.

name: Vicious Marauder
text:
Forced: When Vicious Marauder engages you, discard a random card from your hand and place resources on it equal to that card’s printed cost.

Forced: When Vicious Marauder attacks you, distribute damage among characters you control equal to the number of resources on it.

name: Umbar Captain
text: While you are engaged with Umbar Captain, characters you control cannot attack Ship enemies.

name: Umbar Raider
keywords: Umbar Raider gets +1 Û for each resource on it.
text: Forced: After Umbar Raider attacks you, move 1 resource from one of your heroes’ resource pools to Umbar Raider.

name: Corsair Infiltrator
text:
Forced: When Corsair Infiltrator attacks, deal it 1 additional shadow card for each resource on it.

Forced: After the engaged player collects resources at the beginning of the resource phase, that player moves 1 resource from one of his heroes' pools to Corsair Infiltrator.

name: Raid Leader
keywords: Raid Leader gets +1 Ú for each resource on it.
text: Forced: When Raid Leader engages you, move 1 resource from each of your heroes’ resource pools to Raid Leader.

name: Battle-Hardened
text: When Revealed: Place 1 resource on each Raider enemy in play. Each engaged non-Ship enemy makes an immediate attack. If there are no engaged non-Ship enemies, Battle-Hardened gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If the attacking enemy is a Raider, place 2 resources on it.

name: Drowned Dead
text: Forced: When Drowned Dead attacks and destroys an ally, place that ally on the bottom of its owner's deck.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys an ally, place that ally on the bottom of its owners's deck.

name: Soulless Cadaver
keywords: While you are engaged with Soulless Cadaver, your deck cannot be searched.
text: Forced: When Soulless Cadaver engages you, place each card in your hand with printed cost 2 or less on the bottom of your deck.

name: Throngs of Unfaithful
text: Forced: When Throngs of Unfaithful is destroyed, discard the bottom card of the engaged player’s deck. If that card’s printed cost is 2 or less, return Throngs of Unfaithful to the top of the encounter deck.

name: Curse of the Downfallen
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each non‑objective ally with printed cost 2 or less. Place each ally destroyed by this effect on the bottom of its owner’s deck.
shadow: Shadow: Discard the bottom card of your deck. If that card’s printed cost is 2 or less, attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Lost Island
keywords: Uncharted. Cannot have player card attachments.
text: While Flooded Ruins is the active location, it contributes its $ to the staging area.

name: Lost Island
keywords: Uncharted. Cannot have player card attachments.
text: Forced: After Drowned Graves is flipped over while active, discard the top X cards of the encounter deck. Each player adds an Undead enemy discarded by this effect to the staging area. X is 2 more than the number of players in the game.

name: Lost Island
keywords: Uncharted. Cannot have player card attachments.
text: While Cursed Temple is the active location, characters with less than 2 Ò do not ready during the refresh phase.

name: Aimless Wandering
text: When Revealed: The players, as a group, must remove characters with a total of at least X Ò from the quest. X is the number of Uncharted locations in the staging area. The first player may give Aimless Wandering doomed 2 to look at the facedown side of an Uncharted location in the staging area.

name: Captain Sahír
keywords: The first player gains control of Captain Sahír.
text:
Captain Sahír gets +1 Ò and +1 Û for each resource on him (max +6).
Action: Spend 1 resource from a hero you control to place 1 resource on Captain Sahír. (Limit once per round).
If Captain Sahír leaves play, the players lose.

name: Na'asiyah
keywords: The last player gains control of Na’asiyah.
text:
Action: While Na’asiyah is attacking or defending, spend 1 resource from her to give her +2 Û or +2 Ú for this attack.
Action: Spend 1 resource from a hero you control to place 1 resource on Na’asiyah. (Limit once per round).
If Na’asiyah leaves play, the players lose.

name: Dream-chaser
keywords: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.
text:
The Dream-chaser can always be committed to Sailing tests (even if you are not the first player), and counts as 2 characters when committed to a Sailing test. 

If the Dream-chaser is destroyed, the players lose the game.

name: Dawn Star
keywords: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.
text:
Raise your starting threat by 3.
Draw 1 additional card during the resource phase.
If the Dawn Star is destroyed, its controller is eliminated from the game.

name: Nárelenya
keywords: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.
text:
Reduce the cost of the first ally you play each round by 1.

If Nárelenya is destroyed, its controller is eliminated from the game.

name: Silver Wing
keywords: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel. Ranged.
text:
Reduce your starting threat by 3.
Each hero you control gets +1 Û.
If the Silver Wing is destroyed, its controller is eliminated from the game.

name: Denethor
keywords: Setup: Add 2 resources to Denethor's resource pool.
text: Action: Move 1 resource from Denethor’s resource pool to another Gondor hero’s resource pool. (Limit once per round.)

name: Rod of the Steward
text: Action: Spend 2 resources from attached hero’s resource pool to draw 1 card.

name: In Service of the Steward
text: Attached character gains the Gondor trait.

name: Azain Silverbeard
text: Response: After Azain Silverbeard participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, spend 1 Ï resource to deal 2 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the destroyed enemy. Any player may trigger this response.

name: Last Stand
text: Response: After a Warrior character is destroyed while defending against an enemy attack, deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to that character’s printed Û.

name: Glorfindel
keywords: Glorfindel can be played from your discard pile.
text: Action: Discard a card from your hand to ready Glorfindel. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Tides of Fate
text: Response: When a shadow card increases an enemy’s Û by any amount, increase the defending character's Ú by 3 for that attack. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 Ïresources to ready the defending character and give it +3 Û for its next attack this phase.

name: Imladris Caregiver
text: Action: Discard a card from your hand to heal 1 damage on any 1 character. (Limit twice per round).

name: Heed the Dream
text: Action: Choose a player. That player searches the top 5 cards of his deck for a card, adds it to his hand, and shuffles his deck. Then, players as a group may spend 3 Ì resources to have that player search his deck for another card, add it to his hand, and shuffle his deck.

name: Guardian of Rivendell
text: As an additional cost to play Guardian of Rivendell from your hand, you must discard 2 cards from your hand.

name: Vanish from Sight
keywords: Play only if you control 2 or fewer heroes.
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, if your threat is higher than 20, treat your threat as if it is 20.

name: Swift Departure
text: Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), move 2 progress from Swift Departure to the Stormcaller's quest stage.

name: Full Sail Ahead!
text:
No more than 8 progress can be placed here each round. If you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), no more than 4 progress can be placed here each round instead. 

When you defeat this stage, if the Stormcaller is at stage 2, you have caught up to the Stormcaller and win the game. Otherwise, advance to the next stage.

name: The Weather Turns Foul
text:
Forced: At the end of the staging step, if you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), reveal an additional encounter card from the top of the encounter deck. 

When you defeat this stage, if the Stormcaller is still at stage 3, you have caught up to the Stormcaller and win the game. Otherwise, advance to the next stage.

name: The Cape of Andrast
text:
Forced: After a Weather treachery is revealed, deal 1 damage to each Ship objective and Ship enemy at this stage. 

If you defeat this stage, you have caught up to the Stormcaller and win the game.

name: Full Sail Ahead!
text:
If the players are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), the Stormcaller gets +2 $.
No more than 4 damage may be placed on the Stormcaller each round. 
Forced: At the end of the round, discard the top card of the encounter deck. the Stormcaller places progress on this stage equal to its $ plus the $ of the discarded card.

name: The Weather Turns Foul
text:
If the players are off-course (Cloudy, Rainy, or Stormy), the Stormcaller gets +2 $.
No more than 8 damage may be placed on the Stormcaller each round. 
Forced: At the end of the round, discard the top card of the encounter deck. the Stormcaller places progress on this stage equal to its $ plus the $ of the discarded card.

name: The Cape of Andrast
text:
Forced: At the end of the round, discard the top card of the encounter deck. the Stormcaller places progress on this stage equal to its $ plus the $ of the discarded card. 

If the Stormcaller defeats this stage, Captain Sahír has gotten away with the key, and the players lose the game.

name: The Stormcaller
text:
When the Stormcaller advances to the next quest stage, return it to the Stormcaller's area. 

If the Stormcaller leaves play, the players win the game.

name: Sahír’s Escort
text:
While Sahír's Escort is in the Stormcaller’s area, it contributes its $ to the amount of progress the Stormcaller places on its quest stage each round. 
When Revealed: Add Sahír’s Escort to the Stormcaller’s area, instead of the players’ staging area.

name: Swift Raider
text: While Swift Raider is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a player commits 4 or more characters to a Sailing test or to the quest, Swift Raider engages that player.”

name: Corsair Skiff
text: Forced: When Corsair Skiff engages you from the staging area, either raise your threat by 3 or it gains Boarding 1.

name: Corsair Seafarer
text: Corsair Seafarer gets +1 Attack for each resource on it. Forced: After the engaged player commits a hero to a Sailing test or to a quest, move 1 resource from that hero's resource pool to Corsair Seafarer.

name: Serpent's Blade
text: Forced: When the Stormcaller advances to the next quest stage, Serpent's Blade makes an immediate attack against the engaged player.

name: Jagged Reef
text: Forced: At the beginning of the travel phase, if you are on-course (º), place 2 progress on Jagged Reef. If you are off-course (¼, ½, or ¾), deal 2 damage to each Ship objective instead.

name: Hidden Cove
text:
Travel: Move 2 progress from the main quest to the Stormcaller's quest stage. 

Response: After Hidden Cove becomes the active location, heal 4 damage from each Ship objective.

name: Vast Coastland
text: When Revealed: Add Vast Coastland to the Stormcaller’s area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û if you are at the same stage as the Stormcaller.

name: Man Overboard!
text: When Revealed: Each player contributing at least 8 Ò to the quest must discard a questing character. If your heading is at the worst setting (¾), this effect cannot be canceled.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +X Û, where X is The Stormcaller's current quest stage.

name: Raging Squall
text: When Revealed: Attach Raging Squall to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Forced: After an ally is committed to the quest, deal 1 damage to that ally if you are off-course.”)

name: Lanwyn
text: Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, either ready Lanwyn or give her +2 Ò until the end of the phase. (Limit twice per phase.)

name: Eldahir
text: Action: Spend 1 Î resource to look at a facedown shadow card dealt to an engaged enemy. If that card has a shadow effect, Eldahir gets +2 Ú until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Captain's Wisdom.
text: Resource Action: Exhaust a Noble hero you control to add 2 resources to that hero’s resource pool.

name: Master Ironsmith
text: Response: After you play Master Ironsmith from your hand, if you paid all of its resource cost from a single hero’s resource pool, attach a Weapon or Armor attachment from your hand or discard pile to that hero without paying its resource cost.

name: Raiment of War
keywords: Attach to a Warrior character. Raiment of War counts as 2 Restricted attachments.
text: Attached character gets +1 Û, +1 Ú, and +2 hit points.

name: Sam Gamgee
text:
Reduce the cost to play Sam Gamgee by 2 if you control Frodo Baggins.
Response: After a player raises his threat, that player may spend 1 Ê resource to ready Sam Gamgee. He gets +1 Ò, +1 Û and +1 Ú until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: Elevenses
keywords: Play only after the staging step.
text: Quest Action: Choose X questing Hobbit characters you control. Ready each chosen character and remove them from the quest. Then, reduce your threat by X.

name: Mirkwood Explorer
text:
Response: After Mirkwood Explorer quests successfully, place 1 progress on it.

Action: Exhaust Mirkwood Explorer to move all progress from it to a location in play.

name: Guarded Ceaselessly
text: Action: Exhaust a Ranger or Scout character to give attached location -2 $ until the end of the phase.

name: Take the Ship!
text:
Captain Sahír and Na’asiyah gain indestructible.
Forced: At the end of the round, if Captain Sahír and Na’asiyah are not in play, add 1 resource to each of them.
Progress cannot be placed on this stage unless Helm of the Stormcaller is in the victory display.

name: Change of Plans
text: When Revealed: Flip Captain Sahír and Na’asiyah to their objective sides, removing all tokens from them. Search the encounter deck, discard pile and all play areas for each encounter card from the Corsair Raiders encounter set and remove each of those cards from the game. Add The Thing in the Depths to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set aside The Thing in the Depths encounter set into the encounter deck. Advance to stage 3.

name: Defend the Ship!
text:
During the travel phase, the players may travel to a location in the staging area even if another location is currently active. If they do, return the currently active location to the staging area.
At the end of the round, if the total $ of any one Ship location is 9 or higher, the Stormcaller is destroyed, and the players lose the game.
When Thing in the Depths is destroyed, the players win the game.

name: Helm of the Stormcaller
text:
Helm of the Stormcaller gets +1 quest point for each resource token on a Raider enemy in play.
Forced: When Helm of the Stormcaller becomes the active location, add Captain Sahír and Na’asiyah to the staging area from out of play (enemy side faceup).

name: Forecastle Deck
text: Forced: After you travel to Forecastle Deck, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and reveal it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Weather Deck
text: While Weather Deck is in the staging area, each other Deck location in play gains "Travel: Each player must exhaust a character he controls to travel here."
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

name: Cargo Hold
text: While Cargo Hold is the active location, each enemy gets +1 Ú.
shadow: Shadow: Until the end of the phase, attacking enemy gets +2 Ú.

name: Crew Quarters
text: Travel: Add 1 resource to each Raider card in play to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û.

name: Quarter Deck
text: While Quarter Deck is the active location, deal each enemy an additional shadow card at the beginning of the combat phase.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control.

name: Hold Steady!
text: When Revealed: Exhaust each character with 1 or less Ú.
shadow: Shadow: If the defending character has 0 Ú, discard it. Otherwise, the defending character gets -2 Ú for this attack.

name: The Thing in the Depths
keywords: Immune to player card effects. Cannot be engaged.
text:
The Thing in the Depths gets +3 hit points per player.
Forced: When a Creature enemy is destroyed, deal damage to The Thing in the Depths equal to that enemy’s $.

name: Eye of the Beast
keywords:
Surge. 
Eye of the Beast cannot attack.
text: While Eye of the Beast is engaged with a player, The Thing in the Depths attacks that player during the combat phase (deal and resolve a shadow card for this attack).

name: Thrashing Arm
text: Forced: At the end of the combat phase, if Thrashing Arm is engaged with you, deal 3 damage to a character you control.

name: Crushing Arm
text: Forced: After Crushing Arm is detached from a location, it makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Grasping Arm
text: Forced: When Grasping Arm attacks, the engaged player must exhaust a character he controls.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, resolve Grasping Arm’s Grapple keyword.

name: Giant Arm
text: Giant Arm gets +2 Û when attacking allies.
shadow: Shadow: After this attack, either put Giant Arm into play engaged with you and deal it a shadow card, or resolve its Grapple ability.

name: From the Depths
text: When Revealed: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Resolve the Grapple keyword on each enemy discarded by this effect.
shadow: Shadow: Assign damage among characters you control equal to the number of enemies grappled with locations in the staging area.

name: Lashing Tentacles
text: When Revealed: The Thing in the Depths attacks each player in turn order from the staging area (deal and resolve a shadow card for each attack).
shadow: Shadow: After this attack, The Thing in the Depths makes an attack against the defending player (deal a shadow card for this attack).

name: Elfhelm
text:
Each Ê hero with an attached Mount gets +1 Ò.
Each Ï hero with an attached Mount gets +1 Û.
Each Ì hero with an attached Mount gets +1 Ú.

name: Ceorl
text: Action: Spend 1 Ê resource to ready Ceorl. Then, you may give control of Ceorl to another player. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase).

name: Armored Destrier
keywords: Attach to a Ì or sentinel hero. Restricted.
text: Response: After attached hero defends against an attack, exhaust Armored Destrier to ready attached hero. Then, discard a shadow card from another enemy engaged with the defending player.

name: Déorwine
text: Action: While Déorwine is defending, spend 1 Ì resource to cancel a shadow effect dealt to the attacking enemy. Any player may trigger this action.

name: Revealed in Wrath
keywords: Play only if you control a Noldor hero.
text: Action: Choose a non-unique enemy. Until the end of the phase, treat the chosen enemy’s printed text box as if it were blank (except for Traits).

name: Rhovanion Outrider
text: Response: After Rhovanion Outrider commits to the quest, place 1 progress on a location in the staging area. If that location is not explored by this effect, give Rhovanion Outrider +1 Ò until the end of the phase.

name: Scouting Party
keywords: Play only after the staging step.
text: Response: After you commit characters to the quest, if each character you have committed to the quest is a Scout, each of those characters gets +2 Ò until the end of the phase.

name: Entangling Nets
keywords: Play Entangling Nets into the staging area unattached.
text:
If unattached, attach Entangling Nets to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Attached enemy gets –2 Û and –2 Ú.

name: Arrows from the Trees
keywords: Play only after making engagement checks.
text: Encounter Action: If no enemies were engaged this phase, deal 1 damage to each enemy in the staging area. Then, the players as a group may spend 3 Ï resources to deal 2 additional damage to each enemy in the staging area.

name: Ered Luin Miner
text: Response: After Ered Luin Miner is discarded from the top of your deck, put it into play under your control.

name: Searching the Island
text:
Exploration.
For each progress that would be placed on Searching the Island, you may place it on a location in the staging area, instead.

name: Temple of the Deceived
text:
Forced: When The Grotto’s Entrance is flipped over while active, put Temple Guardian into play from the victory display, engaged with the player with the highest threat.
When the 8th progress is placed on The Grotto’s Entrance, the players have found the sunken ruins and win the game.

name: Temple of the Deceived
keywords: Uncharted. Immune to player card effects.
text:
While Temple Halls is the active location, each character gets –1 Û and –1 Ú.
Forced: When Temple Halls is flipped over while active, put Temple Guardian into play from the victory display, engaged with the player with the highest threat.

name: Temple Guardian
keywords:
X is the number of players in the game.
Immune to player card effects. Cannot be optionally engaged.
text: Temple Guardian gets –50 engagement cost while Cursed Temple is the active location.

name: Gate Key
text:
If unattached, return Gate Key to the staging area and it gains: “Action: Exhaust a hero to claim Gate Key and attach it to that hero.”
Action: Exhaust Gate Key and attached hero and spend 3 resources from attached hero’s resource pool to look at the facedown side of a Temple of the Deceived.

name: Lost Island
keywords: Uncharted. Cannot have player card attachments.
text:
While Jagged Cliffs is the active location, the location to its right is not considered to be in the staging area.
Forced: When Jagged Cliffs is flipped over while active, look at the facedown side of each adjacent copy of Lost Island.

name: Lost Island
keywords: Uncharted. Cannot have player card attachments.
text:
While Winding Caverns is the active location, each enemy gets +10 engagement cost.
When you would travel from Winding Caverns to another location, you may travel to a location up to 3 locations away. (You must still pay that location’s Travel cost in order to travel there.)

name: Lost Island
keywords: Uncharted. Cannot have player card attachments.
text:
While Jungle Path is the active location, the locations immediately above and below it are not considered to be in the staging area.
Forced: When Jungle Path is flipped over while active, each player must exhaust a character with at least 2 Û.

name: Faithless Desecrator
text: While engaged with a player, Faithless Desecrator contributes its $ to the total $ in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead of the active location is a Ruins location).

name: Island Watcher
keywords: Island Watcher cannot be optionally engaged.
text: While Island Watcher is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, if the active location has the Ruins trait, Island Watcher engages the player with the highest threat. Then, deal it 2 shadow cards.”

name: Profane Dead
text: Forced: When you travel to the right, Profane Dead makes an immediate attack against the engaged player.

name: Deeper into the Ruins
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, add X $ to the total $ in the staging area. X is the total $ of all locations to the left of the active location (in its row). If X is 0, Deeper into the Ruins gains Doomed 1.

name: Furious Rainstorm
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: raise his threat by the number of his characters committed to the quest, or deal 1 damage to each of his characters committed to the quest.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, raise your threat by the attacking enemy’s $.

name: Dwindling Supplies
