shadow: Shadow: Discard an unconscious character you control.

text:
While Hidden Path is the active location, locations in the staging area get -1 $.

text: Forced: After Dark Bats damages a character, attach it to that character. (While attached, counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Attached character gets -1 Ò, -1 Û, and -1 Ú.")
shadow: Shadow: Attach this card to the defending character.

name: Fighting Among Friends
text: When Revealed: The first player names a sphere. Then, all non-Baggins characters who do not belong to the named sphere are removed from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. (+2 Û instead if undefended.)

name: Weighed Down
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, exhausted characters get -1 Ò, -1 Û, and -1 Ú.
shadow: Shadow: If the defending character is destroyed by this attack, its controller must raise his threat by 5.

name: A Bare Patch
text:
While attached, Smaug the Magnificent gets -3 Ú.

Response: After the players quest successfully, the first player makes a burgle attempt. If successful, attach A Bare Patch to Smaug the Magnificent.

name: Smaug the Golden
keywords: Indestructible. Immune to player card effects.
text:
Cannot be engaged.

X is the number of non-Burglar characters committed to the quest.

Forced: After the 6th progress token is placed here, the players advance to stage 4A.

name: Smaug the Magnificent
keywords: Indestructible. Immune to player card effects.
text:
Cannot leave the staging area (except by quest effect) but is considered to be engaged with the first player.

Forced: If Smaug the Magnificent is dealt a shadow card with a burgle effect, he makes an additional attack immediately after this one.

name: Croaking Crows
text:
Forced: When a location is revealed from the encounter deck, put 1 progress on Smaug the Golden.

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 1 card from his hand that matches the revealed card's sphere and type.

name: The Lonely Mountain
text:
While at least 1 card is stacked underneath, The Lonely Mountain is immune to player card effects, cannot leave the staging area, and gets -2 $ for each card stacked under it.

Action: While making a burgle attempt, the first player may spend 2 Í resources to take the revealed card into hand and reveal the next card of his deck.

name: Great Hall
text:
While Great Hall is the active location, it gains: "Forced: Put 1 progress on Smaug the Golden at the end of each round."

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 3 cards from his hand that match the revealed card's type.

name: Secret Entrance
text:
While Secret Entrance is the active location, The Lonely Mountain's $ is reduced by half (round up).

Travel: The first player must exhaust a hero and name a card type to travel here. Then, reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If the revealed card is not the named type, return Secret Entrance to the staging area. (The players cannot travel again this round.)

name: Desolation of Smaug
text:
While Desolation of Smaug is the active location, the first treachery card revealed each round gains surge.

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 2 cards from his hand that match the revealed card's cost.

name: Western Slopes
text:
Response: When Western Slopes leaves play as an explored location (choose one): the first player draws 2 cards, or remove 1 progress token from Smaug the Golden.

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 2 cards from his hand that match the revealed card's sphere.

name: Pretending to Sleep
text:
When Revealed: Put 1 progress token on Smaug the Golden. Then, spend X Í resources or advance to stage 4A. X is the number of progress tokens on Smaug the Golden.

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 2 cards from his hand that match the revealed card's type.

name: Known to an Ounce
text:
When Revealed: Each player discards 2 random cards from hand. Until the end of the phase, each Dragon enemy in play gets +1 $ for each event discarded by this effect.

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 1 card from his hand that matches the revealed card's sphere and cost.

name: Belching Fire
text:
When Revealed: Each Dragon enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the player with the highest total Ò committed to the quest. (Do not deal a shadow card for this attack.)

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 1 card from his hand that matches the revealed card's type and cost.

name: Dragon-Spell
text: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with the most resources without Dragon-Spell attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Attached hero gets -1 Ò for each resource in its resource pool. Forced: When attached hero spends resources, attached hero takes X damage. X is equal to the number of resources spent.")

name: Misty Mountain Eagle
text: Action: The first player may spend 2 Í resources to (choose one): take control of Misty Mountain Eagle, or discard this ally to discard a non-unique enemy in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 3 damage to attacking enemy.

name: Bolg
text:
X is the number of players in the game.

Cannot leave the staging area.

The first Goblin revealed each round gains surge.

name: Bodyguard of Bolg
text: Forced: When this enemy attacks, deal it an additional shadow card for each quest stage in play with no progress tokens on it.

name: Gundabad Wolf Rider
text: Forced: When this enemy attacks, remove 1 progress from the current quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each quest stage in play with no progress on it.

name: Gundabad Climber
text: When Revealed: Remove 1 progress from every quest stage in play. (2 progress instead if 3 or more players in the game.)

name: Vanguard of Bolg
text: This enemy gets +1 $, +1 Û, and +1 Ú for each quest stage in play with no progress on it.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove all progress from the current quest.

name: Gundabad Archer
text: When Revealed: Each player must deal 2 damage to a character he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to defending character for each quest stage in play with no progress on it.

name: Ravenous Warg
text: Forced: When Ravenous Warg attacks, the defending player must declare the character he controls with the most damage as the defender. (Even if exhausted.)
shadow: Shadow: Defending character gets -1 Ú for each quest stage in play with no progress on it.

name: Northern Slopes
text:
While Northern Slopes is in the staging area, each Goblin enemy gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.

While Northern Slopes is the active location, it gains: "Forced: When a character leaves play, remove 1 progress from the current quest, if able."

name: Ruins of Dale
text:
Forced: Remove 2 progress from stage 3B at the end of each round, if able.

Travel: Spend 3 Í resources to travel here. (1 Í instead if stage 3B is the current quest.)

name: Ravenhill
text:
Forced: Remove 2 progress from stage 4B at the end of each round, if able.

Travel: Spend 3 Í resources to travel here. (1 Í instead if stage 4B is the current quest.)

name: The Front Gate
text:
Forced: Remove 2 progress from stage 2B at the end of each round, if able.

Travel: Spend 3 Í resources to travel here. (1 Í instead if stage 2B is the current quest.)

name: Hatred Rekindled
text: When Revealed: Each enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack. Do not deal shadow cards for attacks made by this effect. If no attacks were made by this effect, this card gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack immediately after this one.

name: Goblins are Upon You!
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Goblin enemy and put it into play, engaged with him. Then, shuffle the encounter deck. (This effect cannot be canceled.)
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each Goblin enemy engaged with you.

name: Heedless of Order
text: When Revealed: Choose a different quest to be the current quest until the end of the round, if able. If the current quest did not change as a result of this effect, this card gains Doomed 3.

name: Into Mirkwood
text: Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious characters).

name: Lost in the Dark
text: When Revealed: Reveal stage 3 and create a separate staging area for the first player using that stage. If there are no other players in the game, discard this stage and each card in its staging area. All other players advance to stage 4.

name: Captured by Spiders
text:
Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious characters).

Do not pass the first player token. When this stage is complete, do not advance to stage 4 until the end of the quest phase. (Combine staging areas if necessary.)

Action: Spend 2 Í resources to ready an unconscious character you control.

name: Battle with the Spiders
text:
Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious characters).

Progress cannot be placed on this stage while The Spider's Glade is in play.

Action: Spend 2 Í resources to ready an unconscious character you control.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game and discovered the treasure card Bilbo's Magic Ring.

name: A Warm Welcome
text:
Skip the Quest phase.

Forced: At the end of round, advance to stage 2.

name: The Burglar's Turn
text:
Forced: After questing successfully, place 1 progress on Smaug the Golden. Then, the first player makes a burgle attempt. If successful, the first player takes the top treasure card from under The Lonely Mountain into his hand. Then, the players may advance to stage 3.

Forced: After the first player makes an unsuccessful burgle attempt, Smaug the Golden attacks the first player.

name: Inside Information
text:
Players cannot defeat this stage while Smaug the Magnificent is in play.

Forced: If the total number of progress on this stage is greater than the total remaining hit points on Smaug the Magnificent, remove Smaug the Magnificent from play.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game and discovered any treasure successfully burgled from The Lonely Mountain.

name: Thieves! Fire! Murder!
text: Forced: After placing the 7th progress token on this stage, remove all damage from Smaug the Magnificent and set him aside, out of play. Then, add Smaug the Golden to the staging area and reset the quest deck to stage 2B.

name: The Gathering of the Clouds
text: When Revealed: Put stage 2, stage 3, and stage 4 into play at the same time. Then, remove this stage from play.

name: The Eastern Spur
text:
Players cannot advance from this stage unless stage 3 and stage 4 are complete.

Forced: If there is no progress on this stage at the end of the round, each player must discard 1 random card from his hand.

name: Battle in the Dale
text:
Players cannot advance from this stage unless stage 2 and stage 4 are complete.

Forced: If there is no progress on this stage at the end of the round, the first player adds the topmost enemy in the discard pile to the staging area, if able.

name: The Defense of Ravenhill
text:
Players cannot advance from this stage unless stage 2 and stage 3 are complete.

Forced: If there is no progress on this stage at the end of the round, each player must discard all resources from each hero's resource pool.

name: The Clouds Burst
text:
When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Bodyguard of Bolg and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Progress cannot be placed on this stage. While Bolg is in the staging area, it is considered to be engaged with the first player.

If Bolg is destroyed, the players win the game.

name: Frodo Baggins
text: Response: Spend 1 ☺ resource and exhaust The One Ring to cancel the effects of an encounter card just revealed from the encounter deck.  Shuffle that card back into the encounter deck and reveal another encounter card.

name: Sam Gamgee
text: Response: After you engage an enemy with a higher engagement cost than your threat, ready Sam Gamgee.  He gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú until the end of the round.

name: Merry
text:
Merry get +1 Û for each Hobbit hero you control.

Response: After Merry participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, ready another character that participated in that attack.

name: Pippin
text:
Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost for each Hobbit hero you control.

Response: After you engage an enemy with a engagement cost higher than your threat, draw a card.

name: Fatty Bolger
text: Action: Exhaust Fatty Bolger to choose an enemy in the staging area and raise you threat by that enemy's $. Until the end of the phase, that enemy does not contribute its $. (Limit once per round.)

name: Bill the Pony
text:
Lower the cost to play Bill the Pony by 2 if you control Sam Gamgee.

Each Hobbit character gets +1 hit point.

name: Barliman Butterbur
text: If each hero you control has the Hobbit trait, damage from undefended attacks against you may be assigned to Barliman Butterbur.

name: Farmer Maggot
text: Response: After Farmer Maggot enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you. (Deal 2 damage instead if that enemy's engagement cost is higher than your threat.)

name: Halfling Determination
text: Action: Choose a Hobbit character. That character gets +2 Ò, +2 Û, and +2 Ú until the end of the phase.

name: Smoke Rings
text: Action: Reduce your threat by 1 for each Pipe you control.  Each hero with a Pipe attachment gets +1 Ò until the end of the phase.

name: Take No Notice
text:
Lower the cost to play Take No Notice by 1 for each Hobbit or Ranger hero you control.

Action: Add 5 to each enemy's engagement cost until the end of the round.

name: Frodo's Intuition
text: Action: Each hero you control gets +1 Ò until the end of the round.  Draw 1 card for each Hobbit hero you control.

name: Hobbit Cloak
keywords: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Limit 1 per hero.
text: Attached hero gets +2 Ú while defending against an attack made by an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat.

name: Dagger of Westernesse
text: Attached hero gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if attacking an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat).

name: Hobbit Pipe
keywords: Attach to a Hobbit. Limit 1 per character.
text: Response. After your threat is reduced by an event card effect, exhaust Hobbit Pipe to draw a card.

name: Elf-stone
text:
Attach to the active location.  Attached location gets +1 quest point.

Response: After attached location leaves play as an explored location, the first player puts 1 ally into play from his hand.

name: Mr. Underhill
text:
Setup: Attach to the Ring-bearer.

Action: Add Mr. Underhill to the Victory display to choose an enemy engaged with you.  Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot attack you.

name: Tireless Ranger
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero.

Attached hero gets +1 Ú and gains the Ranger trait.

name: Skilled Healer
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero.

Attached hero gets +2 hit points and gains the Healer trait.

name: Valiant Warrior
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero.

Attached hero gets +1 Û and gains the Warrior trait.

name: Noble Hero
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero.

Attached hero gets +1 Ò and gains the Noble trait.

name: Three is Company
text:
When a player fails a Hide test, each Nazgul enemy in the staging area engages that player. (Trigger Forced effects after resolving this effect.)

The players cannot advance unless Bag End is in the victory display.

name: A Shortcut to Mushrooms
text:
When Revealed: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Black Rider, reveals it (cannot be cancelled), and adds it to the staging area.  Shuffle the encounter deck.

When a player makes a Hide test, add 1 to the total $ for each ally that player controls.

When a player fails a Hide test, each Nazgul enemy in the staging area engages that player. (Trigger Forced effects after resolving this effect.)

name: Escape to Buckland
text:
When Revealed: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Black Rider, reveals it (cannot be cancelled), and adds it to the staging area.  Shuffle the encounter deck.

When a player fails a Hide test, each Nazgul enemy in the staging area engages that player. (Trigger Forced effects after resolving this effect.)

Response: After a player makes a successful Hide test, place X progress on a non-unique location in play.  X is twice the number of players in the game.

name: Trouble in Bree
text: The players cannot advance while The Prancing Pony is in play.

name: Into the Wild
text:
When Revealed: Add Midgewater to the staging area.  Each player places 1 progress on the current quest.

Forced: At the end of the round, either remove X progress from the current quest or shuffle 1 out of play Ringwraith into the encounter deck.  X is the number of players in the game.

The players cannot advance while Midgewater is in play.

name: The Ringwraiths Attack
text: If there are no Nazgul enemies in play, the players win the game.

name: Pursued by the Enemy
text:
The players cannot advance unless The Last Bridge is in the victory display.

Forced: At the end of the round, reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1.

name: Race To Rivendell
text:
When Revealed: Add Ford of Bruinen and The Witch-king to the staging area.

While at least 1 Nazgul enemy is in play, Race to Rivendell gets +15 quest points.

Forced: At the end of the round. Reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 1
name: A Shadow of the Past
text: Resolution: Choose Gandalf's Delay or The Ring Draws Them and add it to the Campaign Pool.  Then, choose Gildor Inglorion or Mr. Underhill and add it to the Campaign Pool.  The chosen cards have been earned by the players.

name: Bag End
text: Response: After Bag End leaves play, each player draws 1 card for each Hobbit hero he controls.

name: Woody End
text: While Woody End is the Active location, reduce each Hide X value by 1.

name: Stock-Brook
text: When Revealed: Immediately travel to Stock-Brook.  If another location is currently active, return it to the staging area.

name: Bamfurlong
text: Response: After the players travel to Bamfurlong, each player engaged with a Nazgul enemy may ready a hero he controls.

name: Bucklebury Ferry
text:
While there is at least 1 other location in play, the players cannot travel here.

Travel: The first player must make a Hide 3 test to travel here.

After Bucklebury Ferry leaves play as an explored location, the players win the game.

name: Green Hill Country
text: While Green Hill Country is the active location, characters get +1 Ò while committed to Hide tests.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if you have failed a Hide test this round).

name: Stock Road
text:
While Stock Road is in the staging area, add 2 to the total $ of the discarded cards when a player resolves a Hide test.

Travel: The first player must make a Hide 1 test to travel here.

name: The Marish
text: Forced: After a player fails a Hide test, shuffle a Nazgul enemy from the discard pile into the encounter deck, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending player failed a Hide test this round).

name: Black Rider
text: Forced: After engaged player fails a Hide test, Black Rider makes an immediate attack.

name: Evil Crow
text: While Evil Crow is engaged with a player, that player adds 1 to the Hide value for each Hide test he makes.
shadow: Shadow: If you have failed a Hide test this round, this attack is considered undefended.

name: Crawling Towards Him
text: When Revealed: If you have failed a Hide test this phase, remove each character you control form the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Hunting For The Ring
text: When Revealed: Starting with the first player, each player much either return a Nazgul enemy engaged with him to the staging area or make a Hide 2 test.

name: Have You Seen Baggins?
text: When Revealed: Attach to a hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Forced: After a player fails a Hide test, discard attached hero.")

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 2
name: A Knife in the Dark
text: Resolution: Starting with the first player, each player may choose one of the following boon cards and attach it to a hero he controls: Tireless Ranger, Skilled Healer, Valiant Warrior, Noble Hero. The chosen cards have been earned by the players.

name: The Prancing Pony
text:
Response: After the players travel here, the first player puts 1 ally into play from his hand.

Forced: After the Prancing Pony leaves play, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until X enemies have been discarded.  X is the number of players in the game. Put each enemy discarded by this effect into play engaged with the first player.

name: Weathertop
text:
While Weathertop is in the victory display, each enemy in play gets -1 $.

Travel: The first player must exhaust The One Ring to travel here.

name: Chetwood
text: While Chetwood is in the staging area, Spy enemies get +1 $ and +1 Û.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards 1 random card from his hand.

name: Midgewater
text:
While Midgewater is the active location, enemies cannot attack, take damage, or be engaged.

Forced: After Midgewater becomes the active location, return each engaged enemy in play to the staging area.

name: Weather Hills
text:
Response: After the players travel here, place 1 non-unique enemy in play facedown under this location.  While an enemy is under this location, it is out of play.

Forced: After this location leaves play, return each enemy under it to the staging area face-up.

name: Rider of Mordor
text:
While Rider of Mordor is engaged with a player, characters that player controls get -1 Ò.

While The One Ring is exhausted, Rider of Mordor gets -10 engagement cost.

name: Bill Ferny
keywords: Players cannot optionally engage Bill Ferny.
text: Forced: At the beginning of the staging step, either shuffle 1 out of play Ringwraith into the encounter deck or each player raises his threat by 1 for each non-☺ hero he committed to the quest.

name: Shady Bree-Lander
text: While the One Ring is exhausted, Shady Bree-lander gains: "Cannot be optionally engaged."
shadow: Shadow: Defending character gets -1 Ú (-2 Ú instead if The One Ring is exhausted).

name: Squint-Eyed Southerner
text: When Revealed: You must either shuffle an out of play Ringwraith into the encounter deck or reveal an additional encounter card.

name: Unwanted Attention
text: When Revealed: You must either remove 2 heroes you control from the quest or shuffle an out of play Ringwraith into the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Black Breath
text: When Revealed: Attach to a hero you control.  (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Reduce attached hero's Ò, Û, and Ú to 0.")

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 3
name: Flight to the Ford
text: Resolution: Add each burden card in player, in the encounter deck, and in the discard pile to the Campaign Pool.  Then added cards have been earned by the players.

name: An Evil Wound
keywords: Attach to the Ring-bearer. Attached hero cannot be healed.
text:
When attached hero would take any amount of damage, reduce the Ring-bearer's life an equal amount instead.

If the Ring-bearer's life reaches zero, the players lose the game.

name: The Last Bridge
text:
X is the number of players in the game.

Travel: The first player must reveal the top card of the burden deck and resolve that card as if it were just revealed from the encounter deck to travel here.

name: Ford of Bruinen
text:
Response: After Ford of Bruinen leaves play as an explored location, all engaged enemies are discarded.

Travel: The first player must reveal the top card of the encounter deck to travel here.

name: The Troll's Camp
text: While The Troll's Camp is the active location, each hero gets +1 Ò, +1 Û +1 Ú.

name: Ettenmoors
text:
While Ettenmoors is the active location, do not deal Nazgul enemies a shadow card during the combat phase.

Forced: After any amount of progress is placed on Ettenmoors, reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1.

name: The Old Road
text: Action: Place the top card of the burden deck on the encounter deck to place 4 progress on The Old Road. (Use this action only if you are playing campaign mode.)

name: Fell Rider
text: While Fell Rider is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, the first player must either reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1 or engage Fell Rider."

name: Stricken Dumb
text: When Revealed: You must either shuffle the top card of the burden deck into the encounter deck and reveal an additional encounter card, or raise each player's threat by 3 and immediately end the quest phase (do not resolve the quest).

name: The Enemy is Upon Us!
text: When Revealed: Each engaged enemy makes an immediate attack.  If no attack is made this way, The Enemy is Upon Us! gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove all progress from the current quest.

name: Pain Assailed Him
text: When Revealed: Reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1.  Then, reduce the Ring-bearers Ò, Û, and Ú to 0 until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1.

name: The Nine are Abroad
text: When Revealed: Treat the text box of each character in play as blank (except for Traits) until the end of the round.  If there is a Nazgul enemy in the staging area, The Nine are Abroad gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: The Witch-king
text:
The Witch-king gets -30 engagement cost while The One Ring is exhausted.

Characters with 1 Ò or less cannot defend attacks made by The Witch-king.

name: Ringwraith
text: Forced: When Ringwraith attacks, deal it an additional shadow card if The One Ring is exhausted.
shadow: Shadow: Shuffle this card into the encounter deck.

name: Pale Blade
text: When Revealed: Attach to a Nazgul enemy in play, if able. (Counts as a Weapon attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per enemy.  Attached enemy gets +1 Û and cannot take non-combat damage.")

name: Power In Their Terror
text: When Revealed: Each ally gets -1 Ò until the end of the round. Deal 2 damage to each ally with 0 Ò.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

name: Pathless Country
text: Pathless Country gets +4 quest points while in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: After this attack, the attacking enemy engages the next player then makes an immediate attack.

name: Piercing Cry
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Nazgul enemy. Either add it to the staging area or put it into play engaged with the first player.  Shuffle the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Black Steed
text: When Revealed: Attach to a Nazgul enemy in play, if able. (Counts a Mount attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets -10 engagement cost and gains. 'Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, return attached enemy to the staging area.'")

name: Rode Like a Gale
text: When Revealed: Return each engaged Nazgul enemy to the staging area.  If no enemies were returned to the staging area by this effect, Rode Like a Gale gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Lure of the Ring
text: When Revealed: The first player must either exhaust The One Ring or raise his threat by 3.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if The One Ring is exhausted).

name: Gildor Inglorian
keywords: The first player gains control of Gildor Inglorian.
text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard Gildor Inglorion.  The first player may spend 1 ☺ resource to cancel this effect.

name: Gandalf's Delay
text:
Setup: Add Gandalf's Delay to the staging area.

Each player draws 1 less card in his starting hand.

name: The Ring Draws Them
text: When Revealed: At the end of the phase, each enemy in the staging area engages the first player.  If The One Ring is exhausted, this effect cannot be cancelled.

name: Weight of the Ring
text: When Revealed: Attach to the Ring-bearer. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: At the beginning of each quest phase, either exhaust The One Ring or reveal an additional encounter card this phase.")

name: Fear of Discovery
text: When Revealed: The first player must either exhaust the Ring-bearer or an additional encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 3.

name: Eaten Alive!
text: When Revealed: The first player must deal X damage divided among heroes he controls where X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

name: Panicked
text: When Revealed: The first player raises his threat by 3 and passes the first player token to the next player.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player exhausts a character he controls.

name: Overcome by Terror
text: When Revealed: The first player must exhaust The One Ring. If The One Ring is already exhausted, the first player must discard 2 cards at random from his hand.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards 1 card at random from his hand.

name: The One Ring
text:
Setup: The first player claims The One Ring and attaches it to the Ring-bearer.

Attached hero does not count against the hero limit. The first player gains control of the attached hero.

If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Frodo Baggins
text: Response: After Frodo Baggins exhausts to defend an attack, exhaust The One Ring and spend 1 ☺ resource to target the attacking enemy. Then, this attack deals no damage and each player raises his threat by 2.

name: Gandalf
text: Play with the top card of your deck faceup. Once per phase, you may play the top card of your deck as if it was in your hand. When playing a card this way, Gandalf is considered to have the printed Ì, Î, Ï, and Ê icons.

name: Galadriel
keywords: At the end of the round, discard Galadriel from play.
text: Response: After you play Galadriel from your hand, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an attachment of cost 3 or less and put it into play. Put the remaining cards back in any order.

name: Boromir
text:
Boromir gets +2 Ú while defending against an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat.

Response: After Boromir takes any amount of damage, ready him.

name: Elrond
keywords: At the end of the round, discard Elrond from play.
text: Response: After Elrond enters play, choose one: heal all damage on a hero, discard a Condition attachment, or each player draws 1 card.

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: Response: After Bilbo Baggins enters play, search your deck for a Pipe attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Flame of Anor
text: Action: Add Flame of Anor to the victory display and discard the top card of your deck to ready an Istari character you control. That character gets +X Û until the end of the phase where X is the discarded card's cost.

name: Gandalf's Staff
text: Action: Exhaust Gandalf's Staff to (choose one): choose a player to draw 1 card, add 1 resource to a hero's resource pool, or discard a shadow card from a non-unique enemy.

name: Wizard Pipe
keywords: Attach to an Istari character. Limit 1 per character.
text: Action: Exhaust Wizard Pipe to exchange a card in your hand with the top card of your deck.

name: Fellowship of the Ring
text:
Each hero gets +1 Ò.

Forced: After a character is destroyed, discard Fellowship of the Ring.

name: Sting
keywords: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Restricted.
text:
Attached hero gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú.

Response: After attached hero exhausts to defend an attack, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to the discarded card’s $.

name: Mithril Shirt
text: Attached hero gets +1 Ú and +1 hit point.

name: Glamdring
keywords: Attach to a Warrior hero or Gandalf. Restricted.
text:
Attached hero gets +2 Û.
Response: After attached character destroys an Orc enemy, draw 1 card.

name: Andúril
keywords: Attach to a Noble hero or Aragorn. Restricted.
text:
Attached hero gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú.
Response: After an attack in which the attached hero defended resolves, exhaust Andúril to target the enemy that just attacked. Declare attached hero as an attacker agaisnt that enemy (and resolve the attack).

name: Phial of Galadriel
keywords: Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
text: Action: Add Phial of Galadriel to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool, to give each enemy engaged with you –4 Û until the end of the round.

name: Three Golden Hairs
keywords: Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
text: Action: Add Three Golden Hairs to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool, to lower each player’s threat by 3. Then, each player draws 3 cards.

name: Lórien Rope
keywords: Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
text: Action: Add Lórien Rope to the victory display, and remove it from the campaign pool to give each location in the staging area -2 $ until the end of the phase.

name: Leaf-wrapped Lembas
keywords: Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
text: Action: Add Leaf-wrapped Lembas to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool, to ready all heroes in play.

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 4
name: The Ring Goes South
text: Resolution: If Lust for the Ring is attached to a hero, the players have earned that burden.

name: The Council of Elrond
text: Forced: At the end of the planning phase, each player places the top card of his deck faceup in front of him, in player order, until there are a total of 4 faceup cards between the players. The first player chooses 1 faceup card to player for 0 cost, 1 to add to its owners hand, 1 to discard, and 1 to shuffle into its owner's deck. Then, either shuffle Lust for the Ring into the encounter deck, or raise each player's threat by 5. Advance to stage 2.

name: The Nine Walkers
text:
During the travel phase, the players must travel to a location, if able.

Forced: After an enemy engages a player, place 1 damage on the active location, if able.

name: The Hunt is Up!
text:
During the travel phase, the players must travel to a location, if able.
Forced: After a location enters play, place 1 damage on it.

Forced: After an enemy engages a player, place 1 damage on the active location, if able.

name: The Gates of Moria
text:
There can be 2 active locations. During the travel phase, the players must travel to a location, if able.
Forced: After an enemy engages a player, place 1 damage on each active location.

If Doors of Durin is explored, the players win the game.

name: Watcher in the Water
keywords: Idestructible. Immune to player card effects.
text:
Cannot leave the staging area but is considered to be engaged with each player.
Forced: After placing the 6th damage here, the first player takes control of the Ring-bearer, exhausted with 1 damage on it.

name: Great Warg Chief
text: Forced: After Great Warg Chief engages you, discard cards from the encounter deck until a Warg enemy is discarded. Put that enemy into play engaged with you.

name: Hound of Sauron
text: Hound of Sauron gets -5 engagement cost for each enemy in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if it was engaged this round).

name: Howling Warg
text: Forced: When Howling Warg attacks, place 1 damage on an active location.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destoys a character, place 1 damage on an active location.

name: Crebain from Dunland
text:
When Revealed: Either exhaust a hero you control, or engage Crebain from Dunland.
Forced: After Crebain from Dunland engages a player, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

name: Redhorn Pass
text: Forced: When Redhorn Pass is explored, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls. X is the number of damage here.

name: Doors of Durin
text:
Progress must be placed on each other active location before it can be placed here. Progress cannot be placed here unless the first player controls the Ring-bearer.

If there are 9 damage tokens here, the players lose the game.

name: Tree-crowned Hill
keywords: While Tree-crowned Hill is the active location, each enemy gets -1 $.
text: Forced: When Tree-crowned Hill is explored, the players, as a group, exhaust X characters in play. X is the number of damage here.

name: Hills of Hollin
text:
While Hills of Hollin is the active location, each enemy in the staging area gets +5 engagement cost.

Forced: When Hills of Hollin is explored, each player raises his threat by 1 for each damage here.

name: Redhorn Foothills
text:
While Redhorn Foothills is the active location, it gains: "Forced: After an enemy is added to the staging area, it gets -5 engagement cost until the end of the round."

Forced: When Redhorn Foothills is explored, each player must discard X cards from his hand at random. X is the number of damage here.

name: Eregion
text: Forced: When Eregion is explored, the players as a group must discard X allies from play. X is the number of damage here.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards a non-objective attachment he controls.

name: Regiments of Crows
text: When Revealed: Place 3 damage on each active location.
shadow: Shadow: Undefended damage from this attack must be assigned to the active location.

name: Snowdrifts
text: When Revealed: Attach to the active location. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text, "Limit 1 per location. No more than 3 progress can be placed on attached location each round.") If Snowdrifts is not attached to the active location, it gains surge.

name: Bitter Cold
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either discard each ally he controls, or raise his threat by 1 for each ally he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Storm of Howls
text: When Revealed: Either the Warg enemy in the staging area with the highest engagement cost attacks you, or each Warg enemy gets -20 engagement cost until the end of the round. If no Warg enemy is in the staging area, Storm of Howls gains surge.

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 5
name: Journey in the Dark
text: Resolution: The first player must choose one of the burden treachery cards (Pursued by the Enemy or Shadow of Fear), and one of the burden objective cards (Grevious Wound or Overcome by Grief) to add to the Campaign Pool. If The Balrog is still in play, the first player must choose all 4 burden cards instead. The chosen burdens have been earned by the players.

name: The Long Dark of Moria
text: Forced: After a player optionally engages an enemy, remove 1 damage token from Doom, Doom, Doom.

name: Drums in the Deep
text:
If there are no enemies in the staging area at the beginning of the quest phase, the first player reveals an additional encounter card during the staging step.

The players cannot advance unless there are X resource tokens on this stage. X is the number of players times 3.

Forced: After an enemy is defeated, place 1 resource token on this stage.

name: The Bridge of Kazad-dûm
text:
No more than 5 progress can be placed on this stage each round.

The players cannot defeat this stage while The Great Bridge is in play. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Doom, Doom, Doom
text:
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, remove 1 damage token from Doom, Doom, Doom. Then, if there are no damage tokens here, add The Balrog to the staging area.

Forced: At the end of the quest phase, The Balrog makes an attack if it is in play.

name: The Balrog
keywords: Indestructible. Cannot be optionally engaged. The Balrog and shadow cards dealt to The Balrog are immune to player card effects.
text: While in the staging area, The Balrog is considered to be engaged with the first player and only the first player can declare attackers against The Balrog.

name: Orc-chieftan
keywords: Cannot have attachments. Allies cannot defend against Orc-chieftan.
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, Orc-chieftan engages the first player.

name: Great Cave-troll
text: For each point of excess combat damage dealt by Great Cave-troll (damage that is dealt beyond the remaining hit points of the character damaged by its attack) remove 1 progress from the current quest.

name: Uruk from Mordor
text: When Revealed: Uruk from Mordor makes an attack against the first player.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, attacking enemy makes an additional attack.

name: Moria Orc
text: When Revealed: Either remove 1 damage from Doom, Doom, Doom, or reveal an additional encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: The defending player raises his threat by 1 for each enemy engaged with him.

name: Moria Archer
text:
X is the number of players in the game.

When Revealed: Assign X damage among characters you control.

name: The Great Bridge
text: Response: When The Great Bridge is explored, discard a hero from play to deal X damage to The Balrog. X is that hero's threat cost. Then, The Balrog loses all keywords for the remainder of the game. Any player may trigger this response.

name: Chamber of Mazarbul
text:
The players cannot advance to the next stage.

Travel: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a different enemy and adds it to the staging area to travel here. One of those enemies must be Orc-chieftan, if able.

name: Mines of Moria
text: While Mines of Moria is in the staging area, progress must be placed on Mines of Moria before it can be placed on the current quest.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards a non-objective attachment he controls (2 non-objective attachments instead if his threat is 35 or higher).

name: Many-pillard Hall
text: Many-pillard Hall gets +1 $ for each Many-pillared Hall in play.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending player's threat is 35 or higher).

name: Darkened Stairway
text: Forced: After Darkened Stairway is explored, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is a location, add it to the staging area.

name: Ancient Guardroom
text:
While Ancient Guardroom is the active location, each enemy in play gets –1 Û.

Travel: Discard the top card of the encounter deck to travel here. Each player raises his threat by X, where X is the discarded card's $.

name: They Are Coming!
text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until X enemies are discarded. X is the number of players in the game. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

name: We Cannot Get Out
text: When Revealed: Each player assigns X damage among characters he controls. X is the number of exhausted characters he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Assign X damage among characters you control. X is the number of enemies engaged with you.

name: Deep Fissure
text: When Revealed: Remove a character you control from the quest and discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that character's printed Ò is less than the discarded card's $, discard that character.

name: Fool of a Took!
text: When Revealed: Remove 1 damage token from Doom, Doom, Doom, or The Balrog makes an attack, if able.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck.

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 6
name: Breaking of the Fellowship
text:
Resolution: If Fallen into Evil is attached to a hero, add that hero to the list of Fallen Heroes in the Campaign Log.

The first player chooses either Followed by Night or Ill Fate to be added to the Campaign Pool. The chosen burden card has been earned by the players.

Each player chooses 1 hero he controls (other than the Ring-bearer or Aragorn) to be taken captive. Record the name of each "captive" in the Notes section of the Campaign Log.

name: The Great River
text:
Enemies get +2 Ú and cannot be engaged. Skip the encounter phase.

The players cannot advance while The Argonath is in play.

name: The Company Divided
text: Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, shuffle the Seat of Seeing and Frodo's Choice into the encounter discard pile. Then, place the encounter discard pile on the bottom of the encounter deck. Starting with the first player, each player creates his own staging area and advances to a different stage 3A of his choice. In player order, each player moves 1 encounter card from this staging area to his. When there are no encounter cards left at this stage, discard it.

name: Searching the Woods
text:
If Frodo's Choice is not in play, any time players would place progress on this quest, discard an equal number of cards from the encounter deck instead.

Forced: After Frodo's Choice is revealed at this stage, advance to stage 4A.

Response: After you quest successfully, discard a non-unique location in any staging area.

name: Guard the Hobbits
text:
If Frodo's Choice is not in play, any time players would place progress on this quest, discard an equal number of cards from the encounter deck instead.

Forced: After Frodo's Choice is revealed at this stage, advance to stage 4A.

Response: After you quest successfully, choose a player. Ready each of that player's heroes.

name: The Seat of Amon Hen
text:
If Frodo's Choice is not in play, any time players would place progress on this quest, discard an equal number of cards from the encounter deck instead.

Forced: After Frodo's Choice is revealed at this stage, advance to stage 4A.

Response: After you quest successfully, choose a player. That player draws 2 cards and lowers his threat by 2.

name: Orc Hunting
text:
If Frodo's Choice is not in play, any time players would place progress on this quest, discard an equal number of cards from the encounter deck instead.

Forced: After Frodo's Choice is revealed at this stage, advance to stage 4A.

Response: After you quest successfully, discard an enemy engaged with a player.

name: The Ring-bearer Sets Out
text:
During the quest phase, reveal 1 additional encounter card for each player in the game.
Response: After an enemy is revealed at this stage, raise your threat by X to engage that enemy. X is that enemy's $. Each player (at any stage) may trigger this ability once per round.

When this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

name: Frodo's Choice
keywords: If Frodo's Choice is discarded, reveal it instead.
text: When Revealed: Take control of the first player token and the Ring-bearer (and each card attached to it). Attach to the Ring-bearer. For the rest of the game, you cannot lose control of the first player token.

name: Uruk-hai Captain
text: Allies with fewer printed hit points than Uruk-hai Captain cannot defend against Uruk-hai Captain.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Uruk-hai Archer
text:
X is the number of players at this stage.

When Revealed: Discard an ally you control.

name: Uruk-hai Tracker
text: Uruk-hai Tracker gets +2 Û against characters with 2 or fewer printed hit points.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

name: Uruk-hai Hunter
text: When Revealed: Either choose a player to reveal an encounter card, or Uruk-hai Hunter makes an immediate attack against you.

name: Parth Galen
text:
Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and add it to the staging area to travel here. Shuffle the encounter deck.
While Parth Galen is in play, the players cannot win the game.

name: Seat of Seeing
text: Response: When Seat of Seeing is explored, choose a burden card in play, in the encounter deck, or in the discard pile, and remove it from the game. Shuffle the encounter deck. (If you are playing campaign mode, remove that card from the Campaign Pool.)

name: The Argonath
keywords: Immune to player card effects. X is the number of players in the game.
text: The players cannot travel here while Sarn Gebir is in play. While The Argonath is the active location, skip the combat phase.

name: Sarn Gebir
text: Forced: When Sarn Gebir is explored, deal 1 damage to each exhausted character.

name: River Anduin
text: While River Anduin is in the staging area it gains: "Forced: At the end of the travel phase, each player at this stage raises his threat by 1. Then, River Anduin moves to the staging area to the left, if able."

name: Wooded Shoreline
keywords: While Wooded Shoreline is in the staging area, it gains archery 2.
text: Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and add it to the staging area to travel here. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Slopes of Amon Hen
text: Travel: A player at this staging area must engage an enemy in any staging area to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending character has fewer printed hit points than the attacking enemy).

name: Growing Threat
text: When Revealed: Either move 1 enemy engaged with you to the first player's staging area, or Growing Threat gains doomed 2 and surge.
shadow: Shadow: After this attack, move attacking enemy to the first player's staging area.

name: Orcs of the White Hand
text: When Revealed: Remove all damage from each enemy at this stage. Each enemy at this stage gets +1 $, +1 Û, and +1 Ú until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: If the defending character has fewer printed hit points than the attacking enemy, this attack is considered undefended.

name: Black Feathered Arrows
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, add 1 to the archery total at this stage for each ally currently at this stage.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending character has fewer printed hit points than the attacking enemy).

name: Fallen into Evil
text: When Revealed: Attach to a hero and move it to the first player's staging area. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Attached hero loses the hero card type and gains the enemy card type with $ equal to its Ò and engagement cost equal to its threat cost. If Fallen into Evil is discarded, return attached hero to its owner's control."

name: Lust for the Ring
text: When Revealed: Attach to a non-☺ hero in play. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After The One Ring exhausts, raise each player's threat by 1 and reduce attached hero's Ò to 0 until the end of the round."

name: Shadow of Fear
text: When Revealed: Treat the printed text box of each character in play as blank (except for Traits) until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Defending character does not count its Ú.

name: Pursued by the Enemy
text: When Revealed: Each enemy engaged with a player, and not in the staging area, makes an immediate attack.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Overcome by Grief
text:
Setup: Add Overcome by Grief to the staging area.
Forced: After a character is destroyed, if Overcome by Grief is unattached, attach to a hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After a character you control is destroyed, exhaust attached hero. Until the end of the round, attached hero cannot ready.")

name: Grievous Wound
text:
Setup: Add Grievous Wound to the staging area.
Forced: After a hero takes damage, if Grievous Wound is unattached, attach to that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After attached hero exhausts, deal 1 damage to it.")

name: Followed by Night
text: When Revealed: Put the topmost enemy of the encounter deck discard pile into play engaged with you.

name: Ill Fate
text: When Revealed: Attach to a hero you control. (Counts as a Condition Attachment with the text: "Forced: After a character you control is destroyed, raise your threat by 2.")

name: The One Ring
text:
Setup: The first player claims The One Ring and attaches it to the Ring-bearer. 
Attached hero does not count against the hero limit. The first player gains control of attached hero. 

If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Aragorn
text:
The first player gains control of Aragorn. If Aragorn leaves play, the players lose the game. 

Action: Spend 2 resources from Aragorn’s resource pool to ready a hero.

name: Théoden
text: Lower the cost of the first Rohan ally you play from your hand each round by 1 (to a minimum of 0).

name: Treebeard
text: Action: Deal 1 damage on Treebeard to give him +1 Ò and +1 Û until the end of the phase. (Limit 5 times per phase.)

name: Gimli
text: Response: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, ready Gimli.

name: Legolas
text: Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.

name: Quickbeam
keywords: Cannot have attachments. Enters play exhausted.
text: Response: After Quickbeam enters play, deal 1 damage to him to ready him.

name: Háma
text: Combat Action: Ready Háma. He gets +3 Ú until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, discard Háma. (Limit once per round.)

name: Arod
keywords: Attach to a hero or Legolas
text: Response: After attached character participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Arod to place 1 progress token on any location.

name: Ent Draught
keywords: Play only if you control at least 1 Ent character.
text: Attach to a character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +2 hit points.

name: Herugrim
keywords: Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted.
text: Reduce the cost to play Herugrim on Théoden by 1. Response: After attached hero is declared as an attacker, exhaust Herugrim to add attached hero's Ò to its Û for this attack.

name: Entmoot
keywords: Play only if you control at least 1 Ent character.
text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for any number of Ent cards and add them to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Helm! Helm!
keywords: Play only after the resolving enemy attacks step is complete.
text: Combat Action: Exhaust and discard a Rohan ally you control to choose and discard a non-unique enemy engaged with you.

name: The Three Hunters
keywords: Play only if you control ☺ Aragorn.
text: Quest Action: Choose 3 heroes committed to the quest. Ready those heroes. Until the end of the round, each of the chosen heroes gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú.

name: Shadowfax
text:
Gandalf gains ranged and sentinel. 

Action: Exhaust Shadowfax to ready Gandalf.

name: Intimidation
text:
Setup: Attach to a Warrior hero. 

Response: After attached hero is declared as the only attacker against a non-unique enemy, exhaust Intimidation to give that enemy –2 Ú for this attack.

name: Hands of a Healer
text:
Setup: Attach to a Healer hero.

Action: Exhaust attached hero and Hands of a Healer to heal up to 3 damage from a hero.

name: Forewarned
text:
Setup: Attach to a Ranger hero.

Response: After attached hero is declared as a defender against a non-unique enemy, exhaust Forewarned to discard 1 shadow card from that enemy.

name: Leader of Men
text:
Setup: Attach to a Noble hero. 

Response: After attached hero quests successfully, exhaust Leader of Men to add 1 resource to attached hero’s pool.

name: Beyond All Hope
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero.

Attached hero gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, +1 Ú and cannot have treachery card attachments.

name: Palantír of Orthanc
text: Quest Action: Exhaust Aragorn and Palantír of Orthanc to discard the top card of the encounter deck. If Aragorn’s Ò is greater than the discarded card’s $, you may add Palantír of Orthanc to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool to choose a player. That player reveals 1 fewer encounter card this phase (to a minimum of 0).

name: Poisoned Counsels
keywords: Poisoned Counsels functions like a player card.
text: Forced: After you draw this card, discard all other cards in your hand.

name: To Isengard!
text:
Treat each Captive’s text box as blank. Captive heroes are in play but are not under any player’s control. If there are no Captives in play, the players lose the game.

Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, increase the pursuit value by 1. Then, if the pursuit value is 30 or greater, the players lose the game.

name: Uglúk
text: Allies cannot be declared as attackers or defenders against Uglúk.

name: Grishnákh
text:
Forced: After Grishnákh enters play, the first player attaches 1 of the Captives to him. If Grishnákh is defeated, place the attached Captive faceup underneath To Isengard! 

Forced: At the end of the quest phase, deal 1 damage to the attached Captive.

name: Uglúk's Uruk-hai
text: When Revealed: Either increase the pursuit value by 3, or reveal an additional encounter card.

name: The Wold
text:
While The Wold is the active location, it gains: “Response: After The Wold is explored, each player draws 1 card.” 

Travel: Increase the pursuit value by 1.

name: Eastemnet
text:
While Eastemnet is the active location, it gains: “Response: After Eastemnet is explored, add 1 resource to each hero’s resource pool.” 

Travel: Increase the pursuit value by 1.

name: Plains of Rohan
keywords: X is the number of locations in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, increase the pursuit value by 1.

name: Banks of Entwash
text: Forced: After any amount of progress is placed on Banks of Entwash, increase the pursuit value by 1.
shadow: Shadow: Either increase the pursuit value by 1, or this attack is considered undefended.

name: Rest by Night?
text: When Revealed: Either immediately end the quest phase and increase the pursuit value by 3, or deal 1 damage to each character committed to the quest. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Strange Weariness
text: When Revealed: Each character committed to the quest gets –1 Ò until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Unseen Barrier
text: When Revealed: The players cannot place more than 3 progress on the current quest this round. (This does not count progress placed on any active location.)
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, increase the pursuit value by 1.

name: The Defense of Helm's Deep
keywords: Add 1 to the total $ in the staging area for each resource token here.
text:
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, place 1 resource token here. 

If there are 8 resource tokens here, add The Defense of Helm’s Deep to the victory display and advance to stage 5A.

name: Wild Hillman
text: Forced: After Wild Hillman attacks, place 1 progress on the active location.
shadow: Shadow: Place 1 progress on the active location. Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each progress on the active location.

name: Warrior of Dunland
text:
When Revealed: Warrior of Dunland makes an immediate attack against you. 
Forced: After Warrior of Dunland attacks and destroys a character, place 3 progress on the active location.

name: Soldier of Isengard
text: Forced: After Soldier of Isengard attacks and destroys a character, place 1 progress on the current quest.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

name: The Hornburg
text:
While The Hornburg is the active location, reduce the archery total by 1 for each player in the game.

Forced: When The Hornburg is explored, assign X damage among characters in play. X is the number of enemies in play.

name: Deeping Wall
keywords: While Deeping Wall is the active location, each hero gets +1 Ú.
text: Forced: When Deeping Wall is explored, raise each player’s threat by 4.

name: Deeping Culvert
keywords: X is 1 more than the number of allies controlled by the first player.
text: Forced: When Deeping Culvert is explored, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy, reveals it, and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Postern Door
keywords: While Postern Door is the active location, each hero gets +1 Û.
text: Forced: When Postern Door is explored, until the end of the round, players cannot declare attacks.

name: Helm's Gate
text:
While Helm’s Gate is the active location, if any player is not engaged with an enemy, the first player reveals an encounter card at the end of each staging step. 

Forced: When Helm’s Gate is explored, each enemy gets –20 engagement cost and +2 Û until the end of the round.

name: Scaling Ladders
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to the active location. (Counts as a Siege attachment with the text: “Each enemy gets +1 $.”)
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, place 1 progress on the current quest.

name: Devilry of Saruman
text: When Revealed: Place 3 progress on the current quest (bypassing any active location). Until the end of the round, treat each character’s text box as it was blank (except for Traits).
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û and gains Toughness 2 until the end of the round.

name: Reckless Hate
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: The enemy in the staging area with the highest Û makes an immediate attack against you. If no attack is made this way, Reckless Hate gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Night Without End
text:
Peril. Doomed 2.
When Revealed: Either remove 1 resource token from The Defense of Helm’s Deep, or reveal 2 additional encounter cards.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Ent of Fangorn
text: While Ent of Fangorn is in the staging area, it gains: “Quest Action: Exhaust a hero you control to discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that hero’s Ò is greater than the discarded card’s $, place 1 resource here. Then, if there are 3 resources here, discard them to take control of Ent of Fangorn. Any player may trigger this effect.”

name: Saruman
keywords: Indestructible. Immune to player card effects. Cannot leave the staging area.
text: Forced: When Saruman is dealt a shadow card with the Wizardry keyword, the defending player resolves its effect as if he is the only player in the game.

name: Saruman's Staff
text:
Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, Saruman attacks that player. Deal and resolve 2 shadow cards for this attack. Then, remove 1 damage from Saruman. 

While Saruman has any hit points remaining, the players cannot win the game.

name: Gríma
text:
Doomed 2.
Forced: After Grima attacks a player, that player shuffles Gríma back into the encounter deck and reveals an encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: This attack is considered undefended.

name: Lieutenant of Orthanc
text: Forced: After Lieutenant of Orthanc attacks and destroys a character, that character’s controller discards 1 random card from his hand.

name: Isengard Orc
text:
Peril. Archery 1.
When Revealed: Either discard 1 random card from your hand, or reveal an encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: Until the end of the round, attacking enemy gets +2 Ú.

name: Wolf of Isengard
text: Forced: When Wolf of Isengard is dealt a shadow card with the Wizardry keyword, either discard 1 card from your hand, or Wolf of Isengard makes an additional attack against you after this one.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to defending character.

name: Orthanc
text: While Orthanc is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After the players quest successfully, the first player looks at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck, reveals 1, and discards the others.”

name: Gates of Isengard
text: Forced: When Gates of Isengard is explored, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Ring-wall of Isengard
text:
While Ring-wall of Isengard is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After any amount of damage is healed from a character, its owner discards 1 card from his hand.” 

Wizardry: Each player discards 1 random card from his hand.

name: Underground Armoury
text:
While Underground Armoury is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After an enemy engages a player, deal it a shadow card.” 

Wizardry: Each player exhausts a character he controls.

name: Steaming Vent
text:
While Steaming Vent is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a player commits characters to the quest, he deals 1 damage to a questing character he controls.” 

Wizardry: Assign X damage among characters in play. X is 1 more than the number of players in the game.

name: Plain of Isengard
keywords: X is the number of players in the game.
text:
While Plain of Isengard is in the staging area, archery damage must be assigned to allies, if able. 

Wizardry: Each player discards 1 ally he controls.

name: Open Pit
text:
While Open Pit is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a player draws any number of cards from a player card effect, he raises his threat by 2.”

Wizardry: Each player raises his threat by 2.

name: Blast of Sorcery
text: When Revealed: Assign X damage among characters committed to the quest. X is 1 more than the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending player has 1 or fewer cards in his hand).

name: Poisoned Vapour
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Exhaust each damaged character. Until the end of the combat phase, treat each damaged character’s text box as if was blank.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

name: Machines of Isengard
text: When Revealed: Trigger the Wizardry effect on the active location. If no Wizardry effect is triggered this way, Machines of Isengard gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 random card from your hand.

name: Isengard Uruk
text: When Revealed: Either assign 3 damage among characters you control, or reveal an additional encounter card.

name: Uruk-hai Fighter
text: Forced: After Uruk-hai Fighter attacks and destroys a character, return it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

name: Fighting Uruk-hai
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Uruk-hai enemy, reveal it, and put it into play engaged with you. Shuffle the encounter deck. Until the end of the round, each enemy engaged with you adds its $ to the total $ in the staging area.

name: Snaga
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 random card from your hand. Snaga gets +X $ until the end of the round, where X is the discarded card’s cost.

name: Saruman's Orders
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either return an enemy engaged with him to the staging area, or reveal an encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, return attacking enemy to the staging area.

name: Saruman's Voice
text: When Revealed: Remove a hero from the quest and attach Saruman’s Voice to that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Forced: When attached hero commits to the quest, is declared as an attacker or defender, or triggers its ability, its controller must discard 1 card from his hand.”)

name: Follow the Orcs
text:
X is the pursuit value.

Uglúk cannot leave the staging area or take damage.

Forced: At the end of the combat phase, increase the pursuit value by 1 for each enemy in the staging area.

name: Rescue the Captives
text:
X is the pursuit value.

Response: After an enemy is defeated, reduce the pursuit value by 1.

The players cannot defeat this stage while Uglúk is in play. If the players defeat this stage, they have rescued each Captive hero and won the game.

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 7
name: The Uruk-hai
text: Resolution: If the pursuit value is 25 or lower, the players must choose: either each player earns one of the Skill boons (Intimidation, Hands of a Healer, Forewarned, or Leader of Men) and attaches it to a hero he controls, or one player earns the boon, Beyond All Hope, and chooses a hero from the list of fallen heroes. That player takes control of the chosen hero (removing it from the list of fallen heroes) and attaches Beyond all Hope to it. If a player controls more than 3 non-☺ heroes, he must remove heroes from the Campaign Log until he controls only 3 heroes. Changing heroes as a result of earning Beyond All Hope does not incur a +1 threat penalty. Add the earned cards to the Campaign Pool.

name: The King of the Golden Hall
text:
When Revealed: Each player chooses 1 ally in his hand that matches the sphere of a hero he controls and puts it into play under his control.

Skip the quest phase and combat phase.

Forced: At the end of the round, advance to stage 2A.
sideB: The King of the Golden Hall

name: Assault on Helm's Deep
text:
Defense. 
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, if the number of enemies in the staging area is less than the number of players in the game, the first player reveals an encounter card.

Forced: At the end of the round place 1 progress here for each enemy in the staging area (bypassing any active location).

name: The Hosts of Isengard
text:
Defense.

Forced: After resolving the quest, if the encounter deck did not place at least 1 progress on this stage as the result of questing, the first player reveals 1 encounter card.

name: The Wall is Breached!
text:
Defense. 
Forced: After a character is destroyed, place 1 progress on this stage (bypassing any active location). 

If this stage is defeated, the players lose the game.

name: The King Rides Out
text:
Skip the quest phase. Players cannot reduce their threat.

If there are no enemies in play, the players win the game.

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 8
name: Helm's Deep
text: Resolution: Each player with a copy of Poisoned Counsels in his hand, deck or discard pile has earned that burden. Add the earned cards to the campaign pool.

name: Rouse the Ents
text:
Players cannot draw cards or gain resources. Do not commit characters to the quest or reveal encounter cards during the quest phase. 
Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 resource here. Then, the players may advance to stage 2. If the players advance, the first player shuffles the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and reveals 1 encounter card for each resource here. Then, remove each Ent objective in the staging area from the game.

name: Breaking Isengard
text:
The players cannot travel to Orthanc. 

Forced: After a non-unique location is explored, place 1 damage here. Then, if there are 5 damage tokens here, advance to stage 3A. 

Quest Action: Exhaust Ent of Fangorn to place 2 progress on a non-unique location.

name: The Voice of Saruman
text:
While Orthanc is the active location, Saruman is considered to be engaged with the first player. 
Forced: When Orthanc is explored, cancel any progress placed on the quest this phase and return Orthanc to the staging area.

If a player has 0 cards in his hand, he is eliminated from the game. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

encounterSet: The Lord of the Rings Part 9
name: The Road to Isengard
text: Resolution: If any player has 3 or fewer cards in his hand, the players have earned the Saruman’s Voice burden card. If any player has 3 or more cards in his hand, the players have earned the Palantír of Orthanc boon card. Add the earned cards to the Campaign Pool.

name: Frodo Baggins
text: Action:Spend 1 ☺ resource and exhaust The One Ring to give Frodo Baggins +2 Ò and +2 Û until the end of the round.

name: Faramir
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, ready an ally you control. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Damrod
text:
Reduce the cost of the first Trap card you play each round by 1 (to a minimum of 0).

Response: After a Trap card you control is attached to an enemy, draw 1 card.

name: Anborn
text: Response: After an enemy is added to the staging area, exhaust Anborn to give that enemy +5 engagement cost until the end of the round. Then, deal 1 damage to that enemy.

name: Mablung
text: Response: After Mablung enters play, choose an enemy to get +5 engagement cost until the end of the round. Then, you may engage that enemy, or return it to the staging area.

name: Skinbark
keywords: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted.
text: While Skinbark is attacking alone against an Orc enemy, that enemy does not count its Ú.

name: Gamling
text: Response: After a Rohan ally you control is discarded from play, exhaust Gamling to return that character to your hand.

name: Staff of Lebethron
keywords:
Attach to a Gondor or Hobbit hero.
Restricted.
text: Response: After attached hero exhausts to defend an enemy with engagement cost higher than your threat, exhaust Staff of Lebethron to discard a shadow card from that enemy.

name: Ambush
keywords: Play Ambush into the staging area unattached. If unattached, attach Ambush to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
text: Combat Action: The engaged player discards Ambush to declare an attack against the attached enemy.

name: Snowmane
keywords: Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted.
text:
If attached hero is Theoden, Snowmane loses the restricted keyword.
Response: After the players quest successfully, ready attached hero.

name: Taste it Again!
text: Response: After a hero you control defends an attack made by an enemy with engagement cost higher than your threat, ready that hero. Until the end of the phase, that hero gets +2 Û while attacking that enemy.

name: In the Shadows
keywords: Lower the cost to play In the Shadows by 1 for each Hobbit or Ranger hero you control.
text: Combat Action: Each enemy engaged with you with engagement cost higher than your threat gets -1 Û and -1 Ú until the end of the phase.

name: Speak Your Promise!
text: Action: Ready the Ring-bearer to choose an enemy engaged with you. If the Ring-bearer's Ò is greater than that enemy's $, lower that enemy's Û and Ú by the difference until the end of the phase.

name: Brace of Conies
keywords: Play only if you control the Ring-bearer.
text: Planning Action: Add Brace of Conies to the victory display to (choose 2): heal up to 2 damage from a hero, add 2 resources to a hero’s pool, choose a player to draw 2 cards, or reduce a player's threat by 2.

name: The Searching Eye
keywords: The Searching Eye functions like a player card.
text: Forced: After you draw this card, either exhaust each hero you control, or reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

name: Groping Dead
text:
The engaged player cannot reduce his threat.

Forced: After Groping Dead destroys a character, place 1 mire token on the active location.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, place 1 mire token on the active location.

name: Dead Things
text:
The engaged player cannot reduce his threat.
Forced: After Dead Things destroys a character, the defending player must raise his threat by 3.
shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1 for each Undead enemy engaged with you.

name: Candle-bearer
keywords: The engaged player cannot reduce his threat.
text: Forced: After Candle-bearer destroys a character, it cannot take damage until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Until the end of the round, attacking enemy cannot take damage.

name: Evil-smelling Fens
keywords:
Mire 3.
Forced: When Evil­smelling Fens is discarded by the Mire keyword, deal 1 damage to each character.
text: Travel: Raise each player’s threat by 1 to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to defending character.

name: Shifting Quagmire
keywords:
Surge.
Mire 1. Forced: When Shifting Quagmire is discarded by the Mire keyword, either return a random location from the victory display to the staging area, or raise each player’s threat by 1 for each location in the victory display.
text: Travel: Spend 1 ☺ resource to travel here.

name: Haunted Mere
keywords:
Mire 2.
Forced: When Haunted Mere is discarded by the Mire keyword, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Undead enemy, reveal it, and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.
text: Travel: Exhaust Smeagol to travel here.

name: Stagnant Pools
keywords:
Mire 5.
Forced: When Stagnant Pools is discarded by the Mire keyword, raise each player’s threat by 5.
text:
Stagnant Pools gets +1 $ for each mire token on it. 

Travel: Exhaust Smeagol to travel here.

name: Soft Mires
keywords:
Mire 1.
Forced: When Soft Mires is discarded by the Mire keyword, the first player reveals the top card of the encounter deck.
text: Travel: Each player must raise his threat by 1 to travel here.

name: Creeping Marshes
text: When Revealed: Attach to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, place 1 mire token on each location in the staging area. Then, discard Creeping Marshes.”)

name: Bitter Reek
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: Either raise your threat by 1 for each character you control that is committed to the quest, or deal 1 damage to each character committed to the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by the attacking enemy’s $.

name: A Fell Light
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: Put the topmost Undead enemy in the encounter discard pile into play engaged with you. Each Undead enemy engaged with you makes an immediate attack.
shadow: Shadow: Return the topmost Undead enemy in the encounter discard pile to the staging area.

name: The Black Gate
text:
Forced: At the end of the planning phase, place each Harad enemy in the staging area facedown under The Black Gate.

If there are at least X facedown cards under The Black Gate, the players lose the game. X is 3 more than the number of players.

name: Man of Harad
text: Forced: After Man of Harad engages you, discard 1 random card from your hand.
shadow: Shadow: Discard 1 random card from your hand.

name: Captain of Harad
text: Forced: After Captain of Harad engages you, each Harad enemy gets +1 Û and ­10 engagement cost until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, return attacking enemy to the staging area.

name: The Cross-roads
text: The Cross-roads gets -1 $ for each facedown card under it. The players cannot travel here unless there are no facedown cards under The Cross-roads and at least 20 progress tokens on stage 1B.

name: Henneth Annun
text:
While Henneth Annun is the active location, skip both the encounter phase and combat phase, and  ignore the Forced effects on stage 1B and The Black Gate.

Forced: After Henneth Annun becomes the active location, return each engaged enemy to the staging area.

name: Southward Road
text:
While Southward Road is the active location, each player may optionally engage an additional enemy during the encounter phase. 

Travel: The first player reveals the top facedown card underneath The Cross­roads and adds it to the staging area to travel here.

name: Foothills of Ephel Duath
text:
While Foothills of Ephel Duath is the active location, each Harad enemy gets -1 $.

Travel: The first player engages an enemy in the staging area to travel here.

name: Ithilien Woods
text:
