While Ithilien Woods is the active location, it gains: “Forced: After a player engages a Harad enemy, he readies a character he controls.”

Travel: The first player reveals the top card of the encounter deck to travel here.

name: Hills of Ithilien
text: While Hills of Ithilien is the active location, it gains: “Forced: After a player engages a Harad enemy, deal 1 damage to that enemy.”
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non­objective attachment you control.

name: The Dark Lord's Summons
text: When Revealed: Either place the lowest Û Harad enemy engaged with you facedown under The Black Gate, or reveal the top facedown card from under The Cross-roads and put it into play engaged with you.

name: Marching Up the Road
text: When Revealed: Each player must either return an enemy engaged with him to the staging area, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Harad enemy and put it into play engaged with him.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, place attacking enemy facedown under The Black Gate.

name: Fierce Southrons
text: When Revealed: Either place the lowest $ Harad enemy in the staging area facedown under The Black Gate and reveal an additional encounter card, or each enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against you.

name: Arrows Thick in the Air
text: When Revealed: Each Harad enemy gains Archery 2 until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Either place attacking enemy facedown under The Black Gate after this attack, or it makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Shelob
text:
Shelob gets +1 $ for each resource on her.

Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, either place 1 resource on Shelob, or she makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Morgul Orc
text: When Revealed: Either discard 1 random card from your hand, or reveal an additional encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 random card from your hand.

name: Orc of Citith Ungol
text: When Revealed: Either discard 1 random card from each player’s hand, or Orc of Cirith Ungol makes an immediate attack against you.

name: Morgul Vale
text: Forced: After Morgul Vale is explored, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Morgul Wraith and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Then, the first player must either exhaust The One Ring, or discard 1 random card from each player’s hand.

name: Smeagol's Secret Way
text:
Travel: Either exhaust Smeagol, or discard 1 random card from each player’s hand.

Forced: After Smeagol’s Secret Way is explored, each player either exhausts a character he controls, or discards 1 random card from his hand.

name: Cleft of Cirith Ungol
text:
While The Cleft of Cirith Ungol is in the victory display, Shelob gets +2 Û, loses Indestructible, and gains: “Shelob engages the first player.”

Travel: Place 1 resource on Shelob to travel here.

name: The Spider's Lair
text:
Forced: When The Spider’s Lair is explored, remove 1 resource from Shelob.

Forced: After The Spider’s Lair becomes the active location, Shelob makes an attack against the first player.

name: The Under-way
text: While The Under-way is in the staging area, each Orc enemy gets -5 engagement cost and gains: “Forced: After this enemy engages a player, deal it a shadow card.”
shadow: Shadow: Deal the attacking enemy 2 additional shadow cards.

name: Deep Dark Passage
text:
While Deep Dark Passage is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: When any amount of progress would be placed on a location in the staging area, reduce that amount by 1.”

Travel: Exhaust Smeagol to travel here.

name: Den of Night
text:
While Den of Night is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a ‘When Revealed’ effect is canceled, place 1 resource on Shelob.”

Travel: Place 1 resource on Shelob to travel here.

name: Exhalation of Decay
text: When Revealed: Each player discards 1 random card from his hand and 1 non-objective attachment he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

name: Many Openings
text: When Revealed: Each location in the staging area gets +1 $ until the end of the round. If the number of locations in the staging area is less than the number of players in the game, reveal an additional encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +X Û, where X is the active location’s $.

name: A Heavy Burden
keywords: Permanent. Setup: Attach to the Ring-bearer.
text: Forced: At the end of the planning phase, either raise each player’s threat by 1, or exhaust the Ring-bearer.

name: Morgul Wraith
text: While The One Ring is exhausted, Morgul Wraith gets -30 engagement cost and gains “immune to player card effects.”

name: Call of the Ring
text: When Revealed: The first player must choose: either search the encounter deck, discard pile, and victory display for a Nazgul enemy and add it to the staging area, or exhaust The One Ring and reveal the top card of the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: We Hates Them
text: When Revealed: Either flip Smeagol to Gollum, or Gollum makes an immediate attack. The first player may spend 1 ☺ resource and exhaust The One Ring to cancel this effect.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if the attacking enemy is Gollum).

name: Oliphaunt
keywords: Cannot have attachments or take more than 3 damage each round.
text: Forced: After Oliphaunt engages you, exhaust each ally you control.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +3 Û.

name: Haradrim Soldier
text: Forced: After Haradrim Soldier engages you, it makes an immediate attack.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Haradrim Archer
keywords: Archery X. X is the number of players in the game.
text: Forced: After Haradrim Archer engages you, assign X damage among characters you control.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

name: Blocked Tunnel
text:
When Revealed: Make Blocked Tunnel the active location, returning any other active location to the staging area.

Action: Exhaust a character with a Weapon attachment to place 3 progress on Blocked Tunnel. (Any player may trigger this effect.)

name: Shelob's Poison
text: When Revealed: Attach to a hero you control and exhaust that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per hero. Treat attached hero’s text box as blank, except for Traits. Attached hero cannot ready.”)
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Shelob, resolve the ‘When Revealed’ effect on Shelob’s Poison.

name: Lurking Malice
text: When Revealed: Either place 1 resource on Shelob, or she makes an immediate attack against you.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Shelob, place 1 resource on her. Then, she gets +1 Û for each resource on her.

name: Rage and Hunger
text: When Revealed: Shelob gets +2 Û until the end of the phase. Then, she makes an immediate attack against each player, in player order.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Shelob, she makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: The One Ring
text: Setup: The first player claims The One Ring and attaches it to the Ring-bearer. Attached hero does not count against the hero limit. The first player gains control of attached hero. If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: The Taming of Smeagol
text:
The players cannot advance unless the first player controls Smeagol.

Forced: After a player declares any number of attackers against Gollum, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Gollum gets +X Ú for this attack, where X is the discarded card's $.

name: Across the Marshes
text:
Progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area.

The players cannot advance unless the first player controls Smeagol and there are at least 4 locations in the victory display.

Forced: At the end of the staging step, if the number of locations in the staging area is less than the number of players in the game, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

name: "Don't Look at the Lights!"
text:
While any player is engaged with an Undead enemy, progress cannot be placed on this stage.

The players cannot defeat this stage unless the first player controls Smeagol. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: The Passage of the Marshes
text: Resolution: Each player must choose: either take a permanent +2 starting threat penalty, or earn 1 copy of The Seatching Eye. Record each player's choice in the campaign log.

name: Ambush the Men of Harad
text:
Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, reveal the top card facedown card from under The Cross­roads and add it to the staging area.

The players cannot defeat this stage while The Cross­roads is in play. When The Cross­ roads is explored, the players win the game.

name: Journey to the Cross-roads
text: Resolution: Each player who chose to shuffle a copy of Brace of Coneys into his deck during setup has earned that boon. Add each earned copy to the campaign pool. Record the name and quantity of each enemy underneath The Black Gate in the notes section of the campaign log.

name: The Stairs of Cirith Ungol
text:
Progress cannot be placed on Underground locations.

Response: After Smeagol’s Secret Way is explored, discard 3 random cards from each player’s hand to discard each Nazgul enemy in the staging area.

Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if Smeagol’s Secret Way is in the victory display, advance to stage 2A.

name: The Spider's Pass
text:
Shelob cannot leave the staging area and Smeagol cannot attack or defend. 
Each player cannot play, or put into play, more than 1 ally each round.
No more than 4 progress can be placed on this stage each round.

name: Gollum's Betrayal
text:
If Gollum is defeated, add him to the victory display. (Do not flip him over.)

While Shelob has at least 1 resource on her, she gains: “Forced: When Shelob is dealt any amount of damage, cancel that damage and discard 1 resource from Shelob instead.” 

The players cannot defeat this stage unless Shelob and Gollum are in the victor display. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Shelob's Lair
text: Resolution: Add A Heavy Burden to the campaign pool. The players have earned that burden.

name: Gollum
keywords: Immune to player card effects. The first player gains control of Smeagol.
text:
Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, flip Smeagol to Gollum.

If Smeagol is destroyed, the players lose the game.

name: Aragorn
text: The first player gains control of Aragorn. If Aragorn leaves play, the players lose the game. While Aragorn has an Artifact attached to him, he gains sentinel and does not exhaust to quest.

name: Éowyn
text: Setup: Reduce your threat by 3. Action: Raise your threat by 3 to ready Éowyn. She gets +9 Û until the end of the phase. (Limit once per game for the group.)

name: Beregond
text: Response: After Beregond defends an attack and takes no damage, reduce the defending player’s threat by 1. (Limit once per round.)

name: Grimbold
text: Combat Action: Discard Grimbold to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

name: Prince Imrahil
text: While there is a hero card in your discard pile, Prince Imrahil loses the ally card type and gains the hero card type.

name: Halbarad
text: Reduce the cost to play Halbarad by 1 for each enemy engaged with you. Each enemy engaged with you gets +10 engagement cost.

name: Ghân-buri-Ghân
text: X is the $ of the active location. Travel Action: Discard Ghân-buri-Ghân to travel to a location without resolving its Travel cost.

name: Sterner than Steel
text: Response: Exhaust a Weapon or Armor card attached to the defending character to cancel a shadow effect just triggered in combat.

name: Desperate Defense
text: Response: After a sentinel character is declared as a defender, it gets +2 Ú for this attack. If this attack deals no damage, ready the defending character.

name: Golden Shield
text: Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero is declared as a defender, exhaust Golden Shield to add attached hero’s Ò to its Ú for this attack.

name: Livery of the Tower
text: Attach to a Gondor hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: Spend X resource from attached hero’s pool to cancel X damage just dealt to attached hero.

name: Roheryn
text: Attach to a Dunedain hero. If attached hero is Aragorn, he gains the Ï icon. Response: After you optionally engage an enemy, exhaust Roheryn and attached hero to declare that hero as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against that enemy.

name: Banner of Elendil
text: Attach to Aragorn. While Aragorn is questing, each other questing character you control gets +1 Ò. While Aragorn is attacking, each other attacking character you control gets +1 Û.

name: Esquire of Rohan
text: Setup: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Rohan trait. Attached hero gets +1 Û while attacking with another Rohan character.

name: Esquire of Gondor
text: Setup: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Attached hero gets +1 Ò while committed to the quest with another Gondor character.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Overcome by Fear
text: Setup: Attach to your threat dial. Limit 1 per threat dial.  Your threat cannot be reduced. Forced: At the end of the round, raise your threat by 1. Then, you may spend 1 ☺ resource to detach Overcome by Fear and set it aside, out of play.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: The Stone of Erech
text: Immune to player card effects. Forced: After The Stone of Erech becomes the active location, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Oathbreaker enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Travel: Remove 5 progress from stage 3B to travel here.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Dark Door
text: While Dark Door is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area. Travel: The first player reveals an encounter card to travel here.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Trysting Place
text: While Trysting Place is in the staging area, each enemy in the staging area cannot take damage. Travel: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Oathbreaker enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Deadly Road
text: While Deadly Road is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a ‘when revealed’ effect is canceled, raise each player’s threat by 1.” Travel: Spend 1 ☺ resource to travel here.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Haunted Path
text: Haunted Path gets +1 $ for each player with threat 35 or higher. Travel: Raise each player’s threat by 1 to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Either raise your threat by 2, or return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Dead Man of Dunharrow
text: Forced: After Dead Man of Dunharrow engages you, either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or raise your threat by 2.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Faithless Dead
text: When Revealed: Either raise each player’s threat by 2, or reveal an additional encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û and loses the Phantom keyword for this attack.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Ghosts of Men
text: When Revealed: Either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or Ghosts of Men makes an immediate attack against you.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Shadow Host
text: Forced: After Shadow Host engages you, either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or it makes an immediate attack.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Blood Runs Chill
text: When Revealed: Each player with threat 35 or higher deals 1 damage to each exhausted character he controls.
shadow: Shadow: If your threat is 35 or higher, defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: The Way is Shut
text: When Revealed: Either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or progress cannot be placed on the current quest until the end of the round.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Whispers in the Dark
text: When Revealed: Either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or each character you control gets -1 Ò, -1 Û, and -1 Ú until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if undefended).

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: No Turning Back
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or discard an ally you control.
shadow: Shadow: Either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Great Corsair Ship
text: X is the number of resources on The Corsiar Fleet. The players cannot travel here unless there are at least 3 Ship locations in the victory display. Travel: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Corsair enemy and adds it to the staging area. One of those enemies must be Corsair Captain, if able.

name: Umbar War Galley
text: While Umbar War Galley is the active location, each Corsair enemy gets -10 engagement cost. Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until a Corsair enemy is discarded. Add the discarded enemy to the staging area.

name: Corsair Dromon
text: While Corsair Dromon is the active location, each Corsair enemy gains Archery 1. Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until a Corsair enemy is discarded. Add the discarded enemy to the staging area.

name: Port of Pelargir
text: While Port of Pelargir is in the staging area, no more than 1 damage can be healed from each character each round.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack damages a character, that character cannot ready until the end of the round.

name: Pelargir Quays
text: Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 damage token here. Then, if there are 4 damage tokens here, discard Pelargir Quays and assign 4 damage among characters in play.

name: Corsair Captain
text: Cannot be optionally engaged. If the active location is a Ship, Corsair Captain gets -30 engagement cost and gains: “Forced: When Corsair Captain engages you, it makes an immediate attack.”

name: Corsair of Umbar
text: If the active location is a Ship, Corsair of Umbar gets +2 Û and +2 Ú.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the active location is a Ship).

name: Umbar Pirate Crew
text: Cannot have attachments. Forced: When Umbar Pirate Crew engages you, exhaust a character you control.
shadow: Shadow: If the active location is a Ship, return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Haradrim Pirate
text: Forced: When Haradrim Pirate engages you, deal 1 damage to a character you control (2 damage instead if the active location is a Ship).
shadow: Shadow: Defending character gets -1 Ú for each damage on it.

name: Fell Folk of Umbar
text: When Revealed: Either return each Corsair enemy engaged with you to the staging area, or discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Corsair enemy is discarded and put that enemy into play engaged with you.

name: Black Sails
text: When Revealed: Each Ship location in the staging area gets +1 $. If there are no non-unique Ship locations in the staging area, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Ship location and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Raiding the Coasts
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either add 3 to the total $ in the staging area until the end of the phase, or discard the highest cost attachment you control.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, discard an attachment you control.

name: Driven to the Brink
text: When Revealed: Either immediately end the quest phase (without resolving the quest), or assign X damage among questing characters you control. X is the number of resources on The Corsair Fleet.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Minas Tirith
text: Gondor. City Minas Tirith has 30 hit points plus 10 for each player. Forced: At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to Minas Tirith for each enemy in the staging area. Then, if Minas Tirith has no hit points remaining, the players lose the game.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Grond
text: Immune to player card effects.  X is the number of resources here. Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, place 1 resource on Grond. Then, deal X damage to Minas Tirith. Travel: The Witch-king makes an immediate attack against each player, in turn order.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Gate of Gondor
text: Immune to player card effects.  While Gate of Gondor is the active location, each enemy in play gets -30 engagement cost. Forced: When Gate of Gondor is explored, return each engaged enemy to the staging area.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: City Wall
text: While City Wall is the active location, damage that would be placed on Minas Tirith must be placed here first. Forced: When City Wall has damage equal to its quest points, discard it. Then, each player raises his threat by 3.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Pelennor Field
text: While at least 1 enemy is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if it has the Harad trait).

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Fire-filled Trench
text: Forced: When a player plays an event that would cancel the effects of a treachery card just revealed from the encounter deck, cancel the effects of that event. Then, discard Fire-filled Trench.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Siege Tower
text: While Siege Tower is in the staging area, it gains Archery 3. Forced: After Siege Tower becomes the active location, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until an enemy is discarded. Add the discarded enemy to the staging area.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: The Black Serpent
text: Cannot have attachments or be attacked by more than 1 character at a time. When Revealed: The Black Serpent makes an immediate attack against the first player.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: War Mumak
text: Cannot have attachments or take more than 3 damage each round. Forced: When War Mumak is defeated, reduce each player’s threat by 4.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Southron Champion
text: Forced: After Southron Champion is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect, either deal 3 damage to Minas Tirith, or it makes an additional attack after this one.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to Minas Tirith.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Morgul Captain
text: When Revealed: Put the topmost Orc enemy in the discard pile into play engaged with you.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, return attacking enemy to the staging area.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Orc of the Eye
text: When Revealed: Either deal 2 damage to a hero you control, or deal 2 damage to Minas Tirith.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if it is an Orc).

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Mordor Orc
text: While Minas Tirith is in play, undefended damage dealt by Mordor Orc must be assigned to Minas Tirith.
shadow: Shadow: If Minas Tirith is in play, engage Mordor Orc and deal it a shadow card.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: The Rammas is Breached
text: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and puts it into play engaged with him.
shadow: Shadow: Either deal 3 damage to Minas Tirith, or attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Fell Beast
text: When Revealed: Attach to a Nazgul enemy. Limit 1 per enemy. (Counts as a Mount attachment with the text: “Attached enemy gets +1 $, +1 Û, +1 Ú and -10 engagement cost. Forced: At the end of the round, return attached enemy to the staging area.”)

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Black Dart
text: When Revealed: Remove a hero you control from the quest and attach Black Dark to that hero. Limit 1 per hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Forced: At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to attached hero.”)
shadow: Shadow: If this attack damages a hero, attach Black Dart to that hero.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Spells of Ruin
text: When Revealed: Either deal 1 damage to each exhausted character, or deal 5 damage to Minas Tirith.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, deal 2 damage to Minas Tirith.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Dread and Despair
text: When Revealed: Discard an ally you control. Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the total $ in the staging area for each ally in your discard pile.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Shadow of Mordor
text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a hero he controls. Until the end of the round, treat the printed text box of each damaged character as if it were blank, except for Traits.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Wraith on Wings
text: Setup: Add Wraith on Wings to the staging area. Cannot have non-Morgul attachments. Wraith on Wings gets +1 $ and -1 engagement cost for each resource on it. (Limit 5.) Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, place 1 resource on Wraith on Wings.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: The Forbidden Door
text: When Revealed: Each player may add 1 resource to the resource pool of each hero he controls. Each player who does so must raise his threat by 3. Forced: At the end of the planning phase, discard all cards in each player’s hand and advance to stage 2A.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: The Paths of the Dead
text: X is the threat of the player with the highest threat. Each player cannot reduce his threat below his initial threat level. Forced: At the beginning of the planning phase each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1, or you cannot play cards this phase.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: The Dead are Following
text: While Stone of Erech is the active location, each Oathbreaker enemy loses the Phantom keyword and gets -20 engagement cost. When The Stone of Erech leaves play as an explored location, the players win the game.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: The Passing of the Grey Company
traits: The Lord of the Rings Part 13
text: Resolution: Add each copy of Overcome by Fear attached to a player's threat dial to the campaign pool and record the name of each player it was attached to. If Army of the Dead is in the victory display, add the Army of the Dead boon to the campaign pool. The players have earned each card added to the campaign pool.
sideB: The Passing of the Grey Company

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: Army of the Dead
text: Immune to player card effects. X is twice the number of players in the game. Forced: When Army of the Dead attacks, you must either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or discard an ally you control.

name: Army of the Dead
text: Immune to player card effects. The first player gains control of Army of the Dead. If Army of the Dead leaves play, remove it from the game.

name: Attack on Pelargir
text: Each Ship location in the staging area is immune to player card effects. The players cannot defeat this stage while Great Corsair Ship is in play. When this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

name: The Siege of Gondor
traits: The Lord of the Rings Part 14
text: Resolution: Count the number of resources on The Corsair Fleet and record that number in the notes section of the quest log. Remove Army of the Dead from the campaign pool.

name: The Corsair Fleet
text: Forced: At the beginning of the staging step, place 1 resource on this objective. Then, each player must choose: either reveal an encounter card, or assign X damage among characters he controls. X is the number of resources on this objective. ...ships of great draught with many oars, and with black sails bellying in the breeze. -The Return of the King

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: The Corsair Fleet
text: Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, remove 1 resource from The Corsair Fleet. Then, if there are no resources here, the first player takes control of Aragorn and adds The Corsair Fleet to the victory display.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: The Garrison of Gondor
text: Skip the quest phase and combat phase. Forced: At the end of the planning phase, place 1 progress here.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Retreat from Osgiliath
text: X is the total cost of each ally in the staging area.  Allies in the staging area are treated as if their text box is blank, are immune to player card effects, and are under no player’s control. Forced: At the end of the round, assign damage among allies in the staging area equal to the number of enemies in the staging area.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: The White City Besieged
text: Assault.  The White City Besieged gets +4 quest points for each player.  The players cannot travel to Pelennor locations. Forced: When an enemy is destroyed, place progress on this stage equal to its total $ (progress must be placed on any active location first).

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Rohan has Come!
text: Progress that would be placed on this stage by questing successfully is instead assigned as damage among enemies in play. (Progress must be placed on the active location first.) Forced: At the end of the quest phase, advance to stage 5A.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: Fighting in the Fields
text: The Witch-king and encounter cards dealt to The Witch-king are immune to player card effects. Forced: When an enemy attacks and destroys a character, deal 1 damage to Minas Tirith. The players cannot defeat this stage unless Aragorn is in play and The Witch-king is in the victory display. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
traits: The Lord of the Rings Part 15
text:
Forced: When the players advance to stage 5B, add each set aside Harad enemy to the staging area.
Resolution: Add 1 copy, per player, of Wraith on Wings to the campaign pool. The players have earned those burdens. If Esquire of Gondor, or Esquire of Rohan, is attached to a hero, that hero's controller has earned that boon.
sideB: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: The Witch-king
text:
Only the engaged player can declare attackers against The Witch-king.

Forced: At the beginning of the envounter phase, The Witch-king engages the first player. Then, it makes an immediate attack.

encounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
name: The Passing of the Grey Company
text: Phantom: During the "determine combat damage" step of an attack made by an enemy with Phantom, if any damage would be dealt by the attack, it is cancelled and the defending player raises his threat by an equal amount instead.
sideB: The Passing of the Grey Company

encounterSet: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
name: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
text:
Assault: Progress cannot be placed on the quest stage by player card effects or by questing successfully. However, progress can still be placed on the active location as normal.
When the players quest unsuccessfully, each player does not raise his threat. Instead, the players must deal X damage to Minas Tirith. X is the amount by which the total threat in the staging area was greater than the total willpower of each character committed to the quest.
sideB: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

name: Tracked!
Nor
text: Action: Remove 1 resource token from Nor to give him a resource icon of your choice until the end of the phase.

name: Longbeard Cavern
text:
While Longbeard Cavern is the active location Dwarf allies cost 1 less resource to play.

While Longbeard Cavern is in play Nor gains 'Action: Exhaust Nor to add 2 resource tokens to his resource pool (Limit once per round)'

name: Treacherous Slope
text:
Action: If there are more than X enemies in play, exhaust a Hero to claim Treacherous Slope. X equals twice the number of players. Attach Treacherous Slope to that Hero.

Action: If claimed, place Treacherous Slope in the victory display to trigger an avalanche. Each player may reduce thier threat by 2 for each enemy engaged with them then discard all enemies from play.

name: The Mountain Pass
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card and add it to the staging area.

name: The Diversion
text:
When Revealed: Put Treacherous Slope into the staging area.

You cannot complete this stage of the quest until the Treacherous Slope is in your victory display.

name: The Rescue
text:
When revealed: Refresh all characters. Put the Greate Cave Troll and Longbeard Cavern into the staging area. The first player chooses a player, put Nor into play under control of that player.

Players cannot place progress tokens on this quest while Great Cave Troll is in play.

If players defeat this stage flip over all face down cards. Your allies return and the remaining Orcs flee, you have won the game.

name: Incatasi
text:
X equals the number of attachments in play.
Forced: If the first player controls 3 or more attachments Incatasi will always engage then irrespective of threat.
Forced: At the start of combat, the player engaged with Incatasi must discard an attachment on a character they control. If they can't they may not declare a defender for Incatasi this round.
Forced: During the refresh step return Incatasi to the staging area if the player engaged with Incatasi controls no attachments.

name: Anarchy
text:
X equals the number of heroes with a Ì resource icon

Travel: Each players must discard 1 character to travel here.

Forced: While this is the active location you may not activate action or response effects on Ì cards nor may you play Ì cards.

name: Foolishness
text:
X equals the number of heroes with a Ï resource icon

Travel: Deal 1 damage to each character to travel here.

Forced: While this is the active location you may not activate action or response effects on Ï cards nor may you play Ï cards.

name: Ignorance
text:
X equals the number of heroes with a Î resource icon

Travel: Each players must discard 3 cards to travel here.

Forced: While this is the active location you may not activate action or response effects on Î cards nor may you play Î cards.

name: Repose
text:
X equals the number of heroes with a Ê resource icon

Travel: The first player must exhaust a hero to travel here. Skip the refresh phase at the end of this round.

Forced: While this is the active location you may not activate action or response effects on Ê cards nor may you play Ê cards.

name: In One Day
text:
Forced: Progress tokens may not be placed on Enchanted Grove locations in the staging area nor may they be placed on this quest unless each player controls a hero with Athelas attached.
Forced: If a card targets Wilyador, the first player chooses a hero to be the target of that card instead.

You cannot complete this quest until you have 4 Enchanted Groves in your victory display. When you complete this quest you wake up and have won.

name: Barrow Wight
text: Forced: Characters with 1 Ò or less cannot attack River Wight.

name: Old Man Willow
text: Forced: If Old Man Willow is dealt a shadow card with no effect, defending player must choose and discard a character they control.

name: Barrow Blade
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective if it has no encounters attached. Then, attach Barrow Blade to that hero. (If detached return it to the staging area.)

Action: Exhaust Barrow Blade to give attached Hero +1 Ò or +1 Û or +1 Ú until the end of the round.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text:
When revealed: Place a resource token on this quest card to indicate that it is the active quest stage. When a quest stage is complete, players may move the resource token onto an adjacent quest card (not diagonally); it then becomes the active quest stage.

Forced: Quest cards remain in the 3x3 grid formation with side B face upwards once completed. The rules on all face up quest cards are considered active.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card they may also remove any number of damage tokens from thier characters. Then reveal 1 card from the encounterdeck per player and add to the staging area.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text:
When Revealed: Put Barrow Blade into the staging area.

Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card, remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text:
When revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Wargs and add it to the staging area if possible.

Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card, remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text:
Your way is blocked, you must head back and then find an alternative route.

Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card remove all progress tokens from it and then place the resource token on the quest stage they completed before this one.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text:
When revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a goblin sniper and put it in the staging area.

Forced: When the players place a resource token on this card, reveal 1 encounter card per player and add to the staging area.

Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text:
When revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a spider card and put it in the staging area. One of them must be Ungoliant Spawn.

Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text:
When revealed: If Old Man Willow is in the staging area it engages the first player, regardless of threat.

Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card, remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text:
Up ahead you see a hooded figure on a small boat, slowly punting towards the river bank where a crumbling barrow has collapsed into the water.

When revealed: Put River Wight into the staging area.
You cannot complete this stage of the quest while River Wight is in play.

When you complete this stage of the quest, you have won the game.

name: We've been here already
Dark Road
text: Each player must search the encounter deck and place the first location they find into the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Sacred Shrine
text: After defeating this stage, each player may choose to heal all wounds from all their heroes. If so, proceed to Stage 3. If all player choose not to heal, then proceed to Stage 4.

name: Besieged
text: Each player must search the encounter deck and place the first orc they find into the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. After defeating this stage, the players must decide if they want to try to free the prisoners. If so, proceed to Stage 5. Otherwise, proceed to Stage 6.

name: Take Flight
text: After defeating this stage, the players must decide if they want to try to free the prisoners. If so, proceed to Stage 5. If all players choose not to free the prisoners, proceed to Stage 6.

name: Liberation
text: Players cannot defeat this stge without at least one Clue, or whilst any Dungeon Jailor cards are in play. After defeating this stage, as a response each player may place one ally or attachment into play from his hand for free. Proceed to Stage 7.

name: Abandoned
text: For every 2 players in the game, place one Dungeon Jailor into the staging area. Players cannot defeat this stage without at least one Clue, or whilst any Dungeon Jailor cards are in play. Proceed to Stage 7.

name: Showdown
text: Place the Nazgul of Dol Guldur into the staging area. players cannot defeat this stage without at least one Clue, or whilst any nazgul cards are in play.

name: Ancient Path
text: When 9 Progress tokens have been placed on this card, put Ungoliant's Spawn into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst Ungoliant's Spawn is in play.

name: Deep Catacombs
text: Players cannot place Progress tokens on this stage unless a Hero controls the Shadow Key

name: Risen Nightmare
text: When 6 Progres token have been placed on this card, put the Nazgul of Dol Guldur into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst the Nazgul of Dol Guldur is in play.

name: Goblin Gate
text: Each player immediately chooses and engages 1 Orc. Players cannot defeat this stage while any Orc cards in play.

name: Elf Path
text: Do not make any more engagement chechs whilst on this stage. Enemies already engaged with you remain engaged. You are niether allowed to engage nor be engaged by enemies unless you are already engaged with them.

name: The Veil of the Lonely Mountain
text: Each player may immediately place 1 Elf from their hand into play for free and any Elf character may also heal 1 Wound. Each player immediately chooses and engages 1 Orc. Players cannot defeat this stage while any Orc cards are in play.
sideB: The Veil of the Lonely Mountain

name: Forgotten Path
text: You only need to carry out the staging element of the Quest Phase every other turn after your first turn, for this stage only.

name: Tranquil Glade
text: You may place Legolas into play on your side. For this Adventure only, any resources he generates are treated as the same as your current sphere.

name: Goblin Mines
text: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc card and place it into the staging area. You may not defeat this stage whilst this Orc is in play.

name: Orc War Party
text: Each player searches the encounter deck for 1 Orc and places it into the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Players cannot defeat this stage while any Orc cards in play.

name: Dark Woods
text: Place Chieftan Ufthak into the staging area. Players cannot defeat this stage while Chieftan Ufthak is in play.

name: Daring Rescue
text: The 1st player may immediately place 1 Ally from their hand into play. Place the Hill Troll you put to one side into the staging area. Players cannot defeat this stage while are Hill Troll cards are in play.

name: Foul Tower
text: Whe 5 Progress tokens have been placed on this card, put Ungoliant's Spawn into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst Ungoliant's Spawn is in play. If Ungoliant's Spawn is defeated, place it to one side out of play.

name: Twisted Caverns
text: When 5 Progress tokens have been placed on this card, put Ungoliant's Spawn into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst Ungoliant's Spawn is in play. If Ungoliant's Spawn is defeated, place it to one side out of play.

name: Final Stand
text: When 5 Progress tokens have been placed on this card, put Ungoliant's Spawn into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst Ungoliant's Spawn is in play. If Ungoliant's Spawn is defeated, shuffle it back into the encounter deck.

encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
name: Sauron
keywords: Immune to player card effects. Cannot take damage.
text: Sauron cannot leave the staging area, and is considered to be engaged with each player. Forced: After Sauron attacks, the defending player must discard 2 characters if possible.

encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
name: Elven Alliance
text: When revealed: The first player attaches this card to a hero of his choice as an attachment. Action: If another player controls Narsil, exhaust Elven Alliance to attach Narsil to one of your Gondor heroes.

encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
name: Human Alliance
text: When revealed: The first player attaches this card to a hero of his choice as an attachment. Attached hero gains Gondor trait.

encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
name: Narsil
keywords: Narsil can only be attached to a Gondor hero.
text: Action: Discard X cards from hand to reduce Sauron’s Ú by X until the end of the phase. Action: If the players control Elven Alliance and Human Alliance add Narsil to the victory display to place 1 resource token on Sauron.

encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
name: Preparing for Battle
text: When revealed: Each player may put an additional Noldor hero into play from his collection, who must match spheres with a hero he already controls. (The threat cost of the additional hero does not add to the starting threat level of his controller?. Forced: Skip the quest phase. At the end of the round, advance to stage 2.

encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
name: Combat
text: Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, each player discards X cards from the encounter deck. Each enemy discarded engages the player that discarded it. Each objective discarded is considered revealed from encounter deck. X is equal to the current round number divided by two (rounding down).

encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
name: Terrible and Unstoppable
text: Progress tokens cannot be placed on this quest. Forced: If the total Û of an attack against Sauron is higher than his Ú, place 1 resource token on Sauron. If the attacking player does not control Narsil, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card has a shadow effect, do not place the resource token on Sauron. If Sauron has X or more resource tokens on him, he is defeated and the players win the game. X is the number of players multiplied by 2.

encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
name: Orc Forest Camp
text:
X is the number of resource tokens on this card.

Forced: At the beginning of the travel phase place a resource token on this card if there is an objective card in the staging area. If there are 5 resource tokens on this card, the players lose the game.

encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
name: Elrond's Message
keywords: Restricted. Guarded 2 (attach the top 2 encounter cards instead of 1)
text: Action: Claim Elrond's Message if it free of encounters. When claimed, attach Elrond's Message to a hero you control. (Counts as an attachment. If attached Hero takes damage or Elrond's message becomes detached, return Elrond's Message to the top of the Encounter Deck.)

encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
name: Robbed
text:
When revealed: Select 1 hero, who receives 2 damage.

Players cannot advance to the next stage of the quest unless they have Elrond's Message in their possession.

encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
name: Hide and Seek
text: Forced: If the players are not successful in the quest phase, every hero takes 1 damage and 1 progress token will be removed from the current quest card. Orcs remain in the staging area during the encounter phase unless they guard Elrond's Message. Players cannot advance to the next stage of the quest unless they have Elrond's Message in their possession.

encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
name: Uninvited Guests
text: Forced: At the beginning of each quest phase, as long as Ungliant's Spawn is in play, each player places the top card of his deck face-down in the staging area. These cards represent Ungoliant's Net and have 1 Ò and 1 Quest Point. These cards count as locations. Players cannot defeat this stage while Ungoliant Spawn is in play. If this stage is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: Trouble with Trolls
text:
Response: After a unqiue Troll enemy (Bert, Tom, William) is defeated or after a Troll Camp leaves play as an explored location, the first player chooses and discards a Sack card from play.

Forced: At the start of the refresh phase, remove all Troll enemies from the discard pile and add them to the staging area.

The players win if there at least 5 Troll enemies in the victory display and there are no Troll enemies in play

name: Abominable Goblin
text: Forced: If a shadow card with shadow effect has not been dealt to the first attacking Orc enemy engaged with a player during combat phase, deal that enemy an aditional shadow card until dealing him a shadow card with an effect.

name: Atrocious Beast
keywords: Surge. Immune to player card effects.
shadow: Shadow: Deal X shadow cards to this attacker. X is the number of Dark Forest locations in play.

name: Dark Wolves
text: If Dark Wolves is dealt a shadow card with effect, deal Dark Wolves an additional shadow card.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Deal it another shadow card.

name: Dol Guldur Explorers
text: While there is an Orc enemy engaged with a player, event cards cost 1 additional matching resource to play from that player's hand.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.

name: Hunter
text: If there is an Orc enemy in the staging area, Hunter gets +2 Û and +2 Ú.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.

name: Marauder of the Hills
keywords: Archery X. X is the number of allies in play.
text: Forced: Ir Marauder of the Hills damages a character, that character's controller must choose and discard an attachment he controls.

name: Orc Patrol
text: When revealed: Return each engaged Orc enemy in play to the staging area. Orc Patrol cannot leave the game while there is other Orc enemy in play that is not another copy of Orc Patrol.

name: Ranger Attacker
keywords: Archery X. X is the number of Orc enemies in the staging are.

text: X is the number of players in the game. While there is a Mountain or Wasteland location in the staging area, Rock Mercenaries cannot engage or be engaged.

text: While Seekers of Prey is in the staging area, each Wild enemy gets +1 Û, +1 Ú and +1 Ò

shadow: Shadow: After this attack resolves, attacking enemy engages the next player, if able.

text: Response: After traveling to Abrupt Undergrowth, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

name: Beorning Stream
keywords: Hunt X. X is the number the first player decides.
text: Response: After traveling to Beorning Stream, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

text: Response: After traveling to Cache, the first player may choose up 2 Creature enemies in play. Discard the chosen enemies.

shadow: Shadow: Defending player must discard 1 ally card from his hand, if able.

text: Response: After traveling to East Path, the first player may choose a location from the staging area and discard it, or add 1 resource to each of his heroes' resource pool.

text: Response: After traveling to Inhospitable Places, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Orc Camp

name: Orc Camping
text: When Revealed: Each player removes 1 resource from one of his hero's resource pools, if able.

name: South Settling
text: When Revealed: Discard all allies in play. This effect cannot be canceled.

text: Each Orc enemy gains Archery 1. Forced: After traveling to South Wilderlands, discard the top card of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.

name: The Gorge
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, discard the top card of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to a character controlled by the defending player.

name: The Thicket
keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
text: When Revealed: Each Dark Forest location in the staging area gets +1 $ until the end of the phase.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending player.

name: Archaic Find
text: When Revealed: Attach this card to the hero with the most progress tokens. Search the encounter deck and encounter discard pile for all copies of Archaic Find, and remove them from the game. Then shuffle the encounter deck. This effect cannot be canceled. Response: After a hero is damaged, cancel the damage and remove all progress tokens from attached hero. Limit once per game.

name: The Trial of the Dark Forest
text: After an Orc enemy is destroyed by an attack, place 1 progress token on any 1 character that participated in that attack. Forced: At the end of the round, each player discards from play all allies he controls. If one hero leaves play, the players have lost the game. If each hero in play has 2 or more progress tokens on him and the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.
sideB: The Trial of the Dark Forest

name: Clarion Call
text: When Revealed: At the beginning of the next encounter phase, discard a card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add it to the staging area until there is X enemies in play. X is double or more of the number of players in game. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Confusing Guidance
text: When Revealed: Attach this card to any hero with the Ranged keyword without a copy of Confusing Guidance attached. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'The attached hero cannot attack enemies engaged with other players'. If Confusing Guidance has not been attached to any hero, it gains Surge.

name: Night Looms
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, players cannot declare more than 1 attacker agains one target enemy.
shadow: Shadow: Attacker enemy cannot be declared as target of any attack until the end of the phase.

name: Remain Hidden
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Camp location is discarded. Reveal and add the Camp location to the staging area. After reveal 1 card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Rising Storm
text: When Revealed: Each player must remove 2 progress tokens from 1 hero he controls or exhaust 1 hero he controls. Then, remove 1 progress token from the quest card for each exhausted hero in play.
shadow: Shadow: Remove 1 progress token of any hero the defending player controls.

name: Terrifying Loneliness
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 1 attachment he controls and remove 1 progress token from any hero he controls, if able.

name: Unwelcome Allies
text: When Revealed: Return all Wild enemies in play to the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, then shuffle the Orcs of Dark Forest deck. Then, discard X cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. X is the number of enemies moved by this effect. Any player may remove 1 progress token from one hero he controls to reduce the X number by 1.

name: Rules Card
text: Risk X Keyword. When a location with the risk keyword is in play at the end of the combat phase, discard cards from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck equal to the specified value. If the total of the discarded card’s Û is higher than the total of all ready characters’ Ò in play, the discarded cards engage the first player. If there are any risk locations in play, only the risk keyword with the highest value is considered to be active.

Haleth gets +1 Ò for each enemy engaged with you.

text: Action: Each character with an attached Oath gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú until the end of the round.

If the attached hero leaves play, the players have lost the game.

If there are 0 victory points in the victory display, add Not So High Is Your Destiny to the campaign pool. If there are 1 or 2 victory points in the victory display, add For Good or For Ill to the campaign pool. Victory points from player cards do not count for this purpose.

name: Preparing for Battle
text: When Revealed: Set the Unscathed, Deeds of Daring, and Mighty in Arms objectives aside, out of play. Set Azrat, Weapon of Morgoth, and all copies of Orc Raiding Party aside, out of play. Each player searches the top 10 cards of his deck for an attachment and places it faceup, if able. The first player chooses one faceup attachment and attaches it to an eligible hero. Shuffle all other faceup attachments back into their respective decks. Then, advance to a random stage 2A.

While there is at least 1 enemy in play, the players cannot defeat this stage. When the players defeat this stage, remove it from play and advance to a random stage 2A. If only one stage 2 quest remains, advance to stage 3A, instead.

encounterSet: Custom Set - Making of a Fellowship
name: Making of a Fellowship
text:
Swarm: The swarm trait is new to Making of a Fellowship. When an enemy with the Swarm trait engages a player that already is engaged with an enemy with the Swarm trait the two enemies combine into one larger foe. 
Stack the cards atop one another and add the new cards $, Û, Ú, and hit points together with any other cards in the  Swarm. The end result is one larger foe that has combined stats as well as actions and abilites. 
It is treated as one foe for all other purposes and card effects until after it is placed in the discard pile.

 Set Up and Celemir: During the set up stage players are instructed to place Celemir in the staging area engaged with the Neeker Breeker Swarm. Both cards are considered in the staging area and contribute $ during the quest phase. When the combat phase takes place players deal the Swarm one Shadow card and the Swarm attacks Celemir, and Celemir defends against it. Any Shadow effect that targets a player does not resolve and is discarded from play without effect. Shadow cards that affect the attacker or defender are still resolved. Beware the Swarm may eventually get strong enough to kill Celemir and then the players will lose the game.

name: Blood in Breeland
text: New Staging Rules: When playing the scenario, players reveal encounter cards individually in player order during the Staging step of the Quest phase. Beginning with the first player, each player reveals 1 encounter card and resolves its staging before the next player reveals a card. If an encounter card has an effect that uses the word “you” then the encounter card is referring to the player who revealed the card. If the revealed encounter has the Surge keyword, the player who revealed that card reveals an additional encounter card. Encounter cards with the Doomed X keyword still affecteach player. Burning X: Burning X is a new keyword used in Blood in Breland. When a card with Burning X is revealed from the encounter deck the player that revealed it must choose to either remove progress from the quest stage (but not the active location) or do damage to characters he controls equal to X. If there are no progress tokens on the quest stage the player must do damage to characters he controls instead. Peril: Peril is a new keyword found in The Lord of the Rings Saga Expansion and used here. When a player reveals an encounter card with the Peril keyword, he must resolve the staging of that card on his own without conferring with the other players. The other players cannot take any actions or trigger any responses during the resolution of that card's staging.

text:

name: Ancient Ruins
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location remove the top card from the Stolen Goods Deck from the game. Place 3 time counters on this location.

name: Hidden Camp

name: Defensible Position

shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gains +2 Û (+3 Û if the active location is a Road.)

name: Hunting the Bandits
text:
Battle. (Characters use Û instead of Ò when questing here.) Bandit enemies are dealt an additional Shadow Card.

When this stage is defeated choose another random stage 2A quest. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, or if Breaking the Bandits' Back has 10 or more resource tokens on it, advance to stage 3A instead.

Players cannot defeat this stage if any Bandits are engaged with players.

name: Hunting the Bandits
text:
Allies committed to this quest have -1 Ò during the Quest Phase. Players may not commit more than 1 hero each to the Quest Phase.

When this stage is defeated choose another random stage 2A quest. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, or if Breaking the Bandits' Back has 10 or more resource tokens on it, advance to stage 3A instead.

name: Hunting the Bandits
text:
Progress cannot be placed on the quest except through Quest effects.

Forced: After questing successfully the first player must spend X resources, where X is the number of players in the game, to add 1 progress to the quest. (Limit once per turn).

When this stage is defeated choose another random stage 2A quest. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, or if Beaking the Bandits' Back has 10 or more resource tokens on it, advance to stage 3A instead.

Players cannot defeat this stage if any Captains or Refuges are in play.

name: Hunting the Bandits
text:
Siege (Characters use Ú instead of Ò when questing.) Enemies do not make engagement checks during this stage.

Archery X. X is the number of enemies in the staging area.

When this stage is defeated choose another random stage 2A quest. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, or if Beaking the Bandits' Back has 10 or more resource tokens on it, advance to stage 3A instead.

name: Showdown
text:
Players cannot defeat this stage while the White Hand Captain and the Midgewater are in play.

If the players defeat this stage they have won the game.
