name: Tense Bargains
Fellowship With The Outlaws
text:
Forced: After the 3rd Dilemma objective is added to the victory display, advance to stage 2A and remove Fellowship With The Outlaws from the game.

Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, reveal the top card of the dilemma deck.

If there are 7 cards in the dilemma deck discard pile, the players lose the game.

name: Forweg
text:
Allies cannot attack or defend against Forweg.

Forced: After Forweg makes his first attack each round, he engages the next player and makes an immediate attack (discard and deal a new shadow card for this attack).

name: Androg
text: Androg gets +1 Û for each hero you control with at least 1 Corruption.

name: Larnach's Daughter
text: When Revealed: Forweg declares an attack on Larnach's Daughter. The first player may declare an eligible defender against this attack. If no character is destroyed by this attack, add Larnach's Daughter to the victory display. If no defender is declared, each player deals 3 Corruption among characters he controls.

name: Cull the Weak
text: When Revealed: Either each player must discard the character he controls with the fewest hit points to remove all damage from one character he controls, or add Cull the Weak to the victory display and each player must deal 3 damage to a hero he controls.

name: Punish The Trespassers
text: When Revealed: Either each player must exhaust a character he controls to discard a Woodmen enemy from play, or add Punish The Trespassers to the victory display and each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Woodmen enemy and put it into play engaged with him. One of these must be Hound of the Woodmen, if able.

name: Raid The Homestead
text: When Revealed: Either each player deals X Corruption to a hero he controls to add X resources to that hero's resource pool, or add Raid The Homestead to the victory display and discard all resources from play (any hero that does not discard a resource takes 2 damage).

name: Turn A Blind Eye
text: When Revealed: Either each player must deal 1 Corruption to a hero he controls to reduce his threat by 3, or add Turn A Blind Eye to the victory display and exhaust all heroes in play.

name: Teiglin Hunter
text: While Teiglin Hunter is engaged with a player, all enemies engaged with that player get +1 Û.
shadow: Shadow: All enemies engaged with the defending player get +1 Û until the end of the phase.

name: Hound of the Woodmen
text: Forced: At the start of the encounter phase, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area. This ability does not stack with other copies of Hound of the Woodmen.

name: Homestead Defender
text: While Homestead Defender is engaged with a player, Woodmen enemies engaged with that player not named Homestead Defender cannot be attacked by non-objective characters.
shadow: Shadow: All enemies engaged with the defending player get +2 Ú until the end of the phase.

name: Desperate Outlaw
text: Forced: After an attack against Desperate Outlaw resolves, Desperate Outlaw makes an immediate attack against the defending player.
shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Cruel Robber
text: Forced: After Cruel Robber attacks, discard 1 attachment the defending player controls.
shadow: Shadow: Discard 1 attachment from the defending character.

name: Driven Outcast
text: Forced: After Driven Outcast attacks, deal 1 damage to the defending character.
shadow: Shadow: After this attack resolves, deal 1 damage to the defending character.

name: Forest Clearing
text:
(Stage 1B) Response: After Forest Clearing is explored, reduce each player's threat by 2.

While Forest Clearing is in play, the first Gaurwaith enemy revealed each round gains surge.

name: Scattered Homestead
text: While Scattered Homestead is in the staging area, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck at the end of the round until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area.

name: Tilled Field
text:
(Stage 1B) Response: After Tilled Field is explored, add 1 resource to each hero's resource pool.

(Stage 2B) When Revealed: Each player must exhaust a hero he controls.

name: Hedge and Stockade
text:
(Stage 1B): While Hedge and Stockade is the active location, all Woodmen enemies get +2 Ú and 0 engagement cost.

(Stage 2B): While Hedge and Stockade is the active location, all Gaurwaith enemies get -1 Û and 0 engagement cost.

name: Woods of Teiglin
text:
(Stage 1B) Response: After Woods of Teiglin is explored, each player draws 1 card.

(Stage 2B): While Woods of Teiglin is in the staging area, all Gaurwaith enemies get +1 $, +1 Û, and +1 Ú.

name: Dogs and Fences
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either deal X damage among heroes he controls, where X is equal to the number of engaged Woodmen enemies plus 2, or treat the printed text box of each non-objective character he controls as if it were blank, except for keywords and Traits, until the end of the round.

name: Horn-calls
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Woodmen enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Then, each engaged Woodmen enemy makes an immediate attack.

name: No Law But Their Needs
text: When Revealed: Either Either each player must immediately exhaust and commit 1 hero to the quest, or raise each player's threat by 4.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy. If that enemy is destroyed, deal 1 Corruption to the defending character.

name: Wolf-men of the Winter
text: When Revealed: Each player engaged with a Gaurwaith enemy must discard all resources he controls. If a player did not discard at least 3 resources, deal 1 damage to each character he controls.
shadow: Shadow: The defending player must pay 1 resource or the attacking enemy gets +3 Û.

name: Banded Attack
text: When Revealed: Each player deals X damage among characters he controls,  where X is the number of Gaurwaith enemies engaged with that player.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1Û for each enemy engaged with the defending player.

name: Blood Upon the Grass
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either raise his threat by 1 for each Corruption on characters he controls, or choose one character with at least 1 Corruption. That character is immediately corrupted.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust all characters the defending player controls with at least 1 Corruption.

name: Cruel of Heart
text: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with Curse of Morgoth attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After an ally enters play, exhaust attached hero to deal 1 damage to that ally.")

name: Bitterness of Exile
text: When Revealed: Remove each character with at least 1 Corruption from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy or location, add it to the staging area.

name: Craft In Wood And Field
text:
Attach to the hero with Curse of Morgoth attached.

Response: After the players travel to a location, choose a player and exhaust attached hero to reduce that player's threat by the $ of the active location.

name: Hardship of the Wild
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero.

Attached hero gets +1 Ú and +1 hit point.

Response: Add Hardship of the Wild to the victory display, and remove it from the campaign pool, to cancel 2 points of damage just dealt to attached hero.

name: An Evil and Dangerous Way
text:
Forced: The players must travel to a location during the travel phase, if able.

Forced: After the active location is explored, deal X Corruption among characters the first player controls. X is the $ of that location.

Forced: After a Woodmen enemy is destroyed, add 1 progress to Fellowship Among the Outlaws and 1 Corruption to each character that participated in the attack. (If Forweg or Androg participated in the attack, deal 1 Corruption to each hero controlled by the engaged player.)

name: To Govern this Fellowship
text:
Gaurwaith enemies may be attacked with Ò instead of Û. If an enemy would be damaged this way, place progress tokens on it instead of damage tokens. When an enemy has progress equal to its hit points, add it to the victory display and place those progress tokens on the quest.

When Revealed: Place 5 progress tokens on this quest stage for each card in the discard pile of the dilemma deck.

The players cannot defeat this stage while Forweg is in play. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Among The Outlaws
text: Resolution: Add Bitterness of Exile to the campaign pool. If there is at least 1 card in the dilemma deck discard pile, add Cruel of Heart to the campaign pool. These burdens have been earned by the players. Each player may attach a copy of Hardship of the Wild to a hero he controls. If there are no cards in the dilemma deck discard pile, add Craft In Wood And Field to the campaign pool. These boons have been earned by the players.

name: Bór the Faithful
text: Action: Discard 1 Corruption from Bór the Faithful to ready him. He gets +2 Û and +1 Ò until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: Elder of the Realm
text: Response: After a treachery card is revealed, discard a card from hand (spend 1 Î to discard the top card of your deck instead). If the first letter of the treachery card's title matches that of the discarded card, cancel the "when revealed" effects of the revealed card. (Limit once per game.)

name: Brethil Hound
text: Response: After Brethil Hound participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Algund
text: Response: When the discard pile is shuffled back into the encounter deck, deal X Corruption to Algund to choose X cards in the discard pile. These cards are not shuffled back into the encounter deck.

name: Fostered Son
text: Action: Discard Fostered Son to reduce the cost of the next unique Edain character you play this phase by 2.

name: Wolf-man
text: Action: Exhaust Wolf-man to immediately declare him as an attacker (and resolve his attack) against an engaged enemy with one hit point remaining.

name: Neithan
text:
Attach to Túrin Turambar. Limit 1 Name in play.

Resources on Neithan can be discarded to satisfy the ransom keyword.

Response: When an enemy with the ransom keyword is defeated, add 2 resources to Neithan.

name: Forge of Belegost
text:
Attach to a Dwarf character.

Action: Exhaust Forge of Belegost and attached character to heal X damage on a character. X is the number of Item attachments on that character.

name: Angrist
text:
Attach to a Dwarf character.

Action: Exhaust Forge of Belegost and attached character to heal X damage on a character. X is the number of Item attachments on that character.

name: None Shall Break
text: Action: Ready each character with an Oath attached. (Lower the cost of None Shall Break by 2 if each character that readies takes 1 Corruption.)

name: Song of Parting
text: Response: After an encounter card with at least 3 $ is revealed from the encounter deck, choose and ready a character. That character gets +2 Ò, +2 Û, and +2 Ú until the end of the round.

name: The Siege of Erebor
text:
N is the number of players in the game.

If a quest stage has N+6 damage on it, add it to the victory display.

Forced: Instead of the staging step, Invade N+1.

Forced: At the end of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to each quest stage for each enemy in its staging area.

name: The Eastern Defenses
text:
When Revealed: Turn each other quest stage to side B after resolving the When Revealed effects on side A. Then, Invade N.

Response: After questing successfully at this stage, remove 2 damage tokens from The Eastern Defenses.
Forced: After The Eastern Defenses is added to the victory display, Invade 2.

name: The Riverlands
text:
Characters at this stage get +1 Ò.

Response: After questing successfully at this stage, remove 1 damage token from any quest stage in play.
Forced: After The Riverlands is added to the victory display, each player in the game discards the highest cost ally he controls.

name: Dale
text:
Battle.

Characters at this stage get +1 Û.

Response: After questing successfully at this stage, deal 4 damage to an enemy at this stage.
Forced: After Dale is added to the victory display, each player in the game discards a hero he controls.

name: Erebor
text:
Siege.

Characters at this stage get +1 Ú.

Response: After questing successfully at this stage, add Gate of Erebor to the staging area.
Forced: After Erebor is added to the victory display, the players lose the game.

name: Hold the North
text:
Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 progress token here. Then, if The Eastern Defenses is in play, deal X damage to it, where X is the number of progress tokens on Hold The North. If The Eastern Defenses is not in play, deal 2 damage to the eastmost quest stage in play instead.

At the beginning of the round, if there are at least 8 progress tokens here and no enemies in play at any stage, the players win the game.

name: Gate of Erebor
text:
Heroes at this stage cannot be healed by player card effects or leave a player's discard pile. 

Response: When X damage would be dealt to Erebor, deal X damage to a hero you control instead. Any player at this stage may trigger this response.

name: Iron Hills Battalion
text:
Iron Hills Battalion is immune to player card effects and remains in the staging area under control of the first player.

Action: Exhaust Iron Hills Battalion to (choose 1): Reduce the next amount of damage dealt to the quest stage this phase by 1, place 2 progress on a location at this stage, or move Iron Hills Battalion east or west.

name: Easterling Supply Camp
text:
Forced: At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to the Eastern Defenses.

Response: After Easterling Supply Camp leaves play as an explored location, heal 2 damage from The Eastern Defenses.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the eastmost quest stage.

name: The Running River
text: When Revealed: Either deal 1 damage to The Riverlands or The Running River gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to The Riverlands, if able.

name: Eaves of Mirkwood
text:
Travel: Deal 2 damage among quest stages in play.

Forced: If Eaves of Mirkwood leaves play from the staging area, deal 2 damage among quest stages in play.
shadow: Shadow: Either deal 1 damage to the quest or the attacking enemy makes an additional attack.

name: The Desolation of Smaug
text: Forced: After another location enters the staging area, deal 1 damage to The Riverlands. A player at this stage may discard an ally to cancel this effect.

name: Esgaroth
text: While Esgaroth is the active location, it gains: "The Riverlands cannot take damage. Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, discard Esgaroth from play."

name: City Gates
text: Response: After City Gates leaves play as an explored location, a player at this stage may spend 1 resource to place 1 resource token on Dale. The next time Dale would take damage, remove that resource token to decrease the damage dealt to Dale by 1.

name: City Streets
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to Dale.
shadow: Shadow: Defending character uses their Û instead of their Ú for this attack.

name: City Walls
text: Forced: After Dale takes any amount of damage, deal 1 damage to City Walls as well. Then, if City Walls has 3 damage on it, discard it from play and deal 1 damage to Dale.
shadow: Shadow: Either Deal 1 damage to the quest or the attacking enemy gets +2 Û.

name: Ravenhill
text: While Ravenhill is the active location it gains: "Response: After Ravenhill leaves play as an explored location, add it to the victory display to remove 1 damage from each quest stage in play."
shadow: Shadow: Heal 1 damage from a quest stage in play.

name: Treasure Hoard
text: While Treasure Hoard is the active location, it gains: "Response: When Treasure Hoard leaves play as an explored location, add it to the victory display to add 1 resource to the resource pool of each hero at this stage."

name: Lonely Mountain Armoury
text: While Lonely Mountain Armoury is the active location, it gains: "Response: When Lonely Mountain Armoury leaves play as an explored location, add it to the victory display. Then, each player at this stage may put into play an attachment from his hand."
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: Rhûn Vanguard
text: While in the staging area, Rhûn Vanguard gains: "Forced: After an enemy with a name other than Rhûn Vanguard enters this staging area, Rhûn Vanguard moves west."
shadow: Shadow: If there is no enemy in the staging area, add Rhûn Vanguard to the staging area.

name: Wainriders
text:
Forced: After Wainriders enters a staging area, deal 1 damage to the quest stage.

Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, if Wainriders is in the staging area, it moves west.

name: Rhûn Rearguard
text: X is the stage number of the quest.
shadow: Shadow: If there are no enemies in the eastmost staging area, add Rhûn Rearguard to that staging area.

name: War Machine
text:
When Revealed: Add to staging area 4B or 5B.

Damage dealt by War Machine beyond the remaining hit points of the character damaged by its attack must be assigned to the quest stage.

name: Balchoth Avenger
text: Forced: After Balchoth Avenger attacks and damages a character, it either makes an additional attack or moves west, if able (defending player chooses).
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to the quest stage, or this attack is considered undefended.

name: Easterling Archer
text: X is twice the number of players at this stage.

name: The North Burns
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each quest stage in play. Then, deal X damage among quest stages in play, where X is the number of quest stages in the victory display. This effect cannot be cancelled.

name: Whips of Sauron
text: When Revealed: Starting with the westmost quest stage, the enemy in each staging area with the lowest engagement cost moves west, if able. If no enemies were moved by this effect, Whips of Sauron gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Invade 1.

name: Fight or Flight
text: When Revealed: Each player in the game chooses: Either deal 1 damage to each exhausted character you control, or deal 1 damage to your current quest stage.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to a quest stage in play.

name: Focused Assault
text: When Revealed: Attach Focused Assault to a quest stage in play. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: at the end of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to the attached quest."
shadow: Shadow: Resolve the "When Revealed" effect on Focused Assault.

name: Flanked!
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to staging area 4B or 5B.

name: News from the South
text: When Revealed: If Erebor is the only quest stage in play, all enemies in play gets -1 Û and -1 Ú until the end of the round. Otherwise, Invade 2.

name: Rules 1 of 5
text:
In The Siege of Erebor, multiple staging areas are in play at the same time, with a quest stage assigned to each. Player card effects at one stage cannot affect any other stage. When paying or or resolving text on a player card, consider only players at your quest stage as part of the game.

At the beginning of the round, each player, starting with the first, chooses a quest stage to be that player's main quest until the end of the round. Multiple players may choose the same quest stage. If a player chooses a stage that is different from his choice in the previous round, return all enemies engaged with him (starting with the enemy with the lowest threat) to his previous stage's staging area.

Any encounter card effect that mentions the "quest stage" refers to the encounter quest card at that stage (2B, 3B, 4B, or 5B). Player side quests are played to the player's current staging area, and can still be chosen as the active quest by the first player in turn order at that stage during the quest phase.

name: Rules 2 of 5
text:
At the beginning of the game, the quest stages form a line starting at 2B, The Eastern Defences, on the right (east), and ending at 5B, Erebor, on the left (west). The term "eastmost quest stage" thus refers to the quest stage furthest to the right that is still in play. Each phase of the game is resolved simultaneously, starting with the eastmost quest stage (i.e. 2B fully resolves the combat phase, then 3B, the 4B, then 5B, then 2B resolves the refresh phase, etc.). Within each stage, the phases are resolved in ascending player order.

The Moves West (East) keyword represents cards moving from one stage to another. If a card Moves West (East), it is moved to the nearest staging area that is still in play to the left (right) of its current location, towards (away from) Erebor. Cards at the leftmost (rightmost) stage area are immune to Moves West (East).

name: Rules 3 of 5
text:
During the staging step, players will not reveal cards from the encounter deck in the normal way. Instead, the first player triggers Invade X, where X is the number of players in the game plus 1.

The invade keyword represents the invading forces coming from the east. When the Invade X keyword is triggered, reveal X cards from the encounter deck, one at a time. Any player at any stage can trigger responses (such as Test of Will (CORE 50) or Thalin (CORE 6)) to cards revealed by the Invade keyword. After resolving any "When Revealed" effects on an encounter card, it is placed in an area depending on its card type: Treacheries are placed in the discard pile, enemies are placed in the eastmost staging area, and locations are placed in the staging area indicated in the bottom-right corner of the card. If the the location's staging area is not in play, discard the location without resolving its "When Revealed" effects, and instead deal 2 damage to the eastmost quest stage in play.

name: Rules 4 of 5
keywords: Adding a Quest Stage to the Victory Display
text:
When a quest stage is added to the victory display:
1) From lowest to highest engagement cost, each enemy in that stage's staging area moves west.
2) Discard each location at that quest stage from play. Then, raise the threat of each player in the game by the number of locations discarded.
3) Remove any other cards at that stage (such as objective allies or side quests) from the game. The staging area at that stage is no longer in play.
4) Each player at that stage immediately changes their main quest to the nearest quest stage to the west. Enemies engaged with a player remain engaged with that player (in contrast to changing quest stages at the beginning of the round).
5) Trigger the Forced effect on the quest stage that left play.
6) Play resumes.

name: Rules 5 of 5
text:
Player side quests are played to the player's current staging area, and can still be chosen as the active quest by the first player in turn order at that stage during the quest phase.

The term "quest stage" refers only to the encounter quest cards 2B, 3B, 4B, or 5B, and does not refer to side quests.

There can be an active location at each quest stage, but in order to travel to a location a player must be at that quest stage during the travel phase.
